loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 49 years old and has eight children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Teresita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Teresita has been raising pigs for 20 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sotera

texts.en:
Sotera is 54 years old and lives in D'BAN, Calamba. She is married with 4 children. 

To earn a living, Sotera has a business selling barbecue. She earns about PHP 1800 each month doing this type of work. Sotera has a requested a loan to purchase ingredients needed to make barbecue.

Sotera has been a member of PMPC for 10 years.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make Barbecue.

loans.name: Arcadio

texts.es: Arcadio, un humilde campesino  de  42 años de edad, originario de la Comarca llamada Cacao, en las afueras de Teustepe, casado, padre de 2 hijos entre las edades de 8 y 15 años, actualmente los 2 están  estudiando, de oficio agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de maíz, frijoles  y tomate desde hace 15 años. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio  desde muy joven trabajando con su mama en la siembra. Hoy tiene  sus vaquitas y sus tierras donde trabaja las que ha ido comprando con las ganancias de sus cosechas, para realizar sus trabajos siempre paga mozo la cosecha siempre la lleva a vender a Managua donde pagan mejor el grano. En esta ocasión  Arcadio solicita este crédito para comprar dos vacas. Para venderlos a un mejor precio, ya que con  las ganancias que le genere al momento que las venda tendrá mejores ingresos para seguir invirtiendo en su cosecha.
texts.en:
Arcadio, a humble farmer of 42 years of age, from the Cacao area on the outskirts of Teustepe, is married and a father of 2 children between the ages of 8 and 15 years old. At present both of his children are studying. 

He works in agriculture, sowing maize, beans and tomatoes. He has been doing this for 15 years. He started doing this kind of work when he was very young, helping his mother with the sowing. Now he has cows and the land that he works he purchased with the money he earned from his crops. He hires labourers to carry out work. 

He always takes his harvest to sell in Managua, where they pay better prices for grain. On this occasion Arcadio is requesting the loan to buy two cows. He will sell them at a better price. He will use the earnings from the sale to improve his income, which he can then use to continue investing in his crop for harvest.

loans.use: to buy two cows

loans.name: Poeurn

texts.en: Poeurn is 51 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $1 daily. Her husband is employed and earns about $4 each day. Two of her children are garment workers who make an income of $6 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Poeurn requests a loan of $500 to purchase cattle to resell. By doing so, she would earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to build a new house and help her youngest child earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to resell

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia, 44 years old, is married to a government employee and blessed with three children. They are currently residing in the village of La Paz. She manages a livestock business raising hogs. She's been in this business for almost 22 years. With this business, she earns a net income of PHP 3,000 for every hog that she sells. She would like a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase some hogs to raise and hog feed. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can gain more income from her business.

loans.use: To purchase hogs to raise and hog feed

loans.name: Uuganbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Uuganbayar is 25 years old and lives with his wife in Darkhan which is the second largest city of Mongolia. The couple resides in their own house on a plot of land. His wife works as a hairdresser. He began working as a contract taxi driver at a private business entity in 2012. Before working as a taxi driver, he had been working as a truck driver for the mining industry. He uses his own automobile for his taxi service. The automobile has deteriorated over the past few years and is consuming a lot of petrol. He is requesting a loan of 3800000 MNT to purchase a new automobile which runs on natural gas. 

As a result, he can provide his taxi service for a sustainable period according to his contract with the private business entity.  More importantly, due to using natural gas as a fuel, the automobile he is purchasing will emit less smoke thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase an automobile which runs on natural gas

loans.name: Sam An

texts.en: Sam An is 40 years old. She is married and resides with her three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $1 daily. Her husband runs a public transportation service (tuk tuk taxi). He earns about $5 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Sam An is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase cattle to resell. By doing so, she would earn additional income for the family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store from her home and also help her children to earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to resell

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is 45 years old and married with one child.

Meriam works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Meriam has been in this business for three years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Meriam aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sharon Rose

texts.en:
Sharon Rose is 36 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Sharon Rose is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Sharon Rose has been raising pigs for 10 years and earns additional income from frozen foods.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
This is Merly, 58, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is a mother to her children and they are managing their household as they operate the business. She also has a variety store for additional income. At this time, she is working hard to provide income for their family.

Merly operates an internet café business. Services like this become a need as customers’ demand increases. Her main patrons are students who require her services for school requirements. She has customers who need to rent computers for business purposes like writing a resume and office documentation; as well as customers who would just love to surf the net and visit any social network. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in profit every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy additional computer parts and accessories needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Merly hopes that her business will keep on growing and dreams that her grandchildren will have a good education and a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 65 years old and lives in Lutao, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 6 children. 

Irene has a store and sells groceries and other consumable products and earns approximately 1,000.00 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase items such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, vinegar and oil.

Irene has been a member of PMPC for almost 9 years. In the future, Irene hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing items such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, vinegar and oil

loans.name: Jesus Mardoqueo

texts.es:
El joven Jesus Mardoqueo esta soltero, tiene 21 años de edad, cursó el tercer años de educación básica, actualmente trabaja en un hotel prestando sus servicios de recepcionista, lleva un año de experiencia en su trabajo.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para pagar sus estudios de educación secundaria, ya que quiere mejorar su preparación académica, con el fin de tener una buen futuro. Espera en el futuro ser un profesional y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Jesus Mardoqueo is 21 and single. He has taken three years of basic education, and is currently working in a hotel as a receptionist. He has one year of experience in his job.

He is applying for a loan that he will use to pay for his secondary education studies. He wants to improve his education with the aim of having a good future.  In the future he hopes to become a professional and support his family.

loans.use: To pay for his secondary school studies.

loans.name: Lorilyn

texts.en:
Lorilyn is 30 years old, married and has four children who are in school.

Lorilyn has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. Lorilyn requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for her furniture-making business.

Lorilyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, Lorilyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her furniture making business.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 53 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

Francisca is engaged in rice palay trading and dried fish vending businesses and earns approximately PHP 2,500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase additional stocks of dried fish and rice palay to sell. 
 
Francisca has been a member of PMPC for almost nine years. In the future, Francisca hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish and rice palay to sell

loans.name: Khurelkhuyag

texts.en: Mr. Khurelkhuyag is 47 years old and lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar which is the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. He has been working as an engineer in the dismantling division of a construction business. From December to February, construction work stops which leaves him without a job. The company pays him a very small amount of money. His salary is the only source of family income because his wife is unemployed and stays at home. He has begun building a house with two flats. The new house is conjoined with the small house they live in. Due to a lack of finances, some interior decorations and the heating system isn’t completely finished. He is requesting a loan of 1500000 MNT to purchase construction materials such as gypsum, paint, nails and cement. He would also like to install the heating system. As a result, the family can live in a comfortable and warm place and burn less coal thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials and install a heating system

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a 36-year-old married woman with six children, ages 17, 14, 12, 10, 8, and 6.  She lives with her family and husband in Mwambalazi, Mombasa, Kenya.  She works in her food stall where she sells fruits and vegetables.  She has been in this business for six years and that has given her sales experience to help earn a higher income.  Many customers prefer her because of the quality of food, the good prices, and her excellent customer service.  She is an active woman who is dedicated to her work and very eager to get ahead.  She is always looking for new opportunities that will bring her success.  Every day she works her hardest because she knows that is the only way she will achieve her dream.

She is requesting a 50,000 KSH loan to help expand her business by buying sacks of cabbages and oranges.

loans.use: to buy sacks of cabbages and oranges to resell.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more items like pants, slippers, blouses and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Merlie successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is submitting Merlie's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase pants, slippers, blouses and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Pov is 49 years old. She is widowed and resides with four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than 10 years, earning approximately $2 daily. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $6 each day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Pov requests a loan of $750 to purchase a cow to breed and produce a calf to sell. By doing so, she would earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand the business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it much stronger and more comfortable for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to breed and produce a calf to sell

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en: Hajara is married and has five children, only two of her children go to school.  She buys and sells cattle.   She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more cattle for resale.  She has been in this business for 5 years and sells at the market once a week but sells on wholesale only. Her major business challenges include transportation and lack of enough capital to boost her business. She aspires to own a delivery van to ease transportation. She also hopes to pay school fees and to build rental houses. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include paying for utility bills and school fees.

loans.use: buy more cattle for resale

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en:
Sergio is 59 years old, married and has eight children. 

Sergio is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines.  He requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

Sergio has been farming vegetables for six years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Sergio would like to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Jeanth Faith

texts.en:
Jeanth Faith is 20 years old and lives in Cabgan, Pta. Miray, Baliangao. She is married and has one child. 

Jeanth Faith works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for one and a half years. She has requested a loan to finance her fish selling business. 

Jeanth Faith has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years.

loans.use: finance her fish vending business

loans.name: Sokim

texts.en:
Sokim is 35 years old. She is married and resides with her four children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than a year, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband is a motor taxi driver who makes an income of $4 per day. 

Due to lack of funds, Sokim is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase timber and zinc to build a new house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and help her children earn bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: buy materials to build a new house

loans.name: Ma. Doria

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ma. Doria works hard to support her family.  She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Ma. Doria is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle transportation business.

Ma. Doria has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy motorcycle parts

loans.name: Raul Diosdado

texts.en:
Raul Diosdado is 50 years old and has five children.  He is married and has two children who are in school.

Raul Diosdado is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.  He requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for his pigs.

Raul Diosdado has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain his business.

In the future, Raul Diosdado would like to save money to expand his business and continue to send his children to college.

loans.use: buy medicines and vaccines for his pigs

loans.name: Pedrito

texts.en:
Pedrito is married and has 3 children.  He is 60 years old and lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Pedrito sells flowers to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, he earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan for 14,900 Pesos to add capital on his flower vending business.

In the future, Pedrito hope to have more savings.

loans.use: purchase more stocks of flowers

location.town: Oroquieta-Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 29 years old and lives in Lutao, Panaon,  Misamis Occidental. She is married with no dependent. 

Maricel is engaged in a vegetable gardening activity and earns approximately PHP 2,500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing commercial fertilizers for her vegetable gardening activity. 

Maricel has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years. In the future, she hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: buy fertilizer to grow vegetables

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a widow with 3 children.  She is 55 years old and lives in Villaflor, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Marilyn sells vegetables to earn a living and has had this business for 13 years. She has requested a loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell. 

Marilyn has been a member of PMPC for 13 years. In the future, Marilyn hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Baasanjargal

texts.en: Mr. Baasanjargal is 42 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Ger in Tosontsengel soum of Zavhan, Mongolia. He and his wife Uuganbayar, age 38, has been running a cobbler service business at home since 2006. His sons Myagmarjav, age 16, and Sugarhuu, age 14, and daughter Hongorzul, age 11, go to local schools. The youngest daughter Suglegmaa, age 4, goes to the local kindergarten. They have already built closer relationship with their customers and suppliers over the years. He is now requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase leather and other inventory for their cobbler business. Both the borrower and his wife are hardworking and positive people.

loans.use: to purchase leather and other inventory for his cobbler business.

loans.name: Emil

texts.ru:
Эмиль родился и живет  в селе Ужанис,Сюникской области.Он не женат и проживает вместе с отцом.
С ранних лет Эмиль занимается сельким хозяйством и скотоводством.С 2009 года он имеет собственную ферму в селе Ужанис . У него на ферме есть крупный рогатый скот, куры у свинья. А его отец помогает ему справлятся с огородом , где выращивают овощи и фрукты. У Эмиля еще есть земельный участок, где сеет только зерновые культуры. 
Круглый год Эмиль реализует в оптовых рынках Сюникской области мясо, молоко,сыр,яйца, овощи и фрукты. Труд конечно тяжелый но как Эмиль говорит ; иметь собственную ферму очень прибыльно. Он гордится тем что со своим тяжелым трудом может достойно содержать семью. 
Эмилю нужен кредит на сумму 300,000 Армянских драм для организации весенних посевных робот и для покупки семян ячменя.
texts.en:
Emil was born and lives in the village of Ujanis in the Syunik province of Armenia.  He is not married and lives with his father.

He has been involved in agriculture and animal husbandry since his youth.  In 2009 he got his own farm in the village of Ujanis.  He currently owns some cattle, chickens and pigs.  His father helps him to take care of the garden where they grow fruits and vegetables.  Emil also owns a parcel of land where he cultivates only grain crops.

Throughout the year, he sells meat, milk, cheese, eggs, fruits and vegetables at the wholesale markets of the Syunik province.  Emil works hard of course but, as he says, having his own farm is very profitable.  He takes pride in the fact that, thanks to his hard work, he is able to adequately provide for his family.

He needs a loan of 300,000 Armenian dram to get ready for the spring planting season and to buy barley seeds.

loans.use: to organize spring planting and buy barley seeds.

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Presentacion works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and raising pigs. 

Presentacion is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Presentacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Moses' Group

texts.en:
Moses is a twenty-five-year-old dryland farmer, husband, and father of one child. His wife is a farmer too. 

Moses does poultry farming, keeps cattle and grows food crops. Due to erratic rains, pests and diseases, and the difficulty of marketing his chickens, his agricultural endeavors prove challenging. 

Regarding the KOMAZA microforestry program, Moses says, "The KOMAZA program is good as it avails inputs and trains farmers in its projects. Being in a KOMAZA group gives [me] skills and [we] can share a lot as a group then improve [our] businesses." 

Moses intends to use the profits he receives from his tree farm to build a good house, feed his family better meals, and buy clothing. He also sees the KOMAZA program as a way to "ensure quality education" for his children.

loans.use: to buy inputs for his tree farm inputs (seedlings, fertilizer) and pay for technical training and maintenance

loans.name: Rodenia

texts.en:
Rodenia is married with 2 children.  She is 42 years old and lives in Farmington, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Rodenia is a farmer and owns a rubber and coconut farm to earn a living. She has been doing this for 6 years. She has requested a loan to purchase more coconut and rubber for her farm.

Rodenia has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Rodenia hopes to expand her coconut and rubber farm.

loans.use: buy coconut and rubber for her farm

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 59 years old and lives in Birayan, Rizal. She is married and has 4 children. 

Regina has a copra and charcoal business and earns approximately PHP 4500 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan to purchase construction materials for house repair. 

Regina has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.

loans.use: buy construction materials for house repair

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 50 years old and lives in Poblacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. She is married with 2 children.  To earn a living, Alicia has a business selling a variety of food. She earns about PHP 5000 each month doing this type of work. 

Alicia has requested a loan  to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.  Alicia has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, She would like to expand her business.

loans.use: buy raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Baatardalai

texts.en:
Baatardalai is a 52-year-old widower who lives with his 2 children in a ger in Har-Horin Soum of Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His daughter (Nomin-Erdene, age 28) works at a local school as a teacher, and his son (Suhbold, age 25) is a university student. 

Baatardalai has been running an auto repair business on his plot of land since 2001. He has stopped his business because his welding machine has broken and he is not able to provide his service to customers. He needs to repair or replace his equipment to restart his business. He is now requesting 1,300,000MNT to purchase better machinery to re-provide his business to his customers. 

Baatardalai is hardworking, diligent and positive person.

loans.use: buy machinery for his auto repair business

loans.name: Domero

texts.en:
Domero is 57 years old and lives in Salimpono, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is married and has 2 children. 

Domero is engaged in copra buying business and earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan to be used in paying the tuition fee for his daughter. 

Domero has been a member of PMPC almost 2 years. In the future, Domero hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: pay tuition fee for his daughter

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.   She is borrowing 20000 PHP through NWTF to buy fruits to sell in her food stall.

Cherry successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.  NWTF is relisting Cherry's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: buy fruits to sell

loans.name: Renelfa

texts.en:
Renelfa is married and has 5 children.  She is 39 years old and lives in Pta. Miray, Baliangao.

Renelfa sells grocery items and beverages to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns 2700 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 5000 PHP to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Renelfa has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.

loans.use: buy grocery items to sell

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Ella aprendió el oficio de la costurería desde hace quince años; fue su mamá quien le enseño. Los insumos para costurar, los adquiere en una ciudad que esta a veinticinco kilómetros de su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar tela para la elaboración de uniformes escolares. De esta manera, satisfacera la demanda de uniformes que tiene y podrá recibir ingresos económicos que le permitan mejorar su condición económica y la de su familia. Su deseo es poseer una sastrería de alto nivel y realizarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria is 48 years old, married, and has two children. She learned the sewing trade 15 years ago; it was her mother who taught her. She gets her sewing supplies in a city that is located 25 km from her home. 

The loan that she is requesting is to buy fabric tor making school uniforms so that she will be able to satisfy her current demand. Also, she will be able to receive income which will allow her to improve her and her family's financial situation. Her wish is to own to a high-quality tailor's shop and make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making school uniforms.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is married with two children. She is 39 years old and lives in Binuangan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Liza sells dried fish and longaniza to earn a living and has had this business for 20 years. She has requested a loan to purchase more dried fish and longaniza to earn a living.

Liza has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish and longaniza to earn a living

loans.name: Sanatan

texts.en:
Sanatan is a resident of a small village, Baunsiapada, in Nayagarh district, Odisha. He is 27 years old and staying with his parents, his wife and a child. He has been supporting his family through the income earned from a small grocery store. He sells food items like snacks, spices, electric bulbs, pickles, onions, tea leaves and potatoes in his village. He has had a shop for the last four years. 

He needs a loan of 35,000 INR in order to buy snacks, spices, rice, wheat flour and other household necessities like toilet cleaners, mosquito repellents and wafers for his shop. He says there is good demand for mosquito repellents and sanitizers as mosquito-borne diseases are very widely prevalent in his village. He wants to increase his income and provide his family better facilities of life and save some money for his family's future.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing snacks, spices, rice, wheat flour and other household necessities like toilet cleaners and mosquito repellents for his grocery shop.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is married with 10 children. She is 63 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Rosita is a farmer and grows assorted crops such as banana, coconut, etc to earn a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested a loan to finance her coconut plantation. She has been a member of PMPC for four years.

loans.use: to finance her coconut plantation.

loans.name: Illampu Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ILLAMPU”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Martha es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chompas, producción de alfombras, costura de polleras, costura de ropa de moreno, venta de frutas, venta de queso, tejido de mantas, venta de comida, tejido de lana de  alpaca, confección de deportivos, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Martha es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su vecina que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  costura de polleras; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de un trabajo anterior que tuvo en el taller de su cuñada, posteriormente decide abrir su propio espacio de trabajo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela.) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es viuda y tiene tres hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "ILLAMPU" will begin their fourth loan cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Pan-American regional office. It is comprised of 11 members and is led by a board of directors with Martha serving as the President. The members carry out a variety of business activities, including selling sweaters, rug making, sewing traditional Andean skirts, sewing indigenous clothing, selling fruit, selling cheese, blanket knitting, food sales, alpaca wool knitting, making sportswear, and running a neighborhood store. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit these small business owners such as the member Martha. She points out that this is the fourth loan cycle that she is a part of with Pro Mujer. She joined by an invitation from her neighbor who is a member of the institution. Currently, she has a small business of sewing traditional Andean skirts. She tells us that she learned this trade from a previous job that she had in her sister-in-law's workshop. Afterwards, she decided to open up her own work space. 

The loan that she will presently take out is to increase capital. She will buy fabric from fairs in the city of La Paz, and then she will sells what she makes with it by order. This form of employment allows her to generate resources to maintain her home the best way possible since she is a widow and has three children.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en: Gertrude used the previous loan to buy beers, sodas, and bottled water to sell. She is a 53-year-old married woman with two children living in Kagadi, Uganda. She operates a retail shop where she sells mostly soft drinks. She got start-up capital after selling off her crops since she is also a farmer. Inadequate capital and price fluctuations are factors affecting her business. She would like to educate her children and hire employees to help her expand her business. Gertrude is requesting a loan to buy beers, sodas, and bottled water to sell.

loans.use: to buy beers, sodas, and bottled water to sell.

loans.name: Ay

texts.en:
Ay is 51 years old. He is married and resides with five children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has been working as a construction worker for more than six years, earning approximately $2 daily. His wife is a rice farmer who makes an income of $2 each day. Three of their children are employed. They earn about $9 per day. Due to the lack of funds, Ay is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase construction materials to build a bathroom and toilet. This money will help him provide hygienic living conditions for the family. 

In the future, he would like to run an additional business and help his children earn bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a bathroom and toilet.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Criselda works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Criselda is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy fish to sell to customers.

Criselda has been sustaining her business activities through her past twelve loans from NWTF and through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Endanilla

texts.en:
Endanilla is 64 years old and lives in Sinian, Cobungan, Baliangao. She is married with four children. 

Endanilla sells hypo. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan to purchase 10 gallons of hypo.

Endanilla has been a member of PMPC for 12 years.

loans.use: To purchase 10 gallons of hypo (HCl)

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 33-year-old married man with four children living in Kagadi, Uganda.  Four years ago, he decided to venture into selling brew and, with the proceeds, he has been able to pay for his children’s school fees.  He also has a motorcycle for a transportation business and trades produce.  As a good father, he desires to educate his children and to build a good house for his family, despite inadequate capital.  

James intends to use the loan to buy local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy local brew to sell.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en: Jimmy is a married man with a child living in Kagadi, Uganda.  He operates a cosmetics shop which he has run for four years now.  He also operates a produce business which supplements his income.  He dreams of building a good residential house and trading in wholesale, despite inadequate capital.  Jimmy is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a balut-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more balut to sell to customers.

Digna successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to improve her business.

NWTF is relisting Digna's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more balut to sell to customers.

loans.name: Nelianita

texts.en:
Nelianita is 65 years old and lives in Landing, Baliangao. She is married with three children. 

Nelianita works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to finance her business. 

Nelianita has been a member of PMPC for seven years.

loans.use: To finance her fish-selling business

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.

Edna requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy blouses, t-shirts, pants, and blankets.

She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Edna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy blouses, t-shirts, pants, and blankets.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia is 58 years old and married with 8 children.  She lives in the Philippines.  Alicia is a farmer who grows rice for a living.  She has been doing this for 30 years.  She has requested a loan to pay for the expenses related to preparing her rice field.  Alicia has been a member of PMPC for 9 years.

loans.use: to pay for the preparation of her rice field.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is aged 50 and a farmer in Ndaragwa county in Kenya, where she lives with her husband and five children who are all in school. She has been in farming for the past 20 years, producing vegetables and milk that she sells at the local market in her area.

She is requesting a KES 40,000 loan from Juhudi Kilimo, which she will use to purchase water tanks for irrigation that will help her water her crops. This will provide her with more yields and thus more income to help uplift her living standards. She will use some of the money to pay for her children's schooling. She hopes to have enough water storage for domestic use, crops, and animals through water harvesting in the next five years.

Drought is her major challenge in farming.

Beatrice believes that there is a great future for small-scale farmers in Juhudi Kilimo's loan products.

loans.use: To purchase water tanks for irrigation.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en: Divina is 43 years old, married to a farmer, and blessed with seven children. They are currently residing at the village of La Paz. She has owned and operated a retail store for almost two years. In this business, she's earning a net income of PHP 5,000 a month. She would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 25,000 to purchase curls, biscuits, noodles, canned goods, and beverages. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can able to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase curls, biscuits, noodles, canned goods, and beverages

loans.name: Mulisi

texts.en: Mulisi is a 31-year-old married man with three children living in Kagadi, Uganda. Five years ago, he decided to venture into the local brew business so as to support his family, and he also supplements the business with produce sales. Determined to change his future, he dreams of educating his children up to the university level and also set up a food store that can sustainably supply his customers all year round. Mulisi intends to use the loan to buy local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy local brew to sell.

loans.name: Penh

texts.en: Penh is 43 years old. She is married and resides with eight children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She is a housekeeper. Her husband is a motor taxi driver who earns about $3 daily. Four of her children are employed in factory. They earn about $12 each day. Due to lack of funds, Penh is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase timber to build a new house. This money will help her provide better living condition for the family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and help her children earn higher education.

loans.use: to purchase timber to build a new house

loans.name: Kamughobe Tukolerehaghuma Grou Group

texts.en: Beatrice is a 50-year-old married woman with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. For 20 years now, she has been selling cassava flour, and with the proceeds she has been able to educate her children and build a house. Price-fluctuation and prolonged rainy seasons affect the business. Beatrice intends to use the loan to buy cassava flour to sell. She is a member of the above-mentioned group, where each member guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Maria Paz

texts.en:
Maria Paz is married with one child. Maria Paz is 36 years old and lives in Lawagan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Maria Paz sells dry goods to earn a living and had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to purchase more dry goods to sell at retail.

Maria Paz has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dry goods to sell at retail

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en: Mrs. Dolgorsuren is a 47-year-old widow who lives with her son in Ger in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Her son Batsuuri, age 32, works at a local company. She has been working at a local shoe manufacturing company since 2005. She has gained lot of experience over the years. She is now planning to start her own cobbler service business at home and is requesting MNT 2,000,000 to purchase equipment and inventory for her newly starting cobbler business. She is a hardworking, diligent, and responsible woman.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and inventory for her newly starting cobbler business

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is a 47-year-old woman from Panglao, Bohol. She has four children. The oldest is 27 years old and the youngest is 13 years old. She engaged in the hog-raising business for five years now. She earns PHP 25,000 per month. This is the source of her income. Her husband is a laborer. 

Vicenta is requesting a loan to buy piglets, hog grower, and medicine. Through this loan, she will be able to buy and raise healthy pigs and sell them in her community.

In the future, Vicenta hopes to expand her business and to gain more profit. She also wants to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy piglets, hog grower, and medicine

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is married with three children. She is 44 years old and lives in Southwestern Poblacion, Calamba.

Evelyn sells grocery items and beverages to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,100 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 20,000 to purchase new stock to sell.

Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for almost two years.

loans.use: To purchase 10 boxes of assorted grocery items and soft drinks

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: This time, Helen is borrowing PHP 10,000 to purchase spare parts for her tricycle transportation. Her tricycle transportation business, which she previously funded through NWTF and Kiva field partner, continues to provide for Helen and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle transportation.

loans.name: Sofea

texts.en: Sofea is a 48-year-old married woman and mother of a 16-year-old daughter from Alicia, Bohol, Philippines. She is engaged in a sari-sari, or variety store, business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Sofea needs a loan to buy additional merchandise to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, bread, snack foods, soap, and toiletries. With this, she will be able to improve her sales and profit.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, bread, snack foods, soap, and toiletries

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is aged 28 and a farmer in Ndaragwa County in Kenya, where he lives with his wife and two children (only one has started schooling). He has been in farming for the past eight years, producing vegetables and milk that he sells at the local market in his area.

He is requesting a 30,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo, which he will use to purchase a water pump for irrigation. This will help him water his crops, which will provide him with more yields and thus more income to help uplift his living standards. He will also use some of the money to pay for his children's schooling. He hopes to have improved in farming by producing in a large scale in the next five years.

Drought is his major challenge in farming.

John believes that they are privileged to have Juhudi Kilimo working with them.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump for irrigation.

loans.name: Almeda

texts.en:
Almeda is married with two children. She is 52 years old and lives in Pta. Miray, Baliangao.

Almeda sells groceries and other household basic items to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,900 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 20,000 to pay for tuition fees.

Almeda has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: To pay for her child's tuition fees and other school expenses

loans.name: Hermila

texts.en:
Hermila is 55 years old, married, and has two children who are all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Hermila has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Hermila requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

She has been in this business for five years. In the future, Hermila would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Las Mariposas De Jp Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARIPOSITAS JP”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nora es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de coca, costura de busos, elaboración de tejidos, venta de faldas para cholita, venta de plantas, ayudante de albañil.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nora es integrante, ella indica que es el primer ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  costura de busos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre, ya que ella le apoyaba después ella estableció su propio espacio de trabajo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela.) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el las reuniones de pago.
texts.en: The "Maripositas JP" group is starting its first loan cycle with Kiva partner Pro Mujer from the Juan Pablo II center. The group consists of six members, and it has a board of directors with Nora as president. The members make a living through a variety of businesses, like selling cocoa, sewing, knitting, selling skirts, selling plants and being a construction assistant. The loan will help these small-businesswomen. This is the first loan for Nora, who was invited to join by a fellow member of the institution. She currently has a business sewing sweatshirts, which she learned from watching her mother and then established her own work space. She plans to use the loan to increase her capital and purchase fabrics at the trade fairs in the city of La Paz, and to use them to sew her products to sell at her sales post. This will help her generate revenue to provide for her household, since she is a single mother with a son. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Nora says that she likes the repayment meetings.

loans.use: to purchase fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabric to make clothing in his shop.

loans.name: Romelie Fe

texts.en:
Romelie Fe, a 31-year-old married mother of two, lives in Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga where she has been selling grocery items for 3 years. She earns PHP 3200 each month. 

Romelie Fe has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase construction materials needed for the completion of her house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials needed for the completion of her house.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe, 40 years old, is married to a carpenter and blessed with three children. They are currently residing in the village of La Paz. She owns and operates a clothing business, particularly selling some used clothes in their village. In this business, she's earning a net income of PHP 12,000 a month. She would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 25,000 to purchase used clothes to sell. According to Fe, her net income usually goes to the allowances and tuition fees of their children. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted immediately so that her business will become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes to sell

loans.name: Twende Mbele A Group

texts.en:
Violet is pictured on the right with her hand raised amongst her Twende Mbele A Group members. The 15 of them, 9 women and 6 men, are farmers in Bungoma South District. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ an acre of maize, millet, and sorghum. Violet joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2010, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Violet joined One Acre Fund so that she could grow enough food for the family and use increased profits to send her children to school.

Violet described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and buy a plot at the market center. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Violet’s group members will take input loans of ½ an acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 7.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional gallons and maintain his machines and equipment.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
En la calurosa ciudad de Nazca rodeada de atractivos turísticos y sobre todo con l generosidad que caracteriza a sus pobladores, vive Lucia, una mujer de 45 años de edad, la cual es madre de 8 hijos a los cuales quiere muchísimo y por quienes ha luchado de manera incansable a pesar de las adversidades al lado de su esposo para poder ofrecerles una vida digna y sobre todo mucho amor y cariño. Lucia ha aprendido a trabajar desde muy pequeña ya que sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos, y por ello solo pudo estudiar hasta el sexto grado de primaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder acabar la escuela.

Día a día Lucia trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta y elaboración de pan, ella se levanta muy temprano para poder elaborar sus panes y poder venderlos a sus clientes, sobre todo en temporada escolar, lucia cree que está saliendo adelante en su negocio porque es responsable y sobre todo tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Lucia está muy contenta y agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le están brindando ella podrá mejorar su vivienda colocando pisos, tarrajear y pintarlas paredes, entre otros, de esta manera podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y poder tener más seguridad y poder seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Ampliar su panadería y poder ofrecer mayores productos”.
texts.en: The hot city of Nazca is surrounded by tourist attractions and is known most of all for the generosity of its inhabitants. Here lives Lucia, a 45-year-old mother of eight children whom she loves very much and for whom she fights tirelessly alongside her husband to offer a decent life with a lot of love and affection. Lucia learned to work from a very young age because her parents had few resources, so she only has a sixth-grade education, but she would love to be able to finish school. Day to day, Lucia works in her small business baking and selling bread. She gets up very early to bake the bread to be ready to sell to her customers, mostly around school time. She believes she is making headway with her business because she is responsible and has a strong desire to keep moving forward. Lucia is very happy and grateful for Kiva lenders, because thanks to your support she will be able to improve her home by putting down flooring and painting walls, among other things. In this way she can improve her quality of life, have more security and be able to keep fighting to realize her biggest dream: expanding her bakery and being able to offer more products.

loans.use: to put down flooring and paint walls in her home.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is a married woman and a mother of two children. They live in Bohol, Philippines. She is engaged in the fishing business together with her husband for more than five years now. This is the source of their income. Veronica is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and buckets. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Veronica dreams of expanding their fishing business so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family and so she can also repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and buckets

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 61 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with five children.

Felicidad works in the snack processing and selling business earning approximately PHP 2000 each month doing this type of work.

She has requested a loan to purchase additional flour, sugar and other ingredients for her snack processing and selling business.

Felicidad has been a member of PMPC for almost 12 years. In the future, Felicidad hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional flour, sugar and other ingredients

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a 60-year-old farmer in Ndaragwa county, Kenya, where she lives with her husband and nine children. Her children are all adults and have finished their schooling. Sabina has been in farming for the past forty years, producing vegetables and milk that she sells at the local market in her area.

She is requesting a 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan from Juhudi Kilimo, which she will use to purchase water tanks for irrigation to help her water her crops and provide her with higher yields. This will improve her income to help lift her living standards. She hopes to have enough water storage for her family's domestic use and for her crops and animals through water harvesting in the next five years.

Drought is Sabina's major challenge in farming. She believes that farmers will be able to improve their livelihoods and acquire wealth through Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank for irrigation

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is married and works hard to support her family. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Lanie is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase raw materials for her tailoring business.

Lanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past eleven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Norberta

texts.en:
Norberta is a 56-year-old married woman from Panglao, Bohol. She has eight children. She operates a motorcycle transport business in the community. She has been operating this business for eight years, and it earns her PHP 5000 a month. 

Her husband is a farmer. He grows rice as another source of income. Norberta requested a loan of PHP 21000 to buy fuel and to maintain her motorcyle, including changing oil and tires so she can continue to serve her customers without delays. In the future, Norberta would like invest in other ventures to support her family, as well as for sustainable quality of living.

loans.use: to buy fuel and to maintain her motorcyle

loans.name: Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Tumaini Group is located in Bungoma South District. It is a group of six women and four men led by Sylvester pictured on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for ½ an acre of maize, millet and sorghum cultivation. Sylvester first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 long rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 long rains season. Sylvester joined One Acre Fund in order to gain knowledge on farming and use increased profits to send his children to school. 

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Sylvester was only able to harvest 12 bags of maize per one acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the long rains 2012, he was able to harvest 10 bags per ½ acre. He hopes that his profits from the 2013 long rains season can be used to send his children to school and buy a plot. Sylvester’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ an acre during the 2013 long rains season. In total they will receive inputs for five acres of maize and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a rag-making business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store. Janice is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy items like needles, thread and other equipment for her rag-making business.

Janice has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like needles, thread, and other equipment for rag making.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is single with no child. She is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is a farmer and grows pigs to earn a living. 

Luz has been doing this for seven years. She has requested a loan to purchase feed. She has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of feed.

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victorina is a 48 year old married woman and a mother of four grown up children. They live in Ubay, Bohol, Philippines. She and her husband has been engaged in the rice farming and fishing business for more than 20 years now. This is how they make a living.

Victorina is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and new fishing nets for fishing. With this, they will be able to enhance their farming and fishing business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and new fishing nets for fishing.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 44 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. Lourdes works very hard to provide for them.

Lourdes runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lourdes has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, dried fish and other groceries. 

In the future, Lourdes would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Dulamsuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Dulamsuren is 33 years old. She lives with her parents in a Ger (Mongolian housing tent) in the Hentii province of Mongolia. Her parents are retired and stay home. 

She has been working as saleswoman in a local market since 2008. She is now planning to start her own retail clothing business from a rental counter of a local market. She is requesting 4,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase starting inventory for her newly starting business. She is a hardworking, well-experienced and positive person.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory for her newly starting business.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 55 years old and lives in Landing, Baliangao. She is married with three children. 

To earn a living, Loreta has a business selling snacks. She earns about 2,300 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of work. Loreta has requested a loan to finance her rice production, which is her source of food.

Loreta has been a member of PMPC for nine years.

loans.use: To finance the preparation of the rice field.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en: Pascal is a 36-year-old man from Rwamagana District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. Pascal started selling lights in June, 2011, and he has sold 40 lights to date, providing clean energy to 200 people. He will reinvest the money he makes into buying more lights to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Ma. Joce

texts.en:
Ma. Joce is 35 years old and married with three children.

Ma. Joce works hard to provide for her family. She runs a food production business in the Philippines and requested a 22,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase chicken, meat, pork and ingredients for her food business.

Ma. Joce has been in this business for four years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Ma. Joce aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, meat, pork and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Solange

texts.en: Solange is 27 years old. She is married with two children. The oldest is 4 years old and the youngest is 3. Her husband is a driver. She has been in business for two and a half years as a liquor store owner. She wants a loan to buy more liquor for sale. With the profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more liquor for sale.

loans.name: J.nepo

texts.en: J. Nepo is a 26-year-old man from Rwamagana District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. J. Nepo started selling lights in June, 2011 and he has sold 140 lights to date, providing clean energy to 700 people. He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: To pay for low-cost rechargeable LED lights that he will resell to rural households without electricity

loans.name: Wacataqui Bartolina Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “WACATAQUI BARTOLINA II”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ana María es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de salteñas, venta de comida, costura de colchones, tejido de mantas y macramé, venta de gorras, venta de colchones para bebe.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ana María es integrante, ella indica que  hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace quince años, al ver la carencia de este servicio en su zona.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, fideos, conservas) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene  dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el las reuniones de pago y la enseñanza de responsabilidad en relación al dinero y de la salud que aprende en Pro Mujer.
texts.en:
The communal bank "WACATAQUI BARTOLINA II" will begin its fourth loan cycle in Pro Mujer, at the Juan Pablo II social center.  The group is comprised of nine members and the management board is chaired by Ana María, the president.  The members carry out different businesses, including a grocery store, food sales, mattress manufacturing, blanket and macramé weaving, hat sales and baby mattress sales.

The loan will benefit these small business owners.  Ana María joined Pro Mujer six months ago through an invitation from a friend in the institution.  She runs a neighborhood grocery store which she began 15 years ago because of the need for such a service in the area.

This loan will be to increase working capital to buy rice, noodles and canned goods at the city market in La Paz and sell at her store.  Through her work she is able to earn enough to maintain her household; she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says it's the payment meetings and responsibility training regarding money and health that she learns there.

loans.use: To buy rice, noodles and canned goods.

loans.name: Roxana Maria

texts.es:
Roxana tiene 38 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de uva, esparrago, entre otros. Roxana en una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, desde joven ha luchado mucho ya que sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos pero gracia a su esfuerzo logro estudiar la carrera de Educación inicial; es por ello que actualmente trabaja en una escuela de su ciudad enseñando a niños pequeños que es lo que más le gusta, ella labora alrededor de 8 horas al día y ella cree que está saliendo adelante en su trabajo porque es muy amable con sus alumnos y sobre todo tiene mucha paciencia.

Roxana está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le están brindando ella podrá refaccionar las paredes de la vivienda donde habita y también podrá pintarla, lo que le permitirá tener una mejor calidad de vida y más seguridad y podrá seguir luchando y trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y tener un colegio”.
texts.en:
Roxana, 38, lives in the city of Ica which is known for its warm, welcoming climate and crop agriculture, especially of grapes, asparagus, etc.  Roxana is very determined to get ahead and has worked hard all her life since her parents had very little income.  Thanks to her efforts she was able to get an elementary education degree.  Currently, she works at the city school teaching young children, which is what she enjoys most.  She works eight hours a day and believes she is successful at her job because she is very kind to the students, showing them a lot of patience.

Roxana is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to them, she is able to repair and paint the walls of her house.  This will improve her lifestyle and give her more safety so she can continue working toward her goal:  "To have her own house and a school.".

loans.use: To repair the stucco and paint the walls.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy spices to sell.

loans.name: Marvin Adalberto

texts.es: MArvin es un joven muy trabajador quien vive junto a sus padres. Él posee un negocio en el que comercializa gas propano en su casa de habitación, es gracias a este trabajo es como él puede costear sus gastos personas y perseguir sus sueños y metas. Marvin recibe llamadas de teléfono solicitando sus servicios, por lo que Marvin lleva los cilindros de gas hasta la casa de sus clientes y así mismo vende otros desde su casa. Marvin con todo el deseo de hacer crecer su negocio solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL por  medio del cual pueda invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de cilindros de gas, con lo que Marvin podrá atender más personas y así obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Marvin is a very hardworking young man who lives with his parents. He has a business selling propane gas from his house. Thanks to this job he is able to cover his personal expenses and follow his dreams and goals. Marvin's clients phone him to request his services and he delivers the gas cylinders to their homes. He also sells gas cylinders directly from his home. 

In the hopes of making his business grown, Marvin is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL. This will allow him to invest in the purchase of a larger quantity of gas cylinders, allowing him to serve more clients and increase his earnings.

loans.use: to buy propane gas to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria siempre se ha dedicado a trabajar muy duro para salir adelante junto a su hija quien es la única persona con la que vive. Victoria labora haciendo frescos naturales de diferentes sabores, ya tiene varios años de realizar este  trabajo lo que le ha permitido ser toda una tradición, ya que las personas le han comprado fresco por más de 10 años. Debido a la higiene y el buen servicio que ella brinda, siempre ha tenido mucha clientela. Victoria es muy dedicada a su trabajo dándole un sabor muy delicioso a sus frescos. Ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda comprar materia prima para elaborar más frescos, ingredientes como: sandía, melón, cebada, coco, azúcar, bolsas plásticas, pajillas y todo lo necesario para mejorar su negocio, gracias al que ha salido a delante durante muchos años.
texts.en:
Victoria has always worked very hard to get ahead and provide for her daughter, who lives with her.  Victoria makes natural refreshments in different flavors and has been in business for several years.  For over ten years customers have been buying her products which have become a tradition.  Because of her hygiene and good service, she always has many customers.

Victoria is very dedicated to her work and makes delicious refreshments.  She is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL to buy ingredients, such as: watermelon, melon, barley, coconut, sugar, plastic bags, straws and other items to improve her business, thanks to which she has been able to earn a living for many years.

loans.use: To buy fruit and other ingredients to make refreshments.

loans.name: Richard

texts.es:
Richard tiene 29 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo  podemos encontrar muchos paisajes hermosos y una gastronomía muy variada.  Richard ha pasado por momentos difíciles, pero a pesar de ello logro estudiar la carrera de Técnico en ingeniería forestal y lo logro con mucho esfuerzo ya que sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos y para poder estudiar trabaja por las mañanas y estudiaba por las noches.

Día a  día Richard trabaja como técnico forestal en una empresa de su ciudad, el labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo apoya a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, el cree que está saliendo adelante por su responsabilidad y honradez.

Richard está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias al gran apoyo que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder realizar reparaciones en el techo de su vivienda, como cañas, calaminas, clavos, entre otros; de esta manera el podrá brindar mayor seguridad a su familia y poder seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”Formar una familia”.
texts.en:
Richard, 29, lives in the city of Pucallpa, which is known for its warm, welcoming climate, beautiful scenery and varied gastronomy.  Richard has lived through difficult times, but was able to get a forestry engineering degree with much effort, since his parents had little resources.  To study, he had to work during the day and study at night.

Richard works nine hours a day as a forest technician at a company in the city.  He helps his parents with the household expenses and believes he is getting ahead because he is responsible and honest.

Richard is very grateful to Kiva lenders, thanks to whom he can buy construction materials to repair the roof of his house.  These include, cane, corrugated iron, nails, etc.  This will give his family more safety and allow him to continue toward his goal of "Forming a family".

loans.use: To buy materials such as cane, nails, corrugated iron, etc.

loans.name: Marie Costa

texts.en: Marie Costa is 33 years old and is married with a one-year-old child. Her husband sells cloth, while she has been in business for three years selling food such as potatoes, sweet potatoes, sugar, banana and soap. She would like to take out a loan to buy more of these goods to sell. With the profits she will build a house.

loans.use: To buy more sweet potatoes, sugar and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Anastase

texts.en: Anastase is a 39-year-old man from Rwamagana District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. Anastase started selling lights in August, 2012 and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. He will reinvest the money he makes into buying more lights to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost rechargeable LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity

loans.name: Nellious' Group

texts.en:
Nellious is the leader of Nellious' Group. She is a 29-year-old farmer and mother of four children. She keeps cattle and grows maize, cassava, and legumes on her farm. Her husband works as an Assistant Chief. The major challenges she faces are drought, pests, and diseases, and she lacks the capital she needs to grow her business. 

She decided to join KOMAZA's tree planting program for "an improved standard of living, be it health, education, clothing and housing" for her family. She also hopes to improve her knowledge of farming through the training she will receive from KOMAZA. She plans to use the money she makes from her tree farm to educate her children and build a new house.  

Two additional farmers pictured are Kangombe, a KOMAZA-Kiva farmer that will be part of another loan group, and Kache, an interested farmer but she is unable to plant trees with KOMAZA this season.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm inputs, such as eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer and to pay for technical training and tree farm maintenance.

loans.name: Nicholas' Group

texts.en:
Nicholas is a 39-year-old farmer and machine operator; his wife is a farmer, too. When the machines break down, Nicholas is out of work, and when there is drought his farming suffers. 

Nicholas says, "The KOMAZA trees will improve the environment and it’s a future investment." Nicholas intends to start a poultry business with his profits from the tree farm. 

Nicholas continues, "It’s a good and worthwhile project to invest in, as it brings good changes - income and environment."

There are two adults pictured that will not be planting trees with KOMAZA this season; one is the husband of KOMAZA-Kiva farmer Joyce and the other Jacinta is very interested in the program but unable to plant with KOMAZA this season.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm inputs such as eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer, as well as to pay for technical training and maintenance support.

loans.name: Flordelina

texts.en:
Flordelina is 56 years old and lives in San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Flordelina has a sari-sari general store, from which she earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month. She has requested a loan to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, vinegar and soap. She has been a member of PMPC for eight years and in the future hopes to increase her savings.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, vinegar and soap

location.town: Oroquieta-San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis

loans.name: Meilin

texts.en:
Meilin is married and works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items like sardines, snack foods, diapers and other miscellaneous items.

Meilin has been in this business for eight years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items like sardines, snack foods, diapers and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Asarena

texts.en: Asarena is 33 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. She owns and operates a business of planting and harvesting peanuts to sell in the local community. She's been with her business over 3 years and earns about 1,700 PHP each month. She joined GDMPC in 2008, and now she is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional raw materials. Her goal is to have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials.

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.en: Marie Louise is 30 years old. She is married with three children. The oldest is 11 and the youngest is two and a half. Her husband is a motorcyclist. She has been in business for three years as a tailor. She wants a loan to buy a needed sewing machine and other needed materials to operate her tailoring business. With the profit she will pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and needed materials to use in tailoring.

loans.name: Sharp

texts.en: Sharp is a 42-year-old hardworking man with four children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. In order to support his growing family he decided to set up a food store so as to promptly provide basics to them.
