Like most produce traders he faces challenges of price fluctuation and insufficient supply from farmers due to the unpredictable weather changes. His dreams are to educate his children to attain minimum qualification degrees and set up a food store in town that can sustainably supply the region. Sharp intends to use the loan to buy general produce such as maize flour, beans and cassava to sell.

loans.use: to buy produce such as maize flour, beans and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Liberito

texts.en: Liberito is 45 years old and married with five children. He lives in Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. He owns and operates a business of harvesting & selling farm-raised fish in the local community. He's been with his business over 10 years and earns about 2,000 PHP each month. He joined GDMPC in 2008, and now he is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. He wants to have a better future for his children.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 34 years old and married with four children. She lives in Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. Marilyn owns and operates a business raising pigs to sell. She's been with her business over 3 years and earns about 2,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2011 and now she is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase medication for her livestock. She wants to have a better future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase medication for her livestock.

loans.name: John Bosco

texts.en: John Bosco is a thirty four-year old hardworking man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a very innovative man who fabricates metals and also does electrical wiring of new houses.  Like all good fathers, he desires to educate his children up to the university and set up sustainable income generating activities so as to secure their future. Inadequate capital hinders his business, and his dream is to own a big workshop.  John Bosco intends to use the loan to buy welding materials for use.

loans.use: buy welding materials for his metal shop

loans.name: Buzooba Tutungurane Group

texts.en:
Johnson, a member of the group, sells local gin. He is a member of Buzooba group. He is married to Jenifer and they have three children, only one of whom attends school as the others dropped out. 

He first took a loan of 500,000 UGX which helped him start the local gin business. It gradually moved to the level of self sustainability. However he faced a challenge paying back the previous loan when he was robbed of all the money and is now struggling to get back into the business of producing. 

He wants the loan to buy more millet and maize, renovate his house and pay fees for the child. He is a hard working and persevering man.

loans.use: To buy produce such as millet and maize.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is 51 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Kapatagan, Lana Del Norte. She owns and manages a business of selling food products in the local community. She's been with her business over 7 years and earns about 15,000 PHP each month. Veronica joined GDPMC in 2008. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, like pork, chicken and beef. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell, like pork, chicken and beef.

loans.name: Faustine

texts.en:
Faustine is a 37-year-old hardworking man with five children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He operates a retail shop and he started the business after realising that farming alone could not allow him to meet the day-to-day needs of his family. 

He faces challenges of price fluctuation and inadequate capital to meet the increasing demand while his dream is to have a wholesale shop. Faustine intends to use the loan to buy maize and soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and soda to sell.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 35 years old and lives in Kabayanda a village in rural Lyantonde with his family. He has five children who all go to school. Their ages range from 5 to 13.

Godfrey has a shop, but he also supplements his income by growing and selling beans. The sale of beans especially helps him pay school fees. It was very hard for him to pay tuition for his children until he got a helping land from UGAFODE Microfinance, he therefore no longer tampers with his business capita.

Godfrey plans to buy more land with the next loan so that he can plant more beans. 

With the money he gets from this loan, he wants to buy more merchandise for the shop.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala west region of Uganda. For the past year, Florence has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells drinks like soda, juice and water. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drinks like lucozade (sports drinks), soda and water, and will help Florence to generate greater profits and take care of her necessities. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to build rental houses. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more drinks like lucozade (sports drinks), soda and water.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine is 32 years old. She is married with five children. The oldest is 15 and the youngest is eight months.  Her husband works in a furniture store. She has been in business for eight years. She sells children's clothing. She wants a loan to buy more kids' clothes to sell. With the profit she will pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more kids' clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kirize

texts.en:
Kirize lives in Nkoote,one of the villages in rural Lyantonde with his wife and their seven children. He deals in cereals and also transports people on his motorbike as another way of increasing his income.

With this loan he would like to buy more cereals. Apparently the prices are still low and he will be able to sell at a much higher price therefore increasing his income.His desire is to get to a level where he no longer has to borrow for his business. He always has a challenge in getting funding.

loans.use: To buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Julio

texts.en:
Julio is a 45-year-old married man from Panglao, Bohol. He has 5 children. The eldest is 15 years old and the youngest is 7 years old. Julio has been engaged in a hog raising business for a year now. He earns about 4,000 Php per month. This is the source of his income.

He is requesting a loan to buy piglets and feeds. Through this loan, he will be able to buy and raise healthy pigs and sell them in his community to gain a profit. In the future, Julio dreams of expanding his business and supporting the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feeds.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey, aged 41 years, acquired a loan in the amount of 2,000,000 UGX. He is married with five children, all in school. He has a tea plantation and he sells green tea leaves to the factory. He works for 12 hours six days every week. He also earns from rearing goats and domestic birds for additional income.

Godfrey started this enterprise in 1995, in rural Bushenyi, with the purpose of earning income to make a living. The loan purpose is to buy organic manure and fertilizers to boast tea production. He sells his tea directly to the factory,and he hopes to lead a better life in future.

The challenges include inadequate manure which causes him to use fertilizers, labour shortages, and price fluctuation.

He is hardworking and honest and he hopes through hard work he will reap big.

loans.use: To buy organic manure to fertilise his tea estate

loans.name: Tophil

texts.en:
Tophil acquired a loan of UGX.500,000. He is aged 42 years, married with two children, both in school. He is in the business of brewing local wine out of plantains, locally known as 'matooke'. He works every day of the week. His additional income is from agriculture. The business was started in 2004 to help him earn a living.

He resides in Iraramira central in Ishaka; his clients are people who drink local wine in and around the neighbouring villages. 

He has hopes of building a permanent house in future. His challenge is that most of his clients do not pay on time and this has made his business stagnate. He is hardworking and honest.

loans.use: To buy more green bananas for making local brew

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is 22 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala west region of Uganda. For the past two years, Teddy has been working hard to manage her clothes store, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Teddy has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes to sell, and will help Teddy to generate greater profits and expand her business into a wholesale shop. Teddy hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Teddy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies for the shop  in form of sugar , soap, salt amng others and also pay school fees.

loans.name: Evulet

texts.en:
Evulet is aged 25, married with one child and resides in rural Ntungamo.

She is a trained grade 3 teacher while her husband is a motorcycle "boda boda" rider(a motorcycle for transporting people). She is acquiring a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to use as float for their mobile money business, which is near the trading centre and doing well since she does not have much competition being only two people in the area, she will therefore be able to make profits and repay the loan from it.

In the photograph is Evulet with her husband in their mobile money outlet.

loans.use: To get capital for the mobile money transfer business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a single mother who lives on the outskirts of Lyantonde. She operates an electronics shop from which she earns income to take care of her household needs and pay tuition for her daughter. 

Mariam is a repeat client who has taken several loans of 1,500,000, 2,000,000 and now wants UGX 3,000,000. She began the business in 2005 because there was less competition for the business. However, more people have come into the business and stiff competition has become high on her challenges list. 

Mariam will use this loan to buy construction items in the form of cement and sand to do finishing for her residential house, so that it can be habitable and she will be able to cut her rent costs. She is a very hardworking and assertive woman.

loans.use: To complete her residential house.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora is 42 years old and married. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a general store business in the Philippines and has been in this business for six years. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy groceries like snack foods, canned goods and other miscellaneous items. In the future, Nora would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries like snack foods, canned goods and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is 23 years old and lives in the town of Kyotera in the Masaka region of Uganda.  She is married and has one child who currently attends school.  For the past two years, Winnie has been working hard to manage her coffee business, selling coffee seeds. 

To help expand her business, Winnie has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy more coffee to increase sales, and will help Winnie to generate greater profits and provide for the basic needs of her family.  Winnie hopes that in the future she will be able to become the best coffee producer in town. 

Winnie is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more coffee to increase sales.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is 42 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is single and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past four years, Farida has been working hard to manage her spare parts business, which sells motorcycle spare parts.

To help expand her business, Farida has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more spare parts to sell, and will help Farida to generate greater profits and have a constant supply. Farida hopes that in the future she will be able to be self-reliant . 

Farida is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Farida who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 34 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past eight years, Harriet has been working hard to manage her stationary business, which prints and sells stationary. 

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add stationary items such as exercise books and reams of paper to the business and will help Harriet to generate greater profits and increase the family's income. Harriet hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand the business to other areas. 

Harriet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Harriet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to buy stationary items such as exercise books and reams of paper to sell

loans.name: Burahim

texts.en:
Burahim is 35 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past two years, Burahim has been working hard to manage his hardware store, which sells glass, tiles and iron sheets.

To help expand his business, Burahim has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more iron sheets that will increase his stock, and will help Burahim to generate greater profits and meet his customers' needs. Burahim hopes that in the future he will be able to meet his customers' needs.

Burahim is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Burahim who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more iron sheets to increase his stock.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac lives in Kakamega county in western Kenya with his wife and five children, where he farms passion fruit.

He is happy that Honey Care will provide beekeeping services for his hives, and plans to use the extra income generated by his hives for domestic use. 

This is his first loan, and he hopes to one day expand his beekeeping business.

loans.use: to buy beehives to supplement his income.

loans.name: Mateka Group

texts.en:
Eileen is a member of Mateka Group in Bungoma South District. She is pictured with 11 One Acre Fund farmers, 7 women and 4 men. Eileen is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ an acre of maize, millet and sorghum cultivation. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Eileen’s first season with One Acre Fund. She joined this year in order to access the best input prices and grow enough food for the family.


Last year, Eileen harvested 6 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land. She is excited to improve her harvest as a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and perhaps invest in another business. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Eileen’s group will receive 5.5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Enosi

texts.en:
Enosi, 39, is a married man with 3 children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been trading in agricultural produce for five years. He started as a farmer who would sell only the surplus and after realizing that there is a ready market, he fully ventured into the business. He faces the challenge of inadequate capital to meet the high demand of his customers.

Enosi is requesting for a loan to buy agricultural produce such as maize and beans to sell. He dreams of buying a motor vehicle to ease the transportation of produce and of educating his children. He has a business goal of expanding his business into new markets

loans.use: to buy agricultural produce such as maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Muyayi North A Group

texts.en:
Mildred is a member of Muyayi North A Group in Bungoma South District. She is pictured here, one of ten One Acre Fund farmers, seven women and three men. Mildred is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ an acre of maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.

Mildred first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2010 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access the best input prices and grow enough food for the family.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Mildred was only able to harvest 2 ½ bags of maize per ½ acre but in the Long Rains 2012 season, she was able to harvest seven bags per ½ acre! She plans on using future profits from the harvest to save for the future and to send her children to school. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Mildred's group will receive five acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred, aged 36, is a married man with four children, living in Kagadi, Uganda. He operates a local brew business and has been in business for twelve years now. He also has a piggery project and a produce business in order to increase on his income source. He dreams of building a permanent house for his family and educating them to attain degrees as minimum qualification despite challenges of inadequate capital.

Fred intends to use the loan to buy local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy local brew to sell.

loans.name: Agahikaine Kiryanga Group

texts.en: Abifaisi is a married woman with 6 children and resides in Kagadi, Uganda.She operates a local brew business, which she has been running for five years now, and she supplements it with farming. She dreams of building a permanent house for her family and trade in wholesale, despite the inadequate capital that is affecting her business growth. Abifaisi intends to use the loan to buy local brew to sell. She is a member of the above mentioned group, where each member holds each other accountable for the loan.

loans.use: To buy local brew to sell

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is 34 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, 3 of them are currently in school. For the past 5 years, Robina has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, flour, rice and other items.

To help expand her business, Robina has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more commodities such as sugar and soap to increase business.  This will help Robina generate greater profits and lead to increased returns and an expansion of the business. Robina hopes that in the future she will be able to add more money to the business.

Robina is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robina who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more commodities such as sugar and soap to increase her sales.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en: Susan is a 59-year-old widow with two children. She lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a business of selling charcoal in the local community. She's been with her business over 10 years and earns approximately 1,700 PHP each month. She joined GDMPC in 2012 and now she is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase coconut shells to make charcoal. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is 37 years old and lives in the town of Busia in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. 

For the past two years, Oliver has been working hard to manage her general hardware business, which trades in engine oil, filters, and tubes. 

To help expand her business, Oliver has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to trade in other hardware equipment, and will help Oliver to generate greater profits and build her family a home.

Oliver hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business into a motor spare part store. 

Oliver is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Oliver who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to trade in other hardware equipment.

loans.name: Costa

texts.en: Costa is a thirty-eight year old married man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. For twelve years he has been operating a retail shop. He started the business in order to be able to meet his family's basic needs. Stiff competition and inadequate capital pose a challenge to his business, but he dreams of educating his children and sending them to University, and of owning a wholesale shop. Costa is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Namono A Group

texts.en:
Austine is a member of Namono A Group in Bungoma South District. He is pictured with twelve One Acre Fund farmers, six women and six men.  Austine is standing on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Austine first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Austine joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and use the increased profits to send his children to school. 

Austine described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year. He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and save for the future. Austine’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ an acre during the 2013 Long Rains season.  In total they will receive inputs for six acres of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Embako Group

texts.en:
Edmond’s group has 10 farmers and is located in Bungoma South District. Edmond is pictured on the right of Embako Group with his hand raised. Edmond is pictured amongst the 4 men and 6 women of his group. He will receive input loans capable of planting ½ an acre with sorghum, millet, and maize. 

The 2013 Long Rains season will be Edmond’s first season with One Acre Fund. He joined this year in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer, access the best input prices, grow enough food for the family, and use increased profits to send his children to school.

Edmond managed to harvest 5 bags of maize on 1 acre of land last year. As a One Acre Fund farmer, he hopes to join the ranks of farmers who double their harvest in the first year of the program. He plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school, repair his home, invest in a cow, save for the future, and perhaps invest in another business. 

During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Edmond’s group will receive 5  acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan, a 40-year-old married mother of five children, is from Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She has been operating a specialized retail ice cream business for the past five years and earns 4,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Susan joined GDMPC. She requests a loan of 7,500 PHP, which she will use to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make her products. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase the raw ingredients to make her products

loans.name: Darie Blandine

texts.en: Darie Blandine is 30 years old. She is married with two children. The oldest is three years old, and the youngest is five months old. Her husband is a driver. Darie Blandine has been in business for 10 years. She sells food such as potatoes, rice, beans, and fruit. She wants a loan to buy more food to sell. She will put the profits towards her savings.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell.

loans.name: Vilman Elisabeth

texts.es:
La señora Vilman Elisabeth esta casada, tiene 47 años de edad, cursó los grados de educación secundaria, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 1 esta estudiando, se dedica al comercio de ropa y calzado,  inicio este negocio con poco capital y poca mercadería, hasta el momento lleva 7 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica  al mismo negocio.

Solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de mercadería: compra de ropa en diferente  variedades, compra de calzado en diferente tamaños y diseños, con el fin de vender un poco mas; espera en el futuro tener un negocio prosperado y con muchos clientes.
texts.en:
Vilman Elisabeth is marries and 47 years old. She has a secondary education and 4 children. One of them is in school. She sells clothes and shoes. She started this business with little capital and merchandise. She now has 7 years experience and has the support of her husband, who works in the same business. 

She is asking for the loan to buy merchandise such as a variety of clothing and different sizes and designs of clothing. She is doing this so she can sell a little more and in the future have a prosperous business with many customers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es:
Salvador tiene 42 años de edad, es casado, tiene tres hijos, y vive en una aldea del municipio de San Francisco, Atlántida.
Salvador lleva 5 años de dedicarse a la venta de frutas y verduras. Vende papas, tomate, chiles, cebollas, remolachas, bananos, repollo etc.  Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante, y en su casa tiene una galera donde vende su producto.  Ha solicitado el octavo préstamo a ODEF el cual es por 25,000 Lempiras con el fin de comprar variedad de verduras y frutas de temporada para surtir y aumentar las ventas.  Su meta es establecer el negocio en otro lugar y hacer una caseta para la venta de sus productos.
texts.en:
Salvador, age 42, is married and has three children.  He lives in a village in the San Francisco municipality in Atlántida.

Salvador has been selling fruit and vegetables for five years.  He sells potatoes, tomatoes, chilies, onions, beets, bananas, and cabbage, etc.  He sells in an itinerant manner, and he has a setup at his house where he sells his product.

He has requested his eighth loan from ODEF.  The loan is for 25,000 lempiras, and he will buy a variety of seasonal fruits and vegetables.  He will do this to stock up and to increase sales.

His goal is to establish the business in another spot and to build a stall to sell his products.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Maria Dominga

texts.es: María de 34 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo quien es empleado de una empresa bastante estable, y así mismo vive junto a su hija. María se dedica a su negocio propio en el que elabora tortillas, este es un negocio estable con varios clientes fijos. Las tortillas son primordiales en la dieta de las personas de este país ya que es complemento de todas las comidas. María trabaja de lunes a domingo cada mediodía y cada tarde, ella es una persona amable, responsable y muy dedicada a su hogar y su hija. María solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para poder comprar maíz por mayor y obtenerlo a precios más bajos, lo que le permitirá obtener más ganancias de sus ventas, así mismo para comprar leña y cal para cocinar el maíz que posteriormente muele para convertirlo en masa y poder hacer las tortillas.
texts.en:
María, age 34, lives with her husband and her daughter.  Her husband is employed by a very stable company.

María has her own business making tortillas. This business is stable with several fixed customers.  Tortillas are essential to the diet of people of this country, and it is a compliment to all meals.

María works Mondays through Sundays every noontime and every afternoon.  She is a kind, responsible person who is devoted to her household and her daughter.

María is requesting a loan from Integral in order to be able to buy corn wholesale and to get it at lower prices.  That will allow her to get more profit from her sales.  She will buy firewood and lime powder in order to cook the corn.  She will later grind it in order to make dough, and she will be able to make the tortillas.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and lime powder to make tortillas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise (rice, sugar, pasta and more)

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en: Carolina is a 60-year-old married woman from Loon, Bohol. She has five adult children. Carolina raises pigs. She has been in the hog-raising business for 20 years. In addition to hog-raising, she also operates a dressmaking business. The income that she earns from that business helps her to meet her daily expenses. She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy pig feed and additional piglets. With this loan, Carolina would be able to produce more healthy pigs to sell to her customers on time. In the future, Carolina would like to expand her business in order to support her family and build a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and additional piglets

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda, 38 years old, is married to a maintenance crew worker for a telephone company. They are currently residing at the village of Napaccu Grande. 

She has owned and operated a retail store for almost 15 years; she was earning a net income amounting to PHP 5,000, but, unfortunately her store was temporarily closed due to lack of financial assistance.

She would like to access a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase biscuits, canned goods, noodles, curls, sugars, coffee, and beverages to sell again. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that her store will become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase biscuits, canned goods, noodles, curls, sugars, coffee, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 38 years old and widowed with two children.

Elsie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Elsie has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years, and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Elsie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Feliciano Timoteo

texts.es:
Feliciano Timoteo de 60 años de edad, casado, con cuatro hijos mayores e independiente. Originario de  Malpaisillo lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Feliciano se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, responsable lo cual ha demostrado en sus créditos anteriores en tiempo y forma. Ha sido un hombre muy trabajado desde una edad muy temprana por falta de recursos económico no pudo estudiar.
Gracia a su espíritu de superación tiene por actividad económica la compra y venta de ganado,( vaca, toros, caballos)  y la venta de leche  desde hace once años que se dedica a dicha actividad. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, y de forma ambulante. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar un ganado que se lo están ofreciendo a buen precio. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano obtener mejores ingresos. Feliciano agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Feliciano Timoteo, age 60, is married and has four grown and independent children.  He is from Malpaisillo, which is located in the western area of the country.  Feliciano is known for being a hard-working and responsible person.  He has demonstrated this with his previous loans, which he repaid on time.  He has been a very hard-working man from a very early age.  Due to the lack of financial resources, he was not able to go to school.

Thanks to his will to improve, his business activity is buying and selling livestock (cows, bulls, horses) and selling milk.  He has been doing this business activity for 11 years.  His business is located at his house, and he sells in an itinerant manner.

The objective of the loan is to invest working capital and to buy livestock, which is being sold at a good price.  He will do this in order to have better income in the not very distant future.  Feliciano is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders give to people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have the means to earn a decent living.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel is 62 years old, and married with three children. She lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. 

Ethel owns and operates a business selling firewood in the local community. She's been in business for over three years, and earns 2,000PHP each month. 

Ethel joined GDMPC in 2007, and now she is requesting a loan of 6,000PHP to purchase additional firewood. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood to resell.

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine is 32 years old. She is married with one child, who is five years old. Her husband sells men shoes. 

She has been in business for two years, selling children's clothing. She is requesting a loan to buy more children's clothing to resell. 

With the profit, she will pay her child’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy more children's clothing to sell.

loans.name: Puspashree

texts.en:
Puspashree is a 35-year-old differently-able lady who lives with her in-laws and husband. She has a small grocery shop in her house where she sells lentils, rice, edible oil, spices, salt and biscuits. She earns 2,000 INR per month from her shop which is not enough for a family of three. She is the only one to support her family. 

She has requested a loan amount of 40,000 INR for purchasing more stock of rice, lentils, oil, spices, etc. and adding new productd to her shop like cosmetics, hair oil, shampoo sachets, and detergents to meet her customers’ demand and make them highly satisfied. She hopes  to build a separate shop outside her house and take good care of her parents.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing rice, lentils, oil, spices, cosmetics, hair oil, shampoo sachets, and detergents etc. for her variety store.

loans.name: Arjun

texts.en:
Arjun is a 25-year-old physically-challenged person. He is unmarried. He lives with his parents and elder brother. He has a small variety store in his village. He is selling food items like rice, biscuits, pickles, wheat flour, lentils and spices, etc. He has to travel every three days to the nearest market in Dhenkanal to get more stock. He wants to invest in his grocery store so that he can stock up on more inventory at his shop to meet the demand of the local people and reduce his transportation and buying costs. This will increase his earning capacity.

Arjun has requested a loan of 30,000 INR to purchase more items of what he is selling right now and add more variety to his product line and more stock for his grocery shop and grow his business.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing rice, biscuits, pickles, wheat flour, lentils and spices, etc. for his variety store

loans.name: Ronelyn

texts.en: Ronelyn R. is from Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old, married, and has one child. Ronelyn owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 25,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Ronelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is applying for a loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and sell.

loans.name: Jelleny

texts.en: Jelleny is 24 years old, married and has two children. She works hard to provide for her family. Jelleny runs a general store in the Philippines and has applied for a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries, such as sardines, soft drinks, bread and other miscellaneous items, to sell. Jelleny has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Jelleny aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries, including sardines, soft drinks, bread and other miscellaneous items, to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en: Perla is 49 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail business in the local community. She's been in business for more than three years and earns 1,800 PHP each month. Perla has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. Now she is applying for a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, such as canned goods, soap, shampoo, coffee and sugar. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell, such as canned goods, soap, shampoo, coffee and sugar.

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en: Donatha is 30 years old. She is married and has four children. The oldest is 11, and the youngest is 3. Her husband is in the decoration business. She has been in business for four years. She sells foodstuffs in the market, such as sugar, rice, soap, potatoes, bananas, tomatoes, carrots, and greens. She wants a loan to buy more of these products to sell. She will use the profits to finish her house.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs to sell, so she can finish her house.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en: Wilfredo is a fisherman and seaweed farmer from Bohol, Philippines. A 50-year-old married man and the father of six, Wilfredo been in these businesses for more than 20 years. Wilfredo is applying for a loan to buy new fishing nets, seaweed seedlings, straw and rope. With this loan, he will be able to improve his business and eventually improve his income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, seaweed seedlings, straw and rope.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en: Josie, a 26-year-old married mother of one, lives in Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental where she has been planting and harvesting coconuts for sale for over two years, earning 1,700 PHP each month. Josie joined GDMPC in 2011 and is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Urmila

texts.en:
Urmila is a 38-year-old widow lady living with her in-laws and a son who is schooling. She owns and manages a carpentering shop. 

Urmila has hired a labourer who works for her and does manufacturing and repairing of furniture. Earlier, her husband was managing the shop and was a carpenter, but after his death Urmila took the responsibility of managing the shop. 

She has applied for a loan of 30,000 INR for purchasing a mortise gauge, drilling machine kit, scriber, try square, clamps, etc., and pay for a few more work force to enhance her business and earn more money.

Urmila has a dream of providing the best education facilities to her son and fulfilling her family’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase a mortise gauge, drilling machine kit, scriber, try square, clamps, etc. for her carpentering shop.

loans.name: Judith Maryuri

texts.es:
Judith tiene 20 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Imperial, la cual se encuentra en la costa peruana y posee playas hermosas y se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de maíz, frejoles, entre otros. Judith es una joven que ha pasado por momentos difíciles, ella es madre soltera y el padre de su pequeña la abandono cuando su hijita solo era una recién nacida, pero a pesar de ello y de su juventud ella se esfuerza cada día para poder brindarle su amor ya que su pequeña tiene 3 añitos de edad y sobre todo poder brindarle una vida digna a pesar de las adversidades.

Con mucho esfuerzo y luego de ahorrar por un tiempo logro iniciar su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa desde hace ya un año, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 10 clientes diariamente, ella cree que está saliendo adelante en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes.

Judith está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le están brindando ella podrá comprar mercadería como prendas de verano ya que en su ciudad hace mucho calor y las prendas como los short, faldas, bivirís, entre otros tiene mucha acogida y con ello podría mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá poder sacar adelnate a su pequeña hija y luchar por conseguir hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hija, poder estudiar una carrera universitaria y tener un local propio para su negocio”.
texts.en:
Judith is twenty years old and lives in Imperial which is situated on the Peruvian coast. It has beautiful beaches and it is an agricultural area which specialises in growing corn and beans among other things. Judith is a young person who has been through some difficult times. She is a single mum, as the father of her daughter left when the girl had just been born. In spite of this and her young age, Judith tries hard every day to give her young daughter who is now three, love and a decent life withstanding all their difficulties.  

With much effort and after saving for a period of time, she managed to start her own small business selling clothes one year ago.  Judith works for 8 hours a day and she serves up to 10 clients each day.  She believes that she is getting ahead in her business as she is very kind with the clients.  

Judith is very thankful to the loans from Kiva as with them and the support they are giving her, she will be able to buy merchandise like summer clothing since in her city it gets very hot and items such as shorts and skirts among others are very welcome.  With these items she will be able to improve her income which would allow her to get her daughter ahead and strive to achieve her biggest dreams: give her daughter a good education, be able to study a university degree and have a property for her business.

loans.use: to buy stock (shorts, skirts, men's underwear etc).

loans.name: Ruben Dario

texts.es:
El joven Ruben Dario esta soltero, tiene 27 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, se dedica al comercio específicamente a la venta de producto de consumo diario, inicio este negocio con un poco de capital, hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su familia quienes lo apoyan con el negocio.


Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de productos y ampliar su tienda, compra de aguas gaseosas, golosinas, jugos, jabón, frutas, productos lácteos, etc;y algunas prendas gorras,playeras y calcetines, quiere seguir mejorando su negocio y en el futuro contar son otros puntos de venta, para seguir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Ruben Dario is single, 27 years of age, attended 6 years of primary education and works in the business of selling daily consumption products. He began this business with little capital, until now he has 5 years of experience. He relies on the support of his family who supports him with the business.

He is requesting a loan that he will use for the purchase of products and to expand his store, buy sodas, sweets, juices, soaps, fruits, dairy products, etc.. and some articles caps, t-shirts and socks. He wants to continue improving his business and in the future have other points of sale, to continue supporting his family.

loans.use: to buy products.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is a 49-year-old, married woman with six children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Lucita has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 13 years. Lucita requested a 30,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of rice to sell.

 In the future, Lucita would like to save enough money to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Phut

texts.en:
Phut is 45-year-old widow. She is staying in Odisha with her parents and a son. Her husband was a farmer. He was supporting his family with whatever he got from agriculture. Unfortunately he passed away few years back in an accident. Since then Phut has taken on the entire burden of supporting her family. She is engaged in the activity of selling cow milk in the village and in the market near the village. She sells 10 to 12 liters of milk daily at 24 Indian Rupees (INR) per liter. She has a plan to expand her business by purchasing more cows and increasing her client base to sell more milk to more customers.

She requested a loan of 30,000 INR to purchase a cow and to repair her cow shed. She has a dream to provide a better life to her family.

loans.use: to buy a cow and repair her cow shed.

loans.name: Manas Kumar

texts.en:
Manas Kumar is a 31-year-old differently abled person living with his parents, elder brother and sister-in-law. 

Manas Kumar is engaged in the activity of taking contracts from his customers and building houses for them. He has been doing this activity for the past six years and earns 10,000 INR per month. He says that this amount is not enough for his family, as his parents’ health conditions are not good, and his brother’s job is not permanent.

He has a plan to expand his business by purchasing more raw materials like bamboo, cement, sand, bricks, etc. in order to take more than one contract at a time. He says that doing so will help him stabilize his family's economic condition and save some money for his future.

Manas Kamar has requested a loan amount of 20,000 INR for purchasing the above items and enhancing his business.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo, cement, sand, bricks, etc. for his building construction business.

loans.name: Josiane

texts.en: Josiane is 26 years old. She sells charcoal and has been in the business for 10 years. With the loan, she wants to buy more sacks of charcoal for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en: Loida is 34 years old and married with four children. She lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. Loida owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting vegetables for sale. She's been with her business over 4 years and earns 1,700 PHP each month. Loida joined GDPMC in 2011 and now she is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en: Leonita is 63 years old and married with four children. She lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. Leonita owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting corn for sale. She's been with her business over 20 years and earns 35,000 PHP each month. She joined GDMPC in 2006. Leonita is requesting a loan of 43,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Laxmipriya

texts.en:
Laxmipriya is a 41-year-old widow living with her son and a daughter, who are both in school. After her husband's death she started this business to manage her family's expenses. She earns 5,000 Indian Rupees (INR) per month from this activity, but this is not enough to pay her children's school fees and the family's other expenses.

She owns and manages a ladies novelty corner in her house where she sells cosmetics, hair oil, shampoo, body talc, body deodorant, bangles and other fashion accessories. She wants to enhance her business by adding more stock of what she sells. She says that doing so will improve her earning and her family's status.

She has requested a loan of 20,000 INR for purchasing the above items for her ladies novelty corner.

She has dream to educate her children and save some money to make her future secure.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, hair oil, shampoo, body talc, body deodorant, bangles and other fashion accessories for her ladies novelty corner.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 34-year-old farmer in Ndaragwa county in Kenya where she lives with her husband and two children who are both schooling. Lucy has been in farming for the past 10 years producing vegetables and horticultural products which she sells at the local market in her area.

Lucy is requesting a 20,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo which she will use to purchase a water tank for irrigation that will help her water her crops and provide her with higher yields and thus more income to help uplift her living standards. She will use some of the money to pay for her children's schooling. 

Lucy hopes to have enough water storage for domestic use and crops in the next five years. Drought and unstable markets are her major challenges in farming.

Lucy believes that there is a great future for small scale farmers working with Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank

loans.name: Sunaphula

texts.en:
Sunaphula is a 38-year-old widow lady living with her parents and a child in a village in Odisha, India. She does not want to be a burden on her father, so she started to sell milk at her house and support her father financially.

She is engaged in the activity of selling milk and milk products. She has two cows at her house and has been involved in this activity for the past eight years. She sells ten litres of milk daily at the rate of 24 INR per litre. 

Sunaphula has requested a loan amount of 30,000 INR for purchasing two cows. She says that doing so will let her increase her customers and supply milk in a large amount. She also wants to repair the cattle shed.

Sunaphula has a dream to give a better living standard to her family and save some money for future unfortunates.

loans.use: to purchase two cows for her dairy farm.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 58, married, and has 2 children. She lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. Nenita operates a family member's business providing motor transport services. She's been with her business over 6 years and earns 2,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month. 

Nenita joined GDMPC in 2010. She is requesting a loan of 6,500 PHP to repair an existing vehicle for better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, de 22 años, es una joven mujer muy responsable, es soltera, y es feliz teniendo a sus padres a su lado. Juntos comparte su vida en una casa alquilada, tratando de salir adelante. El trabajo de Juana, consiste en la venta de medicamentos y perfumería, desde muy temprano abre su local, ubicado en el mercado de la ciudad, ahí tiene todo tipo de medicinas, desde lo mas simple hasta medicamentos compuestos, asimismo vende artículos de decoración y personales. Ella comenta que se inicio con un negocio muy chico, pero gracias al esfuerzo pudo crecer de a poco, ahora tiene buenas ventas y ofrece todo tipo de productos y es la garantía que sus clientes esperan siempre poder ir y encontrar lo que deseen. Ella con la ayuda de un químico farmacéutico quien la asesora, le da el prestigio que necesita su negocio. Como toda persona tiene muchos objetivos, el de ella es hacer crecer aun mas su negocio y poder tener un medico para convertir su negocio en un consultorio medico.
Por tanto éste será el primer préstamo con la institución MFP, y espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado 800 soles, comprará medicina para seguir con su negocio, además implementará con artículos personales como perfumes, talcos, desodorantes, etc.  para que tenga variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juana, 22, is a young and very responsible woman. She is single and is happy having her parents at her side. Together they live in a rented house, trying to get ahead. 

Juana's work consists in selling medicine and perfumes. She opens her shop very early; it is located in the market in the city. It has all types of medicine, from the most simple to the complex. She also sells decorative and personal items. She says that she began with a very small business, but thanks to her efforts it grew little by little. Now she has good sales and offers all types of products and it is the guarantee that her customers always expect to go and find what they want. She, with the help of a pharmacist who advises her, gives prestige that the business needs.
 
As every person has many goals, hers is to grow her business even more and be able to have a doctor to turn her business into a clinic. Therefore this will be her first loan with the institution MFP, and she hopes with its collaboration to continue with her goals. With the requested amount of 800 Peruvian Soles, she will buy medicine to continue with her business; in addition she will implement personal articles such as perfumes, talcs, deodorants etc... so that there is a variety of products to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy medicine to continue with her business; in addition she will implement personal articles such asperfumes, talcs, deodorants.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 48 years old and married with three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

Anecita owns and manages a retail business in the local community. She has been with her business for over seven years and earns 2,000 PHP each month. She joined GDMPC in 2007. 

Ancecita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, soap, shampoo, coffee and sugar. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, soap, shampoo, coffee and sugar.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 34 years old. She is married with five children. Her husband works as a house builder. 

With the loan, Chantal wants to buy foodstuffs for sale. She wants to buy more tomatoes, eggplant and green beans. 

The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Ernesto Jose

texts.es:
El señor Ernesto  José trabaja como electricista automotriz desde hace más de 20 años por su propia cuenta y ha podido sacar a su familia a delante.

solicita un crédito para mejoras de su vivienda o ampliación de cocina con compra de perlines, zinc y otros materiales. sus sueños es brindar un techo seguro para su familia.
texts.en:
Ernesto José has been working as a self-employed auto-electrician for more than 20 years, and he has been able to support his family.

He is requesting a loan to carry out improvement works to his house, that is extend the kitchen, through the purchase of beams, metal sheeting and other materials. His dream is to be able to provide his family with a safe roof over their heads.

loans.use: to carry out house improvements (kitchen extension)

loans.name: Miguel Jose

texts.es:
El joven Miguel trabaja para una institución pública desde hace más de un años como profesor de educación de adulto

solicita un crédito para mejoras de su vivienda o ampliación de cuarto con compra de zinc, perlines y otros materiales de construcción.

desea tener un techo mas seguro y digno.
texts.en:
The young man Miguel has worked for a public institution for more than a year as a professor of adult education.

He asks for a loan for home improvements, or expanding his room with the purchase of zinc, metal roof support beams and other construction materials. He wants to have a more secure and dignified roof.

loans.use: to improve his home (to improve his room)

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus tíos, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Dolores  de la ciudad de El Alto.

Ella estudio hasta el nivel Secundario y actualmente desempeña las funciones de Comerciante de CDs y DVDs en la ciudad de El Alto y la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo requiere para aumentar su capital de comercio para comprar más CDs y DVDs y venderlos y así  mejorar sus ingresos.

El sueño de Sandra es tener un negocio mucho mas grande..
Es la Primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Sandra is single and doesn't have children. She lives in her uncle and aunt's house. The house is in the Villa Dolores area of the city, El Alto. 

She has studied up to secondary school level and currently sells CDs and DVDs in the cities, El Alto and La Paz. 

The loan is required to increase her capital so she can buy more CDs and DVDs to sell and improve her level of income.  

Her dream is to have a much bigger business. This is the first time that she has applied for a loan through IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy CDs and DVDs so she can continue with her business.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie is 30 years old and married with three children. She lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She owns and manages an agricultural business, which is planting and harvesting corn to sell in the local community. She's been with her business for more than three years and earns 2,000 PHP each month. Rosemarie joined GDMPC in 2012, and now she is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es:
El joven  óscar Danilo vive en la cuidad de Managua soltero ingeniero en sistema se caracteriza por ser un joven honesto responsable  trabaja como ingeniero en sistema en una  universidad de la capital

Oscar visito ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de materiales de construcción como bloques, cemento, hierro y pago de mano de obra para hacerle unas mejoras a la casa de sus padres por que de esa manera va a ayudarles  a mejorar la condiciones de la vivienda   y darles mejores comodidades  a sus padres.
texts.en: Young Oscar Danilo lives in the city of Managua. He is single. He is honest and responsible, and he works as a systems engineer at a university in the capital. Oscar visited Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy construction materials like cinderblocks, cement, iron, and to pay laborers to make some improvements to his parents' house. In this way, he will help his parents improve the conditions of their home and give them greater comfort.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like stone, cement, and zinc.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en: Bella is 31 years old and married with three children. She lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a farmland by planting and harvesting bananas to sell to earn a living. She's been with her business for more than seven years and earns 5,000 PHP each month. Bella joined GDMPC in 2007. Bella is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
La señora Blanca Estela es madre soltera, tiene 19 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene un hijos pequeño, se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida y refacciones, inicio este negocio con  poco capital, y hasta el momento lleva 4 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de activos: mesas, mostrador, y productos para su venta: refrescos, cereales, etc; ya que espera tener un negocio adecuado a sus clientes, y mejorar  sus ingresos de ganancias, y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca Estela is a single mum who is 19 years old.  She has completed 6 years of primary education.  She has a small son.  

She prepares and sells meals and snacks.  She started this business with little capital and now has 4 years experience.  

With the loan she is requesting, she will buy these assets: tables, a counter and products to sell: drinks, cereals etc. She hopes this will make her business more attractive to her clients and improve her profits to support her family.

loans.use: to buy assets, ingredients and stock.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Leidis, de 36 años, convive con Juan quien es operador de vehículos pesados. Fruto de su compromiso tiene 02 hijos de 11 años y 24 días de nacido. Es el motivo por el cual se esfuerzan y trabajan juntos para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida, habitando cómodamente en su casa propia.
El trabajo de Leidis, consiste en la venta de comida, todos los fines de semana se encarga de salir a la vereda de su casa, pintar una pizarra para ofrecer sus productos y empezar con los preparativos, vende mucha variedad de platos, entre los cuales encontramos cecina con tacacho, chorizo, juanes, pescado ahumado, entre otros, toda esta actividad lo realiza en su casa y ya va por lo menos dos años haciéndolo. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues esta en contacto con las personas, se divierte, se relaja y sobre todo genera ingresos a su hogar. Asimismo ofrece tambien entrega a domicilio y siempre tiene clientes que le solicitan sus deliciosos platos. Le esta yendo bien y gana un buen promedio, por lo que espera tener un restaurante con todos los requisitos ya que tiene muchas expectativas en su negocio.
Este será el crédito número 01 con MFP, y espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, además se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará ingredientes e insumos tales como plátanos, yucas, arroz, hojas de Bijao entre otros para seguir con la preparación de sus deliciosos platos, además de algunos materiales y equipos para seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en: Leidis, 36, lives with Juan, who is a heavy-duty vehicle operator. They have two children: one is 11 and one is 24 days old. This is why they work together, to be able to give them a better quality of life, living comfortably in their own house. Leidis works selling food. Every weekend she goes out on her home's sidewalk, she paints a blackboard to advertise her products, and she starts preparations. She sells a large variety of dishes, including Cecina con Tacacho (roasted plantain fritters with pork), Chorizo, Juanes (chicken wrapped in banana leaves with rice), and Pescado Ahumado (smoked fish), among others. She does all this in her home and she has been doing it for at least two years. She really likes her work because she interacts with people, she has fun, she relaxes, and above all, she makes an income for her home. She also offers a delivery service and she always has customers who ask for her delicious dishes. It is going well for her and she earns a good income, so she hopes to have a restaurant with all the requirements, because she has many hopes for her business. This will be her first loan with MFP, and she hopes for their collaboration to continue with her goals. She also promises to make her payments on time. With the amount she has applied for, 1000 soles, she will buy ingredients and supplies like plantains, yucca, rice, and Bijao leaves, among other things, to continue preparing her delicious dishes. She will also buy some materials and equipment to continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies like plantains, yucca, rice, Bijao leaves, and others to continue preparing her delicious dishes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics and underwear to sell

loans.name: Gisela Maria

texts.es: Gisela en su negocio lavado de muebles, aplicó a un credikiva con el cual compró champoo en mayores proporciones logrando descuentos importantes por el volumen de sus compras y también le alcanzó para financiar los trabajos que se hacen a crédito. Sus ventas han aumentado  y por consiguiente sus utilidades también, su negocio empieza a tener reconocimiento y esto es gracias a Kiva, por eso ella dice lo siguiente a sus financiadores: “Los invito a que sigan desarrollando tan noble labor no solo en Colombia sino en todos los países latinoamericanos“. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará una nueva máquina aspiradora para darle simultaneidad a su servicio y esto la ayudará a que poco a poco cumpla su sueño de prosperidad con realción a hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Gisela applied for a Kiva loan and used it to buy large quantities of shampoo at a discounted rate for her furniture cleaning business. It also helped her finance the jobs that she does on credit. Her sales have increased and, as a consequence, her earnings. Her business is starting to gain recognition thanks to Kiva. For this reason, she would like to say to her funders, "I encourage you to continue this noble effort not only in Colombia, but in all Latin American countries."

Today she is applying for a Kiva loan so that she will be able to buy a new vacuum cleaner to give simultaneity to her service, which will help her, little by little, achieve her dream of prosperity with respect to growing her business.

loans.use: to buy a new vacuum cleaner.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica, de 35 años, es una mujer  alegre y emprendedora. Convive con Ardí quien se dedica al transporte. Juntos habitan en su casa propia junto a su hijo de 09 meses de nacido, a quien quiere dar una buena educación. El trabajo de Mónica consiste en el diseño, confección  y venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños; realiza esta actividad en un local en el interior de su vivienda. Lleva más de 05 años, y le ayudado a generar los ingresos necesarios para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Ella empezó con este negcoio junto a unas amigas a quienes contrató para que le ayuden a terminar los pedidos que eran muchos. Considera rentable su negocio, porque las empresas solicitan la confección de uniformes para sus trabajadores. Asimismo tiene contratos con los distintos colegios de la ciudad. Ante esto, solicitó un préstano bancario para la adquisición de una maquina de coser, ahors sueña con algún día confeccionar vestidos para novia. Ahora este es su primer crédito con MFP, y en el que lo invertirá en la compra de materiales como telas, blondas, elásticos, hilos para así dar un buen acabado a sus confecciones.
texts.en:
Monica, 35, is a happy and entrepreneurial woman. She lives with Ardí who works in transport. They live in their own house with their 9-month-old-son, whom she wants to provide with a good education. 

Monica's work consists of the design, preparation and sale of ladies’, men’s and children’s clothing which she does in the premises of her house. She has been doing this for more than 5 years and it has helped her to generate the necessary income to help with the household expenses. She began this business with some friends who she contracted so that they could help her finish the many orders she had. 

She considers her business profitable because companies request the tailoring of uniforms for their workers. As well, she has contracts with various schools in the city. 

As a result, she is requesting a bank loan for the purchase of a sewing machine. Now, she dreams to someday make wedding dresses. Now this is her first loan with MFP, which she will invest it in the purchase of materials such as fabrics, silk laces, elastics, and threads to be able to create a good finish to her tailoring.

loans.use: to buy materials such as fabrics, silk laces, elastics, and threads to create a good finish to her tailoring.

loans.name: Juan Alejandro

texts.es:
El señor juan Alejandro trabaja y vive en la cuidad de Managua Nicaragua trabaja como vigilante en una empresa. Casado con cuatro persona a su cargo de los cuales dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar es por esta razón que esta solicitando el crédito por que  con el inicio de año escolar necesita solventar aranceles escolares y comprarles los  uniforme escolar, zapato, mochilá, y cuaderno a sus hijos.
 
Don juan desea poder brindar una mejor educación a sus hijos, es por eso que se esfuerza a diario para que no les falte nada.
texts.en:
Juan Alejandro lives and works in the city of Managua, Nicaragua. He works as a security guard at a business. He is married and responsible for four people, two of whom are are school-aged. It is for this reason that he is asking for the loan, because with the beginning of the school year he needs to pay for school fees and to buy school uniforms, shoes, backpacks and notebooks for his children.
 
Juan wants to give his children a better education, so he strives every day so that they won't lack anything.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and to buy school uniforms, shoes, backpacks and notebooks for his children.

loans.name: Llerme

texts.es:
Llerme, de 56 años, es una señora muy amable y trabajadora. Convive con Héctor quien es comerciante. Sus hijos ya son mayores de edad e independientes. Vive cómodamente en su casa propia.
El trabajo de Llerme consiste en la venta de comida, sale todos los días va al mercado para comprar los ingredientes para preparar sus distintas y deliciosas viandas. Tiene un local en el interior de su vivienda en donde por las mañana vende desayunos, como jugos de frutas y sandwichs y por las noches comida asada. Todo su trabajo lo realiza con al ayuda de dos de sus sobrinas a quienes contrata para que le ayuden en la atención a los clientes.  y lleva trabajando ahí por al menos 10 años, en algunas ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, se inicio vendiendo solo desayunos y con el tiempo fue implementando día a día mas variedad de platos.
Le agrada mucho lo que hace, le encanta cocinar y siempre esta en la expectativa de brindar lo mejor a sus clientes, tiene como plan a futuro ampliar su local para vender bebidas gasificadas ya que con la temperaturas altas que se esta dando en la ciudad es otra buena opción de negocio en incrementar sus ganancias. Por tanto éste será el crédito número 01 con MFP, por ellos espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes, de igual forma se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará  víveres como arroz, azúcar, plátano, huevos, entre otros para preparar sus exquisitos platillos. También adquirirá paltos cucharas, ollas, entre otros para una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Llerme, 56, is a very kind and hardworking lady. She lives with Héctor, who is a salesman. Their children are grown up now and independent. They live comfortably in their own home.

Llerme’s work consists of the sale of food. Every day she goes to the market to buy ingredients which she uses to prepare different and delicious dishes. She has given over an area inside the house for the business. In the morning time she serves breakfasts, such as fruit juices and sandwiches, and in the evening time grilled food. Her two nieces help her with all her work. They work for her serving customers. She has been doing this kind of work for at least 10 years. Sometimes her children help her out. She started out serving breakfasts only, but over time she has constantly increased the variety of the dishes she serves.

She enjoys her work. She loves cooking and always aims to offer her customers the best. Her future plan is to extend her business premises in order to sell carbonated drinks as the high temperatures the city experiences make this another good option to increase the earnings of the business. This will be loan number 01 with MFP. She hopes that through this collaboration she will be able to formalise her plans. She is committed to honouring the payment schedule. With the amount requested, 1,500 soles, she will buy supplies such as rice, sugar, plantain, eggs, etc. to prepare her delicious dishes. She will also buy plates, spoons and saucepans, etc. to improve the service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, sugar, plantain, eggs, etc. to prepare her delicious dishes, as well as plates, saucepans and spoons

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en:
Lucille, age 56, is a farmer, earning a living by planting and harvesting spinach. She has operated her business for the past five years and earns PhP 9,000 each month. She lives with her husband and their four children in Clarin, Misamis.

Lucille has been a member of GDMPC since 2009. She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 13,000, which she will use to purchase fertilizer, such as manure and pesticide. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure and pesticide

loans.name: Lissette Carolina

texts.es:
Lissbette es una joven de 20 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Santiago, el cual se caracteriza por sus grandes parcelas agrícolas, especialmente se cultiva el algodón, uva, esparrago, entre otros .Lissebeth es una joven muy carismática y sobre todo con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día para poder solventar sus estudios de Secretariado en un instituto de su ciudad, y también poder apoyar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar; Lissbette cree que está saliendo adelante porque es responsable y sobre todo porque quiere llegar a ser una gran profesional.

Lissbette está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar una computadora, con lo cual podrá tener una herramienta necesaria para sus estudios ya que podrá realizar sus trabajos y ya no tendrá que gastar en alquilar cabinas de internet para ello; así ella seguirá luchando y podrá hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar su carrera y ser una gran profesional”.
texts.en:
Lissette is a 20 year old youth. She lives in the district of Santiago, which is known for its vast agricultural fields. They especially grow cotton, grapes, and asparagus among others.

Lissette is a charismatic young person and above all eager to get ahead which is why she is working about 8 hours a day in order to be able to pay for her secretarial studies at an institute in her city and also to be able to help her parents with the household expenses. Lissette believes that she is succeeding because she is dependable and above all because she wants to become an outstanding professional.

Lissette is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as thanks to the help they have provided she will be able to buy a computer with which she will have a necessary tool for her studies and not have to pay rental fees at Internet cafes, and so she can continue struggling to achieve her biggest dream, “finishing her career studies and becoming an outstanding professional.”

loans.use: to buy a computer which is a necessary tool for her secretarial studies

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie, age 49, is a very hard-working entrepreneur who runs a sari-sari (general store) business. She has been engaged in this business for two years. She and her husband have eight children, four of whom are still in school.

Rosie has requested a PhP 12,000 loan through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

In the future, Rosie would like to save enough money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her store

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es:
La señora Erlinda es madre soltera, tiene  23 años de edad, cursó los 2 años de educacion primaria, tiene un hijo quien esta estudiando, se dedica al comercio a la venta de ropa típica nuevas para mujeres, inicio este negocio por iniciativa propia y capital propio, hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderías, consistente en cortes, blusas, suéteres, y otras prendas, esto con el fin de mejora su negocio y que tenga mejor posicionamiento. Espera seguir mejorando tener un negocio grande y reconocido.
texts.en:
Ms. Erlinda is 23 years old, is a single mother who attended two years of primary education, and her son is currently in school. She is in the business of clothing sales, selling new and traditional women's clothing.
