She began this business by her own initiative and used her own capital, and she has been running this business now for five years.

She is asking for a loan that she will use to buy merchandise that would consist of skirts, blouses, sweaters, and other clothing items in order to improve her business and have a better position in life. She hopes to continue improving it, and to eventually have a big, well-recognized business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, una humilde comerciante de Estelí , madre soltera de tres hijos, dueña de una pulpería uno de los negocios más populares y que genera ingresos diarios , expresa su agradecimiento por la oportunidad que le brindo su primer préstamo Kiva , le ayudo a tener su primer record crediticio, compro productos para surtir su negocio al igual hizo nuevos clientes. El cambio ha sido notorio poco a poco ha ido creciendo su pulpería. Está solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para comprar granos básicos, aceite, jugos, gaseosas, sobres de café, pasta de dientes, desodorantes, agua embotellada. Pues son parte de los productos que más vende a diario.  Su expectativa es ir ampliando y surtiendo de diferentes productos su pulpería y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, a humble shop-keeper from Estelí, is a single mother of three children. She owns a small grocery store which is very popular, and it generates a daily income. She expresses her gratitude for the opportunity that her first Kiva loan provided for her. It helped her to have her first credit record. She bought products to stock her store, and she made new customers. The change has been noticeable: little-by-little, her business has gradually grown. 

She is requesting a new loan to buy bulk grains, oil, juices, soft drinks, coffee packets, toothpaste, deodorants, and bottled water, since they are the products she sells the most of every day. Her expectation is to continue growing, to stock her store with different products, and to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains, oil, juices, soft drinks, coffee packets, toothpaste, deodorants, and bottled water.

loans.name: Elesier

texts.en:
Elesier, age 51, owns and operates a business recycling and selling lampakanay (woven fiber) products in the local community. He has been engaged with his business over 16 years and earns PhP 5,000 every month. He and his wife have four children and live in Aurora.

Elesier joined GDMPC in 2008. He is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 7,000 to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. 

He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make fiber products for sale

loans.name: Dolores Del Carmen

texts.es: Dolores, originaria de la ciudad de Estelí, 38 años de edad, casada, madre de 2 hijos de 9 y 18 años de edad , es de oficio comerciante se dedica a atender una pulpería desde hace 10  años. Negocio que puso con capital que obtuvo cuando le dieron su liquidación en la fábrica de tabacos para la cual trabajaba como obrera, necesita conseguir de manera rápida ingresos pata poder pagar la educación de sus hijos y aportar para los gastos en el hogar, así que puso una pequeña pulpería la cual ha ido progresando poco a poco. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar artículos escolares tales como cuadernos, libretas, borradores, lápiz de colores, reglas, bolsos, lapiceros, marcadores. Pues su idea es ofrecer artículos variados no solo lo común de otras pulperías sino que ofrecer variedad para atraer más clientes. Su expectativa a futuro es poner un minisúper de alimentos y artículos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Dolores, originally from Estelí, is 38 years old, married, and the mother of two children who are 9 and 18 years old. She is in business attending to a grocery store for 10 years.

She started her business using capital she obtained from her severance pay from a tobacco factory where she used to work as a laborer. She needed to quickly obtain earnings in order to be able to pay school fees for her children and to contribute to the household expenses, so she opened a small grocery store which has been progressing little by little.

She is asking for financing in order to buy school supplies such as notebooks, journals, erasers, colored pencils, rulers, bags, ball-point pens, and markers. So, her idea is to offer various articles but not only the commonplace items of other grocery stores but to offer a variety to attract more customers. Her goal for the future is to open a convenience store offering household items.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, journals, erasers, colored pencils, rulers, bags, ball-point pens, and markers

loans.name: Santiago Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SANTIAGO”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Mary es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de pescado, venta de queso, tienda de barrio, venta de paja.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Mary es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de pesca; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres y cuando se casó inicio su propio emprendimiento.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la mejora de herramientas (compra de red de pesca) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo implementará en su trabajo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The communal bank "SANTIAGO" will begin their second loan cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the regional office of Copacabana. It is comprised of 10 members and it is led by a board of directors with Mary serving as the President. The members carry out a variety of business activities such as fish sales, cheese sales, running a neighborhood store, and selling straw.  

The loan that they will take out will benefit small business owners such as the member Mary. She says that she has been a part of Pro Mujer for two years. She joined by invitation from a promoter of the institution who visited her at home. Currently, she has a fish business; she says that she learned this trade from her parents, and when she got married, she began her own business venture. 

The loan that she will presently take out will be to improve her equipment. She will buy a fishing net from one of the fairs in the city of El Alto. Afterwards, she will use it in her job. This form of employment allows her to generate resources to maintain her family since she is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes most about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to invest in working capital and buy corn, firewood, cooking gas, bags and lime.

loans.name: Nescil

texts.en: Nescil is from the village of Aurora. She is 24 years old, married, and has one child. Nescil owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 39,000 PHP a month. In 2011, Nescil joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 43,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is married, with six children. Anita is 61 years old and lives in Palayan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Anita is a cook in a small restaurant to earn a living. She has been doing this for seven years. She has requested a loan to purchase more raw ingredients for her small restaurant.

Anita has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Anita hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her small restaurant

loans.name: Donathile

texts.en:
Donathile is 42 years old. She is married with two children. They all go to school. 

Donathile owns a shop selling different items and has been in business for one year. With this loan, she wants to buy more soaps, sugar and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her two children.

loans.use: To buy more soaps, sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Patrocinia

texts.en:
Patrocinia is a 33 years old and married, with four children. She lives in Aurora, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting bananas for sale to earn a living. She's been with her business over two years. Each month she earns 1,500 PHP. 

She joined GDMPC in 2009. Now she is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es: Saludos desde Perú,  voy a presentar les  a un grupo conformado por 8 integrantes  con gran iniciativa para los negocios, así se caracteriza el grupo comunal “Santa Ana”. Una de  los integrantes  es la Sra. Rosa de 31 años de edad  y madre soltera de 1 hijo, el cual es  su  motivo de lucha y progreso de todos los días, la Sra. Rosa desde muy temprano  se dedica a la venta de productos de abarrotes que vende en su bodega. y así poder salir  adelante y prosperar como pequeña comerciante. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en compras de de abarrotes y frutas para su posterior venta. La Sra. Rosa está muy contenta  por el préstamo otorgado y agrádese  el interés brindado y la confianza que han depositado en ella, deja la promesa de seguir superándose para mejorar la calidad de vida  de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Greetings from Peru, I am going to introduce you to a group comprised of eight members who have great business initiatives. They are known as the Santa Ana communal bank. One of the members is Rosa, 31 years old. She is a single mother of a son, who is her motivation to fight and progress every day. Rosa works by selling grocery products beginning very early in the morning. She sells them from her grocery store. This way, she can move forward and prosper as a small business owner. With her recent loan, she will invest in buying groceries and fruits to sell. Rosa is very happy with the loan she was awarded and is thankful for the interest and the confidence people have put in her. She promises to continue excelling in order to improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to invest in buying groceries and fruits.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José de 46 años de edad, originario de la Comarca Asedades, en  las afueras de Teustepe,  casado, padre de 3 hijos entre las edades de  12, 15 y 22 años, de oficio agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y trigo. Inicio su actividad agrícola  a la edad de 30 años, debido a que necesita un medio del cual subsistir poder salir adelante con su familia. Actualmente José es quien se encarga de darle mantenimiento a los potreros, pero no solo se encarga del cuido de las tierras, también siembra maíz, frijol y trigos, ordeña sus vaquitas, la cual ha ido comprando con las ganancias de su siembra. El dice que cuando saca  la cosecha  la vende en la misma comunidad para evitar gastos.
En esta ocasión José esta  solicita el financiamiento para comprar alimentos para el ganado como comida concentrada para ganado, melaza,  vitaminas y los insumos para la huerta. Ya que estima que este crédito le ayudaría  a comprar todos los productos necesarios para el cuido de sus animales y también podrá hacerle las reparaciones a las cercas para evitar que las vacas se pasen a la huerta. Sus planes futuros son una vez  que saque la cosecha cancelar el crédito y de las ganancias de la venta de su siembra comprar una planta de riego y una cortadora de pasto.
texts.en:
José is 46 years old and is originally from the region of Asedades, just outside of Teustepe. He is married, is the father of three children between the ages of 12, 15 and 22, and is a farmer who dedicates himself to planting corn and wheat. He began his agricultural activity when he was 30 years old because he needed a way to provide for his family. Today, José is in charge of maintaining his pastures, but he is not only in charge of taking care of the land; he also sows corn, beans and wheat and takes care of his cattle, which he has been buying with his harvest earnings. He says that when he harvests his crops, he sells them in the same region in order to minimize costs.

José is applying for financial aid to buy feed for his livestock, such as concentrated livestock feed, molasses, vitamins, and other supplies for his farm. He feels that this loan will help him buy all the necessary products to be able to take care of his animals and will also allow him to repair his fence to keep his cattle from escaping. His future plans include paying off the loan after selling his harvest, and with the remaining earnings buy an irrigation system and a lawn mower.

loans.use: to buy feed for his livestock such as concentrated livestock feed, molasses and vitamins, as well as other supplies need for his farm.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is single. She is 42 years old and lives in Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Ruth sells snacks and vegetables to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns 4,200 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to purchase more stock of fruits and vegetables.

Ruth has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Ruth hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Hemanta Kumar

texts.en: Hemanta Kumar is a 41-year-old differently-able person living with his wife and a child who is in school. He has a tea and food stall in his village. He sells tea, some local snacks like samosas (fried dough stuffed with potato curry), idli (a popular recipe of south Indian origin made by steaming a batter consisting of fermented black lentils and rice), wada (lentil doughnut), etc. He earns 5000 Indian rupees (INR), which is used for his household expenditures. Hemanta Kumar wants to repair his food stall and purchase some furniture (benches and table) to seat his customers. He also needs ingredients like potato, flour, spices, oil, etc., and utensils like plates, spoons, etc. He will attract customers and increase his monthly income. He has requested a loan of 20,000 INR to fulfill his requirements. He says that he can earn 6,000 to 7,000 INR per month in this way and would be able to construct a house for his family.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing furniture, plates, spoons, flours, spices, oil, potatoes, etc., for his snacks stall

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 49 years old, married and has four children. Brenda’s husband runs a vulcanizing shop in their village. Brenda’s oldest child is working abroad as an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker). She receives monthly remittances from her child who is abroad. Brenda doesn't want to rely only on her child's remittance, which is why she engages in the retail business.

Brenda has her sari-sari store business. She sells eggs, noodles and condiments. She wants to extend her business but she can’t pursue it because she doesn't have enough capital. Brenda is asking for a loan of P50,000 to buy can goods, soft drinks and breads. She hopes to increase her income and be able to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy can goods, soft drinks and breads.

loans.name: Leonitha

texts.en:
Leonitha is 33 years old. She is married to a house builder. Together, they have one child, aged six. 

Leonitha sells maize flour and has been in the business for the past seven years. With the loan, she wants to buy more maize flour, cooking oil and beans to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more maize flour, cooking oil and beans to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace has a sari-sari store in which she sells grocery items like spices, snack foods and condiments. She has been in this type of business for 20 years. Grace's goal in life is to make her business grow. 

Grace is now 43 years of age, is married and has two children attending school. She works hard and manages her business well to earn income and be able to meet her children's needs in school. 

Grace wants to sell grocery items that are seldom for sale in their village to increase her profit. Grace wants to borrow 50,000 PHP to buy beverages, sandwich spread and powdered juice. She believes that this loan will help her hit her goal in life and continue to meet her children's needs as well.

loans.use: to buy beverages, sandwich spread and powdered juice.

loans.name: Graciana

texts.en:
Graciana is a 52-year-old married woman from Dauis, Bohol. She has six grown children. She owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells commodities like canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, beverages and noodles. She has been in the sari-sari store for five years. 

Graciana has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy more items to sell, like canned goods, soft drinks, beverages and soaps. In the future, Graciana would like to invest in other business ventures to support her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, like canned goods, soft drinks, beverages and soaps

loans.name: Christelle

texts.en: Christelle is 31 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for one year. She has requested a loan to buy more rice and maize flour to sell. With the profits from the business, she plans to accumulate more savings and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more rice and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman from Panglao, Bohol. She has five children. The eldest is 28 years old and the youngest is 11 years old. 

Elizabeth has engaged in food vending for about 15 years now. She makes puto (a classic steamed Filipino rice muffin) and bibingka (a native Filipino rice cake, a mixture of rice flour, coconut cream, coconut wine (tuba) and sugar, mixed together and cooked in an oven). These are the traditional snack foods in the Philippines. Elizabeth earns about 8,000 PHP per month. This is the source of her income.

Elizabeth is requesting a loan to buy rice flour, coconut, and sugar. These are the ingredients needed for making puto and bibingka. With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy all those ingredients and make puto and bibingka to sell in her local community.

In the future, Elizabeth hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rice flour, coconut, and sugar

loans.name: Arlette Roberta

texts.es:
Doña Arlette, nació en la cuidad de la Flores, Masaya, casada, comerciante desde hace 4 años, tiene la edad de 39 años, su núcleo familiar es de 3 personas, su esposo y un niño.
 
 La señora posee un pequeño tramo en el mercado municipal de la cuidad,  donde comercializa ropa para niños, mosquiteros cubre colchones entre otros, Sus ventas las realiza a los visitantes del mercado y su compras las efectúa en la capital en el mercado oriental, cuidad a la que tiene que viajar dos veces al mes. 

Ella también cuenta con el  apoyo de su esposo ya que el posee un pequeño negocio de venta de Disco, entre los dos han sacado adelante su hogar y su hijo que esta en formación escolar.

Esta solicitando un financiamiento para invertir en ropa escolar ya que en esta temporada se mejoran las ventas por el inicio del año escolar y así poder contar con variedad en sus productos ofertados, manifiesta que esta ayuda le permitirá crecer mas en su negocio y le dará mayores beneficios para su familia.
texts.en:
Dona Arlette, born in the city of Flores, Mayasa, is married and has been in sales for four years. She is 39 years old, and she has a three person family with her spouse and their son.

She has a small area in the city's principal market, where she sells clothing for children, mosquito nets, and mattress covers, among other things. She sells to visitors of the market and she buys her products in the eastern market, a city to which she has to travel two times per month.

She also counts on the support of her spouse, since he has a small store selling disks, and between the two of them they have been able to get ahead, both for their home and their son that is in school.

She is asking for a loan in order to invest in school clothes since sales improve in this season because of the beginning of the school year, and this way she will be able to count on a variety of product offerings, which will allow her to grow her business and give better benefits to her family.

loans.use: To buy school shirts, pants, sports outfits, underwear, and socks.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married with six children. Jocelyn is 44 years old and lives in Binuangan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Jocelyn sells dried fish and sausage to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan to purchase more stock for her dried fish and sausage.

Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her dried fish and sausage

loans.name: Benigna

texts.en:
Benigna is widowed with three children. Benigna is 58 years old and lives in Lower Langcangan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Benigna sells tires to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,800.00 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14,900 Pesos to purchase more materials for her business.

Benigna has been a member of PMPC for 12 years.  In the future, Benigna hope to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en: Pelagie is 43 years old. She sells food stuffs and has been in the business for four years. With this loan, she wants to buy more rice, sorghum and sugar to sell. With the profits from the business she will increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sorghum and sugar to sell

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is 71 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. Rosalinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase items such as powdered milk, bread, soft drinks, soap and other groceries. Rosalinda has been in her business for ten years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items such as powdered milk, bread, soft drinks, soap and other groceries.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is married with 6 children. Gina is 39 years old and lives in ZNAC, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte in the Philippines.

Gina is a farmer who grows crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, Gina  hopes to expand her garden to plant other crops and corn.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is a twenty three year old farmer in Ndaragwa county in Kenya where he lives and has been practicing mixed farming for the past ten years producing vegetables,horticultural products and milk which he sells at the local market in his area.

He is requesting a 60,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo which he will use to purchase a water pump and pipes for irrigation that will help him water his crops. This will provide him with more produce and thus more income to help uplift his standard of living. He will also use some of the money to support his family. He hopes to be able to produce french beans and vegetables in large scale in the next five years.

Drought and middle men are the major challenges in farming.

Josphat is very thankful to Juhudi Kilimo for providing him with the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump and water pipes

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina, age 40, raises pigs to earn an income. She has been engaged in this venture for two years. She and her husband have three children.

Agustina has supported her agricultural business with three previous loans from NWTF. She has requested a PhP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Agustina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Silvestre Giovanni

texts.es:
Silvestre es un joven de 28 años de edad,     vive en la calurosa y acogedora ciudad de Ica al lado de su esposa y de sus hijos, a quienes quiere muchísimo y por quienes  lucha cada día para poder brindarles una vida digna y sobre todo poder brindarles las oportunidades que él no tuvo. Silvestre trabaja desde muy pequeño debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres, es por ello que solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de ingeniería mecánica.

Día a día Silvestre trabaja como chofer de taxi, el labora alrededor de 10 horas al día ya que es su único trabajo y con él puede solventar los gastos de su familia con mucho esfuerzo, el cree que sale está saliendo adelante porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque se esfuerza para dar lo mejor cada día.

Silvestre está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado él, podrá realizar un mantenimiento general a su vehículo con lo cual podrá tener mayor seguridad al conducir y sus clientes tengan más confianza en  solicitar sus servicios y poder mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”  Darle una buena educación a su hijo y tener otro auto para trabajar”.
texts.en:
Silvestre is a 28-year-old young man. He lives in the hot and welcoming city of Ica, along with his spouse and their children, whom he loves very much and for whom he fights every day in order to bring them a dignified life, and above all to bring them the kinds of opportunities that he never had. Silvestre has worked since he was very young because of the limited economic resources of his parents. Because of this, he was only able to study until the fifth grade of secondary school, but he would have liked to have a career in mechanical engineering.

Day to day, Silvestre works as a chauffeur of a taxi. He works about 10 hours per day, since this is his only work and with it he can pay the bills of his family if he works hard. He believes that he is successful because he is very friendly with his clients and above all because he works hard to give his best every day. 

Silvestre is very thankful for the Kiva loans, since, thanks to the support that they have brought, he has been able to maintain his vehicle, which makes driving safer, and his clients have more confidence in asking for his services. This way, he has been able to increase his income and continue fighting for his biggest dream: giving a good education to his son and buy another car for work.

loans.use: to maintain and repair his vehicle

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen, a 30-year-old married mother of four, is from Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She has been operating a specialized retail ice cream business for the past five years and earns 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. 

In 2008, Helen joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 14,500 PHP, which she will use to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her product. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her ice cream product.

loans.name: Santa Ana De Los Olivos Group

texts.es:
¡Saludos desde Perú! Este es el  grupo Santa Ana  de los Olivos

Este grupo empieza su segundo ciclo. Nora de 59 años es una de las socias de la alcancía y tiene el cargo de presidenta, tiene un hijo mayor de edad que vive con ella. Nora tiene un taller de costura donde se dedica a la confección de ropa y venta de mercería, trabaja diariamente alrededor de 10 horas, empezó a trabajar desde muy joven y se perfecciono estudiando costura, son 10 años que continua trabajando en este oficio y le va muy bien porque tiene muchos clientas que siempre acuden a su negocio para confeccionarse diferentes prendas y realizar algunos arreglos a sus prendas. Nora se siente feliz porque su trabajo le ha permitido ayudar a su hijo y darle estudios, mas adelante  desearía contar con un local propio donde poner su taller ya que por ahora esta alquilando el espacio donde trabaja, gracias a sus préstamos está surgiendo, su nuevo crédito lo destinara para la compra telas, hilos y materiales de confección..
Nora quiere agradecer a los inversores de KIVA por permitir su préstamo y el de su alcancía comunal, en la foto es la que viste polo color negro.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru! This is the Santa Ana de los Olivos group. This group is beginning its second cycle. Nora is 59 years old and is one of the partners in the group, serving as president. She has an adult son that lives with her. Nora has a sewing workshop where she makes a living by making clothing and selling haberdashery. She works 10 hours a day, and began working when she was very young, studying and improving her sewing. She has been working in this function for 10 years and it is going well because she has a lot of clients that always come to her business for sewing, clothing, and to get their clothing tailored. Nora is happy because her work has allowed her to help her son and give him an education. In the future she hopes to own a place where she can have her workshop, as for now she is renting the space where she works. Thanks to her loans she is emerging. Her new loan will be destined for buying fabric, thread and sewing materials.

Nora wants to thanks the Kiva investors for allowing her loan and that of her communal group. She is wearing a black shirt in the picture.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and sewing materials.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Don Miguel, de 78 años de edad, un humilde habitante de la  Comarca el Empalme de Boaco, casado, padre de 6 hijos todos son independiente, solo uno de nueve años esta a su cargo, de oficio comerciante, es dueño de una pulpería desde hace mas de 10 años. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio con capital propio, dinero que adquirió de su anterior trabajo, el cual lo fue invirtiendo poco a poco en su pulpería, ya que el dice que le va muy bien en su negocio porque le genera ganancias a diarias, y cuenta con clientes fijos, este ha sido su primer negocio, el recibe otros ingresos como es la pensión que recibe del INSS, sus expectativas es seguir ampliando su negocio.
El esta requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar arroz, azúcar, frijoles, jabón, gaseosa, etc. Con el objetivo de agregar más productos al inventario de su pulpería, para incrementar sus ventas y  obtener mejores ingresos
texts.en:
Don Miguel, who is 78 years old, is a humble member of the Comarca el Empalme de Boaco. He is married, a father of six children who are all independent, , only one of nine years is under his care. He works in sales, and has owned a store for about 10 years. He started in sales with his own money, which he had acquired from his previous work, which he had invested little by little in his store. He says that it has been going very well, since he makes money every day, and has fixed customers. This has been his first business. He receives other income such as his pension, which he receives from INSS. His goal is to continue expanding his business.

He needs a loan in order to buy rice, sugar, beans, soap, beverages, etc, with the objective of adding more products to his inventory in order to increase his sales and make more money.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, soap, beverages, etc. for his general store.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru: Светлана выращивает ранние и поздние овощи в теплицах - помидоры, огурцы, перец, редис. Она занимается этим уже 15 лет. Светлана целеустремленная и трудолюбивая. Она постоянно расширяет свой бизнес. Светлана просит предоставить ей кредит для ремонта теплиц, покупки пленки и семян.
texts.en: Svetlana grows early and late varieties of greenhouse vegetables: tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers, and radishes. She has been in this business for 15 years. Svetlana is goal-oriented and hard-working. She keeps expanding her business. Svetlana is requesting a loan to renovate her greenhouses and buy greenhouse film and seeds.

loans.use: to renovate her greenhouse and buy greenhouse film and seeds.

loans.name: Francisca Marisol

texts.es:
Francisca Marisol de 40 años de edad, madre soltera con un hijo de 10 anos. Es originaria de la Paz Centro, lugar  que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país.  La paz Centro de caracteriza por sus comidas típicas, como el quesillo y  el tiste. Lamentablemente Francisca no pudo cursar una carrera Universitaria por falta de recursos económica pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar Enfermería titulada.
Gracias a su espíritu de emprendedor y sus ganas de salir adelante es que tiene por actividad económica la venta de repostería y pasteles, como pico, cachos, totas de pasa, dedos, rin, pan de especies, torta de leche. Desde hace 4 anos ubicado en su casa de habitación. En la foto observamos a la sra. Francisca preparando la masa del pan para elaborar sus reposterias. La rutina de ella es trabajar unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta materia prima como arina,azucar,manteca,lecha,levadura. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano  pueda  obtener mejores ingresos.  Francisca Marisol agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Francisca Marisol, who is 40 years old, is a single mother with a 10-year-old son. She is originally from Paz Centro, an area that was located in the western part of the country. Paz Centro is known for its food, such as the quesillo and the tiste. Sadly, Francisca could not pursue an educational career because of a lack of economic resources, but she would have liked to become a registered nurse.

Thanks to the entrepreneurial spirit and her will to get ahead, she earns money by selling sweets and cakes, such as candies, lollipops, spiced bread, and torta with milk. She has been doing this out of her house for four years. The the photo, we can see her preparing the dough for the bread in order to make her cakes. The routine for her is to work some 10 hours per day offering her product. The objective of the loan is to invest in the working capital and supply  her business in the purchase and sale of materials such as flour, sugar, butter, milk, and yeast, so that in the not-so-distant future she will be able to earn a higher income. Francisca Marisol is thankful for the help of the people who loan through Kiva, who bring people the resources they need to earn a dignified living.

loans.use: To invest in working capital with the purchase of materials needed for her confectionery such as flour, sugar, butter, milk, and yeast.

loans.name: Zenelia Elvira

texts.es:
Zenelia Elvira de 47 años de edad, casada con hijos mayores de edad. Originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. En sus ratos libres le gusta mucho ir al cine y ver películas. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, por falta de recursos económicos, la cual la obligo a trabajar desde muy temprana edad. Pero le hubiera gustado mucho ser médico.
Gracias a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante es que tiene por actividad económica la venta mercadería en general la cual consisten en vender pantalones, camisas, camisetas, short, vestidos, pijamas, ropa de cama, juegos de toallas, prendas de plata y oro, cosméticos. Desde hace 12 anos que desempeña dicha actividad, de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación. Su rutina de trabajo es unas 9 horas diarias, recorriendo las calles de su localidad, con un bulto de unos 20 kg ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de mercadería, para que en un futuro no muy lejano poder obtener mejores ingresos. Zenelia Elvira agradece la ayuda de los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre económicamente como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Zenelia Elvira, 47 years old, is married with grown children. She is originally from Leon, a place that is located in the western part of the country. In her free time, she likes to go to the movies. Sadly, she was unable to pursue an educational career for lack of economic resources, which meant that she had to work from a very young age. She would have liked to have been a doctor.

Thanks to her spirit and her will to succeed, she earns a living through the sale of general merchandise, such as pants, shirts, blouses, shorts, jackets, pajamas, bedclothes, sets of towels, gold and silver jewelry, and makeup. She has been doing this activity for 12 years, going door-to-door and also selling out of her house. Her routine is to work some nine hours per day, walking the streets of her area with a bag of 20kg worth of her products. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and grow the business through the purchase of merchandise, so that in the not-so-distant future she will have a better income. Zenelia Elvira is thankful for the help of the Kiva lenders who provide people with resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can earn a dignified living.

loans.use: to invest in general merchandise, such as pants, shirts, blouses, shorts, jackets, pajamas, bedclothes, sets of towels, gold and silver jewelry, and makeup

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is 46 years old and lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children.

Dinah is engaged in the dried fish vending business and earns approximately 2,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in the redeeming of their pawned parcel coconut land.

Dinah has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years. In the future, Dinah hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To be used in the redeeming of their pawned parcel coconut land.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 42 years old, married and has five children, two of whom are in school.

Elena is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Elena requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elena has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed from NWTF four times in the past from to sustain it.

In the future, Elena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is 58 years old and lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

Leonor is engaged in copra (dried coconut meat) buying business, and earns approximately PHP1,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional copra for resale. 

Leonor has been a member of PMPC for almost six years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional copra (dried coconut meat) for resale.

loans.name: Hermogene Pablo

texts.es: Hermogene ,49 años es de la comarca Cerro de piedra, Teustepe municipio de Boaco,  casado tiene 4 hijas de las cuales solo una estudia el 2do año de la carrera de Ingeniería en computación  en Managua la capital, el de oficio agricultor  se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol también compra y vende cuajadas y huevos  de gallinas. El dice que cuando el inicio a trabajar lo hacía como peón en una finca  y el dinero que ganaba lo ahorraba para comprar su primera vaquita posterior mente el hijo del patrón a quien trabajaba le fue vendiendo pedacitos de tierra. Hoy en día  poco a poco ha comprado su  tierra para sembrar maíz también ha ido comprando sus vaquitas su  cosecha de  maíz y frijol lo lleva a vender a Managua pues  le pagan mejor el grano. Hoy  solicita financiamiento para comprar  terneros para engordarlos y con un buen cuido llegar a obtener un poco más  de ganancia al venderlos. Uno de sus planes  después que pague este crédito  sacar otro crédito para comprar dos vacas paridas,   limpiar un terreno que tiene a orillas del rio para sembrar maíz de riego y venderlo en elote para buscar un poco mas de ganancia y poder pagarle los estudios  a su hija.
texts.en:
Hermogene is forty-nine years old and is from the region of stone hills, Teustepe, in the municipiality of Boaco.  He is married and has four daughters; only one is studying, and she is in her second year in a computer engineering degree in the capital city of Managua.  

He works in agriculture, and makes a living in planting corn and beans.  He also buys and sells cheese curds and chicken eggs.  He says that when he began to work, he started off as a laborer on a farm, and he saved the money that he earned to buy his first small cow.  Afterwards, the son of the man for whom he was working was selling pieces of land.  Today, little by little he has bought land in order to plant corn, and he has also continued to buy calves.  He brings his corn and bean harvest to Managua to sell, since he can get better prices there.  

Today he asks for financing in order to buy calves for fattening; with good care, he will make more of a profit from them when he sells them.

One of his plans for after he pays back this loan, is to take out another loan in order to buy two dairy cows.  He also wants to buy a plot of land on a river bank to plant irrigation corn, and to sell it by the ear in order to make more profits and to be able to pay for the studies of his daughter.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is 31 years old. She sells cooking oil, charcoal and beans. With the loan, Jeannette will add more foodstuffs to her store to sell, such as beans and maize flour. With the profits from the business, she will make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more beans and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 34. She sells foodstuffs and has for three years. She would like to get the loan to buy more rice and corn flour for sale. With the profits from the business, she will make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more rice and corn flour to sell.

loans.name: Erdenesuren

texts.en:
Mr.Erdenesuren is 56 years old, and lives with his wife in a ger in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife, Surenjav, is 55 and works at the state library as a librarian. 

He has helped his son run his business (a retail toy store) in a rental counter at the local market. He has gained much experience in dealing with customers and suppliers over the years. 

He is now planning to start his own business (curtain retailing) in the local market. He is requesting 2,000,000MNT to purchase a starting inventory for his business. 

He is a hardworking, responsible, and modest man.

loans.use: to purchase a starting inventory for his curtain retail business.

loans.name: Purna Chandra

texts.en:
Purna Chandra is a 49-year-old differently-able person living with his wife and a child in the village of Puri, a sacred place, in Odisha, India. He owns and manages a small fruit stall in a market near his village. He sells apples, oranges, bananas, grapes and other seasonal fruits from his stall. He earns 9,000 Indian rupees (INR) per month from this business, which is not sufficient for his family.

Purna Chandra has a plan to expand his shop by renovating it and keeping more stock of seasonal fruits in the shop. He has applied for a loan of 20,000 INR to do this. He wants to save some money for future unfortunates.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing seasonal fruits like apples, oranges, bananas, grapes, etc., for his fruit stall.

loans.name: Marie Grace

texts.en:
Marie Grace is 37 years old. She sells charcoal and vegetables, and she has been in this business for three years. She is married, and blessed with four children. Three of them are enrolled in school. 

She wants this loan to buy more charcoal and vegetables to resell. She will reinvest her profits in her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Vasiliy

texts.ru:
Василий – из села Водяное. Он проживает там с супругой и двумя взрослыми детьми. Василий занимается выращиванием ранних овощей, помидор и редиса. Он имеет большой участок земли, на котором держит три большие теплицы и еще две теплицы для рассады. 

Благодаря предыдущему КИВА кредиту Василий подготовился к сезону и получил хорошу прибыль. Часть прибыли Василий вложил в бизнес и купил котел для отопления. Сейчас ему нужны дополнительные средства, чтобы купить и провести трубы для отопления теплиц и купить мотор.

Внуку Василия (ему 4 годика) недавно сделали операцию. Все прошло успешно, ребенок уже здоров.
texts.en:
Vasiliy is from the village of Vodyanoe, where he lives with his wife and two adult children. He grows early vegetables, tomatoes, and radishes. He owns a large plot of land, where he maintains three large greenhouses and two other greenhouses for transplanting. 

Thanks to his previous Kiva loan, Vasiliy was well prepared for his season and made a good profit. He invested a part of the profit in his business by purchasing a boiler for heating his greenhouse. Now he needs some additional funds to purchase and install pipes for the heating system and to purchase a motor. 

Vasiliy's 4-year-old granddaughter recently underwent an operation. Everything went well and she has already recovered.

loans.use: to purchase pipes for heating his greenhouse and a motor

loans.name: Raisa

texts.ru: Раиса выращивает овощи в теплицах. Она использовала кредит для того, чтобы сделать отопление на теплицу, а также сделать двойную пленку (дополнительную защиту от морозов), чтобы начать торговать пораньше по более выгодным ценам. Благодаря полученным доходам Раиса помогла сыну купить небольшой дом. Рядом с домом была старая теплица. Раиса с сыном сломали ее и на этом месте хотят построить новую. Для этого Раиса просит предоставить ей кредит 17,000 гривен.
texts.en:
Raisa grows vegetables in her greenhouse. She used a previous loan to install a heating system and a double layer of plastic sheeting, which provides extra protection against frost, in her greenhouse. She did all of this in order to be able to start selling earlier at more competitive prices. 

Thanks to the extra income from her previous loan, Raisa was able to buy her son a small home. There was an old greenhouse near the home. She and her son torn it down and now want to build a new one on the property. Hence, Raisa is requesting a 17,000 hryvnia.

loans.use: to build a large, new greenhouse

loans.name: Nikolay

texts.ru:
Николай занимается выращиванием овощей на своем участке уже 5 лет. В основном он выращивает помидоры, редис и огурцы. Он живет в Каменке, в своем доме. 

Осенью от сильного ветра повредилась пленка на теплице. Ее нужно менять. Никоалй просит дать ему кредит 24,000 гривен. Кроме замены пленки Николай хочет увеличить размер теплицы и доделать отопление. 

Никоалй помогает своей дочери и ее мужу осваивать тепличный бизнес.
texts.en: Nikolay has grown vegetables on his land for five years now. He mainly grows tomatoes, radishes, and cucumbers. He lives in Kamenka in his own home. In the fall, strong wind damaged the covering on his greenhouse and now he needs to replace it. Hence, Nikolay is requesting a 24,000 hryvnia loan. Additionally, he would like to increase the size of his greenhouse and add heating. He is currently helping his daughter and her husband learn the greenhouse business.

loans.use: to replace the covering on and complete the heating in his greenhouse.

loans.name: Trabajando En Armonia Group

texts.es:
Alejandrina es uno de los miembros del  grupo Trabajando en Armonía

Alejandrina tiene 52 años, es conviviente y tiene 04 hijos. Alejandrina se dedica a la venta de  confitería y helados, su pequeño negocio lo ha instalado en su casa donde tiene una vitrina con los productos que vende, en algunas oportunidades también sale a las calles a ofrecerlos, gracias a su trabajo ella puede ayudar en la manutención de su familia, sobretodo apoyar con los estudios de sus hijos; su trabajo es muy sacrificado porque camina mucho, son 12 horas diarias las que le dedica a su trabajo, fue su suegra quien le enseño a preparar los confites  que son muy ricos, sus fieles compradores son niños, transportistas y público en general. Alejandrina utilizara el dinero de su préstamo para comprar helados y los ingredientes para la seguir trabajando.
Alejandrina se siente feliz de que otras personas puedan ayudarla a ella y su grupo, agradece a KIVA por permitirles progresar y ser mejores personas, en la foto es la primera de la izquierda (en la parte de atrás) viste pantalón color celeste.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the group "Trabajando en Armonía" [Working in Harmony] and is 52 years old.  She is married (common-law) and has 4 children.  Alejandrina works selling candies and ice cream.  She has set up her small business in her house where she has a glass display of the products she sells.  Sometimes she also offers them as a street vendor.

Thanks to her work she can help support her family; more than anything help with the schooling of her children.  She sacrifices much for her work because she walks a lot and dedicates 12 hours a day to her work.  

She was taught how to make sweets by her mother-in-law, which are very good.  Her faithful customers are children, transportation workers, and the public in general.

Alejandrina will use this loan to buy ice cream and ingredients to make the sweets she sells and keep working.

Alejandrina is happy that other people are helping her and her group.  She is thankful to Kiva for allowing them to progress and be better people.  In this photo she is the first one on the left (towards the back) in the light blue pants.

loans.use: buy candy and ice cream ingredients

loans.name: Yajaira Celina

texts.es: Yajaira de 38 años de edad, originaria de la Comarcas las Banderas, en las afueras de Teustepe, casada, madre de 3 hijos entre las edades de 8, 13 y 14 años, actualmente los 3 están estudiando, de oficio comerciante, es dueña de una pulpería. Inicio su actividad laboral con capital propio, dinero que tenia ahorrado, cuando comenzó con su negocio no vendía mucho productos, luego con el tiempo fue invirtiendo cada centavo que hacia en la pulpería, fue asi que  poco a poco fueron incrementando sus ventas. Busco financiamiento para poder agregar otros productos que no tenían en inventario y que eran muy solicitados por sus clientes. Ella se siente muy satisfecha porque fue adquiriendo más clientela, con lo que ha podido obtener más ingresos. Se acerca la temporada escolar y es por eso que esta solicitando el financiamiento para comprar útiles escolares como cuadernos, lapiceros, mochila,  borrador, reglas, etc. sus planes futuros es ampliar su pulpería.
texts.en: 38 year old Yajaira is from Comarcas las Banderas in the outskirts of Teustepe. She is married, and is the mother of 3 children between the ages of 8, 13, and 14 years. They are all currently in school. She is in business and is the owner of a grocery store. She started her business with her own capital, money that she had saved. When she opened the store, she didn't sell many products. Later, with time, she invested every cent that she had in the store and, little by little, her sales increased. She is seeking a loan so that she can add other products that she hasn't had before, and that are often requested by her customers, to her inventory. She feels very satisfied as she has been gaining more customers and so she has been able to earn more income. The school year is nearly here, and this is why she is requesting the loan to buy school supplies such as notebooks, ballpoint pens, backpacks, erasers, rulers, etc. Her future plan is to grow her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy school supplies such as notebooks, ballpoint pens, backpacks, erasers, rulers, etc.

loans.name: S Sudarsan

texts.en: S. Sudarsan is a physically challenged person, age 33. He lives with his wife and his only child, who is in school. He manages a betel-cum-variety shop in his village. He sells betel; packaged foods, like biscuits, cake, etc.; soap of different brands; detergent; shampoo; talc powder; face wash; body lotion; etc. Because there is only one variety shop in his village, all the villagers depend on his shop for their daily necessities, but he is not able to fulfill all his customers' demands. S. Sudarsan requested a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase more stock of what he sells now and a few more new products like cooking oil, lentils, noodles, etc. He hopes to make his family happy and to provide a better education for his child by sending him to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase betel, biscuits, oil, lentils, noodles, talcum powder, detergents, etc., for his variety store.

loans.name: Maryori Madeleine

texts.es:
Maryori es una joven de 20 años, muy alegre y carismática y sobre todo con muchas ganas de salir adelante, ella vive en la ciudad de Camana, ciudad de cálido clima y posee playas hermosas las cuales son muy visitadas por muchos turistas. Ella es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, tal es así que trabaja desde muy joven y a pesar de las adversidades logro estudiar una carrera universitaria. Maryori también es una joven con talentos artísticos, tal es así que actualmente gracias a su bella voz ella trabaja en un conjunto musical, especialmente en un grupo de mariachis y con los frutos de su trabajo puede apoyar a su familia, ella trabaja principalmente los fines de semana en matrimonios, cumpleaños y otras actividades, ella cree que está saliendo adelante ya que le gusta lo que hace y porque es muy responsable.

Maryori está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le están brindando ella podrá comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, entre otros para poder realizar refacciones en las paredes de su vivienda, así ella podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su propio negocio”.
texts.en:
Maryori is a young woman of 20 years of age. She is very cheerful and charismatic and, above, really wants to get ahead. She lives in the city of Carmana, a city with a warm climate that has beautiful beaches that attract many tourists. She is a young woman who wants to succeed, so much so that she has worked since she was very young and, in spite of adversity, was able to attend university. Maryori is also a young woman with artistic talent, so much so that, currently, thanks to her beautiful voice, she is working in a musical group, a mariachi band. With the fruits of her labor, she can support her family. She works mostly at the weekend for weddings, birthdays, and other events. She believes that she is getting ahead because the customers like what she does and because she is very responsible. 
Maryori is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as, thanks to the support they have offered, she will be able to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, and more to make repairs to her parents house. In this way, she will be able to improve the family's standard of living and to continue striving to realize her greatest dream: to have her own business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Christian Jesus

texts.es:
Christian tiene 21 años es estudiante de Derecho en una universidad local
Christian escogió esta carrera por vocación ya que siempre se intereso por los derechos de las personas, ya lleva estudiando 4 años de los cuales le falta un año y medio para culminar su carrera, en sus horas libres trabaja como comerciante para ayudarse con la compra de materiales y libros que requiere su profesión, en el ínterin de su carrera, el obstáculo mayor es la parte económica que muchas veces lo ha desanimado, felizmente es su hijo quien lo alienta a seguir con sus propósitos y es el motivo principal para convertirse en un buen profesional, con el dinero de su préstamo podrá pagar las mensualidades de 02 ciclos en la universidad, también está buscando realizar sus practican en algún estudio jurídico lo que espera concretar muy pronto.
Christian quiere agradecer a los Inversionistas de KIVA por apoyarlo en su objetivo de convertirse en una mejor persona y un profesional prestigioso.
texts.en:
21 year-old Christian is a law student at a local university.
Christian sees this career as a vocation as he has always been interested in the people's rights. He has been studying for 4 years and has a year and a half left of his course. In his free time, he works in business to help him buy the materials and books that are required for his profession. The biggest obstacle to his career is the economic part, which has often left him discouraged. Happily, it is his son who encourages him to pursue his goals and who is his main motivation to become a good professional. He will use the money from the loan to make the monthly payments for 2 cycles in the university. He is also seeking a position in a law firm, and expect that to happen very soon.
Christian wants to thank the KIVA lenders for supporting him in his goal to become a better person and a prestigious professional.

loans.use: to make monthly payments.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 28 years old. She sells various items in her business. She has been in the business for the past three years. She wants a loan, to buy more sugar and biscuits to sell. The profits from the business will be to increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy more sugar and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Ganchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs.Ganchimeg is 30 years old and lives with her husband in a small house, in the Tolgoit area of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. She runs a butcher shop with her husband, Monhbaatar, at a rental counter of the local market. Ganchimeg and her husband have been in the butcher shop business for two years. They purchase meat and cattle from herders in the countryside, and sell to local customers at their counter.

They need their own vehicle, to reduce their transportation costs. Now Ganchimeg is requesting to borrow 4,000,000 MNT to purchase an eco-friendly, electric and gas-consuming car, to run their business with higher efficiency. Both borrower and her husband are hard-working and open-minded people.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly, electric and gas-consuming car, to run their business with greater efficiency

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 35 years old and a farmer in Kisii county in Kenya where she lives with her husband and four children. Three of her children have started schooling. She has been farming for the past fifteen years producing milk, maize and beans which she sells at the local market in her area.

She is requesting for 62,400 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow that will provide her with more milk for sale and earn her extra income. She will use this income to improve her living standards and pay for her children’s schooling. She aspires to buy another dairy cow in the next five years.

Fluctuation of prices and too much rainfall are her major challenges in farming.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing to resell

loans.name: Surrayia's Group

texts.en:
Ms.Surriya is a 36 year old woman. Her husband is a taxi driver and she is the mother of 3 sons and 3 daughters. 

She is a very hard working tailor by profession and has excellent skills in stitching female clothing. Due to financial issues, she has started her tailoring business by purchasing a sewing machine. Since 2005 Surriya has been operating this business very efficiently. She is interested in expanding her business by purchasing one more sewing machine. Surriya, as a member of 3-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan.

She is hopeful that the loan will help her to increase her net income and savings.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Gantsetseg

texts.en: Mrs.Gantsetseg is 35 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children in a small house in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her husband Myagmarbaatar is 36 years old and runs a small animal pelt retail business in a local market. Zagadzusem, age 15 and Tsend-Ayush, age 10 go to local schools. Her twin sons Tormonh and Monhtor are 2 years old and go to local kindergarten. The borrower has been working as a saleswoman in a local market for 12 years and now she is planning to start her own butcher shop at a rented counter of the local market. She is now requesting 3,000,000MNT to purchase meat products for her butcher shop. She is a hardworking and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase meat products for her newly started butcher shop

loans.name: Libertadores Group

texts.es: Saludos desde Perú,  les presento  a un grupo conformado por 10 integrantes  con gran iniciativa para los negocios, así se caracteriza el grupo comunal “Libertadores”. Una de  los integrantes  es la Sra. Ana de 52 años de edad  y madre de 3 hijo, el cual son  su  motivo de superación diaria, la Sra. Ana desde muy temprano  se dedica a la venta  de verduras  que vende en un pequeño mercado. Para  así poder salir  adelante y prosperar como pequeña comerciante. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en compras de verduras tales como papa lechuga y otros tubérculos,  para su posterior venta. La Sra. Ana está muy contenta  por el préstamo otorgado y agrádese  el interés brindado y la confianza que han depositado en ella, deja la promesa de seguir superándose para mejorar la calidad de vida  de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Greetings from Peru! I present to you a loan group comprised of 10 members who have great business initiative. This how is the community group Libertadores can be described. One of the members is 52 year old Ana, mother of 3 children who are her main motivation to succeed every day. Ana has been selling vegetables for a long time and she sells them in the little market. In this way, she can get ahead and prosper as a small-businesswoman. She will use the loan to buy vegetables such as potatoes, lettuces, and other tubers and she will sell them later. Ana is very happy with the loan awarded to her and the interest that is offered and the confidence that has been placed in her. She makes a promise to continue overcoming difficulties to improve the quality of life for her and for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as potatoes, lettuce, and other tubers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Delio

texts.en: Delio is a 44-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has six young children. He is into fishing. He catches fish, crabs, shrimps and sea shells. He has been in the fishing business for 15 years. Delio requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy fishing materials like fishnets, crab nets and fuel for his motorboat, which is very helpful for his fishing activity as his source of livelihood. Delio works hard to support his family. In the future, Delio would like to invest in other ventures in order to save as well as to send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishnets, crab nets and fuel for his motorboat

loans.name: Bajram

texts.en:
Bajram is in his early 60s and a Roma man, who was widowed nearly twenty years ago, when his only child was two-and-a-half years old. Bajram lived and worked in Greece for almost 10 years, accompanied by his son. For the most recent ten years, they both have been living in their city in south-central Albania, in their community.

Bajram has been offering transportation services to members of his community, with his own cart and horses. “It has been profitable, and I have been enjoying this activity, too. It’s beautiful!  It’s kind of traditional in our Romani community,” Bajram said. 

“For all these past years, my only goal was to raise my son, and now that I feel I have accomplished that, I'd like to improve our living conditions. It’s about time, yet I know that I can’t achieve this without lenders' support,” he ended his conversation.

loans.use: To make repairs to the family home

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en: Donatha is a mother of five children, ages seven to twelve. Two of them are adopted. And they all go to school. She sells foodstuffs, and she has spent eight years in the business. With the loan, she wants to buy more foods to resell, like potatoes, rice and maize flour. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: To buy more foods to resell, like potatoes, rice and maize flour

loans.name: Juan Sixto

texts.es:
Sixto tiene 43 años de edad, pero tiene la alegría y el espíritu de un joven de 20 años, el vive en la ciudad de Camaná, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de arroz, y también podemos apreciar una gastronomía variada en especial uno de sus platillos favoritos es el riquísimo “Chupe de camarones”. Sixto aprendió a trabajar desde muy joven ya que  sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos y debido a ello solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria.

Día a día Sixto trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, con su trabajo puede solventar los gastos propios del hogar  con mucho esfuerzo, el labora alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 cliente diariamente; él cree que está saliendo adelante con su trabajo porque es responsable y amable con los clientes.

Sixto está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá   comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, hormigón, arena, entre otros  con lo cual podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda  como refacción de paredes, mejoramiento de pisos y tuberías, así podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una empresa de transportes”.
texts.en:
Sixto is 43 years old, but he has the joy and spirt of a young man of 20. He lives in the city of Camaná, which is characterized by its warm a welcoming climate. There is a lot of agriculture here, particularly the cultivation of rice, and we can also appreciate the varied food. In particular, one of the favorite dishes of the area is the delicious shrimp soup. Sixto learned to work when he was very young as his parents had few economic resources and, because of this, he was only able to study up to the 5th grade of secondary school. 
Day in and day out, Sixto works as a motorcycle-taxi driver. Working hard at this job enables him to cover the household expenses. He works about 10 hours a day and may have 15 customers a day. He believes that he is doing well in his work because he is responsible and friendly to his customers. 
Sixto is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as, thanks to the help they have offered, he will be able to buy construction materials such as cement, concrete, sand, and other things with which he will make improvements to his home such as repairing the walls, and improving the floors and plumbing. In this way, he will be able to have a better quality of life and continue fighting to achieve his greatest dream: to have a transportation business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cake making and decorating equipment

loans.name: Shingirirai Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 52-year-old Stella from Masvingo. She is married and has six children. For the past 15 years, Stella has run a food business selling beef. She says that her main challenge is periods when business is generally low. Stella has requested a loan of 1,000 USD to buy beasts for slaughtering. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to pay fees and to buy food for her grandchildren. In the future, Stella wishes to buy a truck for easy transportation of beasts.

loans.use: To buy beasts for slaughtering

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 52-year-old farmer in Kisii county in Kenya, where she lives with her husband and five children. Only one of her children is still in school. She has been in farming for the past twelve years, producing milk and cereals that she sells at the local market. She buys and sells tea leaves as an additional source of income.
She is applying for a 62,400 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow, which will provide her with more milk for sale and earn her extra income, which she will use to uplift her living standards and pay for her children’s schooling. She aspires to have bought another dairy cow in the next five years. Diseases and fluctuation of prices are her major challenges in farming. She is thankful to Juhudi Kilimo for financing her with the loan.

loans.use: to buy and insure a cow for her dairy farm.

loans.name: Anita's Group

texts.en:
Anita lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is 36 years old, an independent woman. She is the mother of two children. Her husband is a government employee. Since 2005, Anita has been running her beauty salon. She has excellent beautician skills. She conducts this business in one room of her house. She needs to buy cosmetic products, including makeup kits, hair dryers and facial creams.
She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, as a member of a six-person borrowing group. She is hopeful that the loan will bring out a positive change in her income. She is thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Astrit

texts.en:
Astrit is 49 and lives in central Albania with his wife. For ten years now, Astrit has been doing woodworking and the clientele he has managed to build is stable and wide. “There is a lack of such services in my region, and this works perfectly in my end; more clients, more work for me. Yet, I do not take advantage; I still try to offer my very best services and quality as well as keep my clientele happy,” Astrit said.

Astrit is requesting a loan of 150,000 Albanian Lek which he will use to purchase wooden planks and machinery for his shop.

loans.use: to buy wooden planks and machinery for his shop.

loans.name: Stepan

texts.en: Stepan is 21-year-old student from Yerevan. He studies at Mkhitar Heratsi Yerevan State Medical University, in the economics department. Stepan lives with his mother, sister and older brother. Together with her children, Stepan's mother works hard to sustain her family and to cover her children's basic needs. She works as a teacher, but unfortunately her monthly income is enough only to make ends meet. So it is very hard for her to save money for Stepan's education. Stepan has applied for this loan to pay for university tuition. The loan is very important for him to complete his education and become a good economist.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition.

loans.name: Ricarte

texts.en:
Ricarte is a happy person, which is good for attracting costumers for his beauty salon business. Ricarte offers hair cutting, straightening, and some hair styling. (He also offers catering for all occasions.)  He has learned this type of business working for someone who has a beauty salon.

Ricarte has the passion to succeed. He is a helpful person, who always thinks about a better way of living of his parent, brothers and sisters as well. Ricarte’s customers encourage him to offer hair coloring. Hence, he is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy hair spa and hair coloring requisites.

 He hopes to continue to manage the business well and to earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy hair spa and hair coloring requisites.

loans.name: Gezim

texts.en:
Gezim is in his early sixties, married, and has three grown-up children. They all live in a suburb of a major city in the southwestern part of Albania where members of their Egyptian community live. He works hard to support his wife as well, since she has been paralyzed for a very long time.
Gezim repairs shoes, and he offers his services to everyone, not exclusively to his Egyptian community. He has been practicing his shoe-making activity for nearly thirty years and, in this way, he has been able to raise his children and support his wife, even though he has been the sole financial provider for his family.
“Gezim is the most good-natured and responsible person. You find him at his shop every day.” These were comments from one of his clients.

loans.use: to buy materials for his shoe-repair business.

loans.name: Judhistira

texts.en:
Judhistira is a 43-year-old physically challenged person living with his wife and three children in a village of Odisha. He has a vegetable shop in his village where he sells parwal, brinjal (egg plant), cabbage, cauliflower, lady finger [okra], cucumber, tomato, bitter gourd, etc. He has been involved in this business since 2003. He purchases the vegetables twice a week from the local market, which is nine kilometres from his village. In this way, he earns 5,000 Indian rupees (INR) per month from his business. The village people are benefited by purchasing vegetables from his shop, as there is no other vegetable shop in the village. He wants to expand his business by renovating his shop and adding a larger quantity of seasonal vegetables and, along with it, he also wants to add fruits as well.

Judhistira has requested a loan of 25,000 INR to purchase these products and renovate his shop so that he can meet the customers' demand. He will be able to earn 7,000 to 8,000 INR a month from this business. He has a dream to make a house for his family and give his children the best education.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing vegetables like parwal, brinjal (eggplant), cabbage, cauliflower, lady finger [okra], etc., and for renovating his vegetable shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for feed for his chickens.

loans.name: Progress Grp Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 39-year-old Merenziana from Masvingo. She is married and has four children, three attending school. She also cares for three dependents. For the past 5 years, Merenziana has run an agricultural business selling chickens. She says that her main challenge is that some chicks die at an early age. Merenziana has requested a loan of 400 USD to buy additional chicks and feed. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's general welfare. In the future, Merenziana plans to open a shop in town for selling chickens in bulk.

loans.use: to buy additional chicks

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is aged 34 years and a farmer in Kitale county, Kenya. She lives with her husband and five children; two of the children are still schooling. Joyce has been in farming for over ten years, producing eggs, bananas, sugarcane and milk, which she sells at the nearby market in her area.

She is requesting a 41,600 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. The cow will provide her with more milk for sale and earn her extra income, which will help her to improve her living standard and to pay for her children's schooling in the future. Joyce aspires to have bought a pick-up for transporting her produce, in the next five years.

Competition, pests and diseases are her major challenges in farming. She is very thankful to Juhudi Kilimo for offering the loan to her.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is 30 years old. She is married and has three kids. She has been running a business of selling babies' items, for two years. With the loan, she wants to buy more Pampers, towels and kids' clothes, for sale. She plans to use the profits for savings, to have a better store in the future.

loans.use: To buy more kids' clothes, towels and Pampers, for resale.

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 45 year old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. She has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her tailoring business. 

The loan will help her to expand her tailoring business, which she has been running very efficiently since 1998. She wants the financing to invest in purchasing a new sewing machine.  She believes in hard work and honesty. She is confident that the loan will bring positive changes to her business and will increase her profit.

Yasmeen has two buffaloes as well. She sells their milk in the market. With the profit, she wants to purchase one more buffalo to increase her milk selling business also. This will help her to increase her net income and savings. 

She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 41 years old and married with four children, who are all school-going.  He also has two dependents who are orphans living with him.

William started a small hardware shop in 1997 as his major source of income to look after the family.  He operates this business in the outskirts of Kagadi Town, and his major clients are residents of his village.

William wants a loan of 3,000,000 UGX (three million shillings) to buy more stock of cement and other hardware materials to meet the demand for  construction materials.  He anticipates getting more profits if he is funded.  He will also  be in a better position to educate his children as well as to put up a permanent house for the family.  However, his major challenge is the weather, most especially if it rains, making transportation difficult. There is also a lot of competition in the market.

William would like the lender to offer different loan products to help alleviate of poverty.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for his hardware shop.

loans.name: Bathsheba

texts.en:
Bathsheba is aged 29 years and a farmer in Kisii county, Kenya. She lives with her husband and two children, of whom one has started schooling. She has been in farming for the past six years, producing milk, maize and beans, which she sells at the local market in her area. She is employed as a clerk, for an additional source of income.

She is requesting a 62,400 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow.
