 In 2001, Adbulai established his cow meat business. He started the business to be self-reliant. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are men and women. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Adbulai has already received and successfully repaid three loans and now requires a new loan to increase his cow meat. He hopes that this loan can increase his stock and maximize the profit. In the future, Adbulai plans to open an outlet on the outskirts of town. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for cow meat.

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.es: Don Bonifacio un humilde señor de 64 años de edad, de oficio agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de maíz, frijol y trigo. Es cliente kiva  él está muy agradecido por su primer crédito  lo pudo invertir en la compra de insumo como fertilizantes, abonos  y pagar mano de obra en su siembra, de esta manera pudo incrementar su producción de cosecha para obtener mejores ganancias en su siembra. Es por esta razón que don Bonifacio está requiriendo de su segundo financiamiento para comprar animales como vaca y cerdo. Ya que el estima que este crédito le ayudaría a comprar los animales, para luego venderlos a un mejor precio, para obtener mejores ganancias en su negocio, con el objetivo de seguir invirtiendo en su siembra y  salir adelante con su familia, su meta próxima es  poder pagar este crédito para luego volver a solicitar otro.
texts.en: Bonifacio, a humble, 64 year old farmer, grows corn, beans and wheat.  He is a Kiva customer and is very grateful for his first loan, which he was able to invest in supplies such as fertiliser and to pay for labour for sowing the land.  Doing this, he was able to increase his harvest and earn more from his sown land.  Because of this, Bonifacio is applying for a second loan, to buy animals such as cows and pigs.  He thinks this loan would help him to buy animals that he can later sell on at a better price and earn more for his business.  He then aims to keep investing in his sown land and move forward with his family.  His next goal is to be able to pay back this loan so that he can later come back to apply for another one.

loans.use: to buy animals such as cows and pigs.

loans.name: Genaro Deciderio

texts.es: El señor Genaro, habita en el municipio de la Concepcion, su familia lo apoya en todas sus decisiones para lograr a si una mejor vivencia en el hogar, el ha trabajado la tierra desde hace mas de 15 años, y su mayor sueño es darle mejores condiciones de vida a su esposa e hijos, con este nuevo credito que se le ha otorgado comprar los insumos necesarios para darle mantenimiento a su cultivo de Cafe y asi mejorar la cosecha de este años ya que para evitar las plagas y el mal clima necesita invertir con los fertilizantes, Agradece le Apoyo y la canfianza que se le ha brindado.
texts.en: Genaro lives in the municipality of Concepcion.  His family supports him in all his decisions that will bring them a better life at home.  Genaro has been working the land for more than 15 years and his biggest dream is to give his wife and children the best living conditions possible.  This new loan that Genaro has been given is to buy the necessary supplies for maintaining his coffee plantation and so improve this year's harvest.  He needs to invest in fertilisers so as to avoid plagues and problems with the bad climate.  He is thankful for the help and trust that he is being given.

loans.use: to buy supplies for maintaining the land.

loans.name: Maria Teodora

texts.es: Maria, de oficio comerciante, habitante de la comarca Las Canoas, Teustepe, agradece la oportunidad que le brindo el crédito Kiva, le abrió la oportunidad de vender un poco más hacer más clientes. La Temporada escolar está por iniciar y la demanda de uniformes escolares es alta y es por eso que esta requiriendo financiamiento para comprar faldas, pantalones, camisetas, blusas y ropa interior para niños y adultos. Su es ofrecer más mercadería variada de ropa, cosméticos incluso artículos para el hogar y captas más clientes de diferentes comarcas.
texts.en: Maria, a trader living in the region of Las Canoas, Teustepe, is thankful for the opportunity that Kiva is providing.  This loan is giving her the chance to sell a little more and to have more customers.  The school year is about to start and demand for school uniforms is high.  For this reason, she needs money to buy skirts, trousers, shirts, blouses and underwear for children and adults.  Her goal is to offer a bigger variety of clothes and cosmetics, including items for the home and to attract more customers from different regions.

loans.use: to buy skirts, trousers, shirts, blouses and underwear for children and adults.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell in her fish vending business.

Lourdes has been in this business for three years. Lourdes earns additional income from her general store.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 39 years old and lives in Maloro, Tangub City. She is married with four children. 

Judith has a shop that sells groceries. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan to purchase stock for her store. 

Judith has been a member of PMPC for a year.  In the future, Judith hopes to improve her store and turn it into a supermarket.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her retail store.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Hawa. She is a widow and has five children aged 28, 24, 21, 12 and five. She has two additional dependents, who live with her this way she helps her younger sisters with their education. In 1981, Hawa established her local food stuff, imported rice, maggi and groundnut business. She began her business because she wants meet her personal needs and to take care of the home. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,192,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan of an amount of SLL 4,000,000. Hawa has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional imported rice. She hopes that this loan can improve the trade of imported rice. 

In the future, Hawa plans to see the business grow to become a provisions shop and also plans to be able to take care of her family needs with the profit. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bags of beans, bennie (sesame seed) and groundnuts to resell.

loans.name: Ishmael

texts.en:
This is thirty-four-year-old Ishmael. He is married, and has two children aged four and seven. In 2001, Ishmael established his used clothing business. He started his business with an uncle after dropping out of school and with the aim of being self-reliant. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are ladies and gents. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,975,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan of an amount of SLL 3,000,000. Ishmael has already received and successfully repaid four loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional ladies t-shirts and original shorts. He hopes that this loan will help the business by improving on the stock. 

In the future, Ishmael plans to improve and expand the business. The loan can help to increase the stock and maximize the profit. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Kadiatu.  She is married and has two children aged fourteen and sixteen. In 1992, Kadiatu established her motor bike spares business. She began her business because she wants to help her husband with running the home. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are mechanics and bike riders. 

Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,085,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of an amount of SLL 3,000,000. Kadiatu requires a loan in order to buy additional engine oil. She hopes that this loan can improve her sales of engine oil. 

In the future, Kadiatu plans to develop and have a concrete shop. She also plans to be able to have additional profit and increase the stock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy engine oil.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of three young children from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She is engaged in a retail business selling agricultural and veterinary supplies to the people in her place. She has been in the business for more than four years now. This is the source of her income.

Elma is asking for a loan to buy stock like feeds, pesticides, fertlizer, animal food supplements and others. With this, she will be able to cater for her buyers and sell more stock to them. In the future, Elma hopes to expand her business and save money for the schooling of her young children.

loans.use: to buy stock like feeds, pesticides, fertilizer, animal food supplements and others.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is 60 years old, married and works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Olivia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase fish to sell in her fish vending business.

Olivia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell in her business.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish and banana vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish and bananas to sell in her fish and banana vending business.

Andrea has been in this business for 19 years.

Andrea has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell in her fish vending business.

Ruth has been in this business for 10 years. Ruth earns additional income from dress making.

Ruth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Mernalyn

texts.en:
Mernalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell in her rice grain business.

Mernalyn has been in this business for nine years. Mernalyn earns additional income from selling ready to wear.

Mernalyn successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her busness buying and selling rice grains.

Mernalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Favio Luis

texts.es: Favio Luis es de la comarca La Laguna casado tiene dos hijas de 15 y 7 años de edad una hija ya estudia su 3er año de secundaria en un pueblo cercano a la comarca. Él se dedica a cultivar maíz y frijol desde los 15 años de edad ,  el se crio con su abuelo quien tenía ganado  le ayudaba a cuidar el ganado y su  abuelo le pagaba y con ese dinero fue ahorrando para posteriormente invertirlo en sus propias siembras de  maíz y frijol. Toda lo que cosecha lo vende en Managua la capital donde consigue mejor precio. Él está necesitando el crédito para comprar una vaquita. Dentro de sus planes esta comenzar a preparar la tierra para el ciclo de siembra de frijol y maíz.
texts.en:
Favio Luis is from the La Laguna district, he is married and has two daughters aged 15 and 7-years-old: One daughter is already in her 3rd year of secondary school in a nearby town  

Favio Luis has been making his living growing corn and beans a cultivar since 15, growing up with his grandfather who had cattle. He helped look after the cattle and his grandfather paid him and he saved this money to then invest it in his own corn and bean crops. He sells everything he harvests in Managua, the capital of Nicaragua, where he obtains better profits. He needs this loan to buy a cow. As part of his plans, Favio Luis is getting ready to prepare the land for the next corn and rice sowing season.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Amparo Leonor

texts.es:
La Sra. Amparo vive en Manta. Ella era una mujer que desde pequeña le gusto la costura y cuando cumplió la mayoría de edad empezó con su negocio hacde confeccionista. 

Ella confecciona vestidos, blusas, toda clase de ropa para mujer y lo realiza durante el día y cuando tiene bastante material lo realiza hasta en las noches. No está casada, es una mujer separada, tiene dos hijos que son menores de edad que estudian una escuela fiscal.

Con el prestamo quiere comprar telas y un a maquina de  coser par pacer otros tipos de confecciones. El sueño de Amparo con el préstamo es tener un taller grande y confeccionar cortinas, edredones y otros, para que a su familia no le falte nada. Y así poder tener mayores capitales.
texts.en:
Sra. Amparo lives in Manta. She enjoyed sewing as a young girl, so when she became an adult, she started her own sewing business. Amparo produces dresses, blouses, and all types of women’s clothing during the day. If she has enough material, then she will continue to work at night. Amparo is not married since she is separated from her spouse. She has two young children who attend a state school.

With this loan, she will buy fabrics and a sewing machine for making other types of items. As a result of this loan, Amparo dreams of having a larger workshop where she can produce curtains, bedspreads, and other products. She hopes to have more capital so that her family lacks nothing.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Oney Ulices

texts.es: Don Oney, tiene 34 años de edad, es casado, tiene tres hijos y vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Nueva Frontera.  Hace aproximadamente 23 años que Oney  tiene  su propio negocio de taller de reparación de bicicletas y venta de repuestos. El taller lo tiene en su casa y tiene su clientela formada. Ha tenido varios prestamos con ODEF, lo que le ha permitido mantenerlo estable y activo su negocio. Actualmente solicita el sexto préstamo que es por  12,000 Lempiras, con el cual va  surtir el negocio de repuestos para bicicletas como llantas, rines, neumáticos, pedales, cadenas, etc. Tanto para prestar el servicio de reparación, como para vender repuestos a  los clientes. Tiene como meta a futuro trasladar el taller en otro lugar para poder remodelar su casa.
texts.en:
Don Oney is 34 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in a neighborhood in the town of Nueva Frontera.

For approximately 23 years, Oney has been managing his own business where he repairs bicycles and sells spare parts. His workshop is located in his home and he has an established clientele. Oney has received several loans from ODEF, which has enabled him to maintain a stable and active business. He is currently requesting his sixth loan in the amount of 12,000 HNL so that he can restock his business with bicycle parts such as tires, rims, inner tubes, pedals, chains, and other items. This will allow him to provide repair services and also sell spare parts to his customers. His goal in the future is to move his workshop to another location so that he can remodel his house.

loans.use: to buy various bicycle parts to sell and to use in making repairs.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 71 years old, married, and has 9 children. She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for 12 years now, and has borrowed 24 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lindy

texts.en:
Lindy is 51 years old and married with 4 children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, canned goods, soap and noodles, etc.

She has been in this business for 3 years. In the future Lindy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, canned goods, soap and noodles.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than ten years now. This is the source of their income. Imelda is asking for a loan to buy additional fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets. With this, her husband will be able to increase his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Imelda hopes of making their business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money so that she can repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en: A 53-year-old farmer from Philippines, Perla has been engaged in a rice farming business for more than ten years now. She helps her husband in tilling their lands and in cultivating their field to plant rice. Perla needs a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, they will be able to improve their farming business and augment their income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 52 years old and married with 8 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buying and selling of dried coconut business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional dried coconut to sell.

She has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the dried coconut business for 7 years and also earns an income from raising livestock and food vending.

Leonora aspires to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried coconut to sell.

loans.name: Mylen

texts.en: Mylen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell. In the future, Mylen would like to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Virgildo

texts.en: Virgildo is a fisherman residing in Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. Virgildo wants to expand his fishing business but lacks the financial resources to do so. Because of this he joined CEVI to gain access to the loan programs offered by the organization to the micro-entrepreneurs like him. The loan will allow him to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets. Virgildo dreams of making his business a success and improving his way of living.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years. She earns more income from farming rice. Patricia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. 

She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to purchase stock to sell, like soap, shampoo, canned goods, spices, etc. for her general store business. Patricia hopes to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase stock to sell, like soap, shampoo, canned goods, spices, etc.

loans.name: Cinderella

texts.en: Cinderella is 37 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental. She is married with 4 children. Cinderella is engaged in a business of selling RTW (ready-to-wear) and earns approximately PHP1,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stocks of RTW to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Cinderella hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of RTW to sell.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en: Luzmindais 63 years old and lives in Villaflor, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Luzminda has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan to purchase fertilizer. She has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, she hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her to grow crops.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is married with 8 children. Ana is 40 years old and lives in Tula-an, Dolipos Bajo, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Ana sells fruits and vegetables to earn a living and has had this business for 25 years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000.00 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 4,000.00 to pay for a motorcycle.

Ana has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future Ana hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to pay for a motorcycle.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is married with two children; only one of her children goes to school. She has a secretarial bureau business which she has been involved in for  three years. 

She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 400,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of paper and cartridges. She generates additional income from knitting table cloths. She works seven days a week from a shop that she rents but sells on retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and piped electricity. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of paper and cartridges.

loans.name: Stand Up And Fight Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 44 year old Fadzayi from Mutare. She is married with three children, all attending school. She also cares for two additional dependents. 

Fadzayi runs a clothing business selling clothes and she also rents wedding gowns. The business has been in operation for 10 years. She says the main challenges faced are credit sales as some debtors sometimes fail to pay on time. 

Fadzayi has requested a loan of $1,000 to buy clothes for resale and boost her wedding gown rental busness. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will help in the payment of school fees. In the future Fadzayi plans to own a mini bus for business operations.

loans.use: to boost her wedding gown rental business and to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is married with four children; all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (a sister). She has a business selling clothes and has been in this business for six years. She sells to all categories of people but on retail basis five days a week. 

She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 500,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She moves door to door selling used clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality (the rainy season hinders her movements) and the ever-increasing prices of used clothes. 

She aspires to getting permanent business premises and also to become a wholesaler. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is married with five children; only two of her children go to school. She also takes care of an additional family member. She has a mini-bakery business; she has been in this business for five years selling to all categories of people but on wholesale only. She works from her home and works seven days a week. 

She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more baking flour, cooking oil and baking powder. Her major business challenges includes thieves and seasonality. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more baking flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Numfor

texts.en:
Numfor is married and blessed with two children who go to school.  The fact that she was unable to acquire a basic education because she did not go to school has made life very difficult for her. It is difficult for her to feed and educate her children. 

She was motivated to become a member of GHAPE by her friends and relatives who have been GHAPE members since 2003. Numfor has successfully borrowed and repaid loans six times. The profit from this loan helps her pay for her children's school fees and provide some basic food for the family.

She plans to buy piglets, pig feed and medicine for retail.  She knows her business is going to succeed because she has acquired some basic training in finance management and how to choose a good business from GHAPE. 
 
She plans to use the profit from this loan to pay tuition fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay for piglets, pig feed and medicine.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is married and a mother of two children. With a heavy responsibility on her husband to provide for her children and those of her the entire family, she decided to become a GHAPE member in 2008 so she can obtain a loan and continue with her dress-making activity to raise money and assist her husband in paying school fees and provide food for her children.

She was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline and since then has showed commitment in investing and repaying loans three times.

Given a loan, she plans to buy cloth, thread, electric iron and a sewing machine. She knows her activity will succeed because she has a ready market for her dresses and she has so many customers. She also says members of her community will obtain good dresses at very cheap prices. 
 
She plans to raise money to invest in an additional line of business and buy medicine for the family.

loans.use: to pay for cloth, thread, electric iron and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Tamufor

texts.en:
He was born on 21/06/1967, is married and a father of seven children, three of whom are still below 15 years of age. He lives with his family in a seven-room apartment in Bamenda, northwest region of Cameroon. 

He has encountered some major challenges in life such as the death of his uncle, being unable to sponsor his children in school and being unable to raise business capital. All these made life difficult for him. But now he has got a little bit of relief thanks to GHAPE. He came to know about GHAPE in 2009 after a long struggle to try and catch up with life.

He plans to invest his loan in the purchase electrical cables and in the production and sale of electrical appliances like distributors and switches. He is convinced the business will succeed because of the experience he has in this kind of business and also because he has a good business location. 

He plans to use the profit from his loan to pay tuition fees for his children and to improve the standard of living in his family. Most of the profit from the business will be plowed back into  to the business.

He prefers to receive a loan from GHAPE because the method of repayment is comfortable and convenient.

loans.use: to pay for electrical cables.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a single mother of five children, and all of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members, her elderly parents. She has a business which sells used clothing. Ruth has been in this business for 4 years. She applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes to sell. She works six days a week at the market and sells on a retail-only basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever increasing prices of used clothes. She aspires to import used clothes and to become a wholesaler. Ruth resides in her own house. The family has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Misael De Jesus

texts.es: Misael vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos menores de edad, Misael se dedica al trabajo de la siembra, cultivando maíz, frijol y sorgo, él es muy trabajador y dedicado a su oficio el cual desempeña desde hace muchos años atrás, cuenta con parcelas propias lo que le ayuda mucho ya que no debe pagar alquiler por ellas. Misael solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL,  para poder cumplir su meta la cual es aumentar la cantidad de granos que produce, con el préstamo podrá comprar: semillas para sembrar, herramientas para realizar su trabajo y pesticidas para el mantenimiento de las plantas. Misael es una persona muy responsable por lo que tiene muchos clientes y así mismo cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales algo que es muy positivo para su negocio.
texts.en: Misael lives with his wife and his minor children. Misael works planting and growing corn, beans and sorghum. He has done this for many years. He has his own land parcels, which is a big help because he doesn't have to pay rent to anyone else. Misael is asking INTEGRAL for a loan to be able to meet his goal of increasing the amount of grains he produces. With the loan he will be able to buy: seeds to plant, tools to do his job, and pesticides to maintain the plants. Misael is a very responsible person and he has a lot of customers as well as good personal references, something that is very positive for his business.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant.

loans.name: Suh

texts.en:
She was born on 05/09/1973, she is married and a mother of four children two of whom are below 15 years of age. Though married, she toils day and night to ensure the family live well. She and her family live in a two-room apartment in Bamenda, northwest region of Cameroon. 

She has encountered some major challenges in life such as the death of her uncle, being unable to sponsor her children in school and the theft of all her capital by thieves, which made her miserable. All this made life difficult for her. But now she has been a little bit relieved thanks to GHAPE. She came to know about GHAPE in 2002 after a long struggle and then began to catch up with life.

She plans to invest her loan in a restaurant and call-box business. She plans to buy rice, oil, beans, credit cards and a cell phone. She is convinced the business will succeed because of the experience she has in the business, and also because she has a good business site.

She plans to use the profit from her loan to pay for her children school fees and to improve the standard of living in her family. Most of the profit from the business will be plowed back into the business.

She prefers to receive a loan from GHAPE because the method of repayment is comfortable and convenient.

loans.use: to pay for rice, palm oil, beans, credit cards and a cell phone.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
She is a single mother with two children. Though not married, she is the bread-winner in the family. She lives in Musang, in the North West region of Cameroon. 
 
She has struggled in life to earn a living for her family. It was not easy for her to raise business capital until she saw GHAPE as a source of relief and became a beneficiary. This is her ninth year as a GHAPE member and her previous loan repayments were satisfactory. 

As a very hard-working lady, she plans to invest her loan in a buy and sell business and part of the loan will be spent on crop farming. She is highly convinced this business will succeed because she goes and buys from the “bush market” in bulk. Also she has good experience in business and has a good business location. 

She plans to use the profit from the business to pay for her children’s school fees, assist her younger brother to pay his apprentice fee, give good medication to her children whenever they are sick and also to ensure they are well fed. 
  
She prefers to receive loans from GHAPE because the rate of interest is low, the method of payment is comfortable and convenient and also because of the training GHAPE offers before disbursing her loan.

loans.use: to pay for palm oil, plantains, corn and seedlings.

loans.name: Medardo

texts.es: Medardo de 39 años de edad, es una persona responsable quien trabaja muy duro para llevar el sustento diario a su familia y de este mismo modo mantener su hogar. Medardo trabaja cultivando maíz, frijol y sorgo en su pequeña parcela, de lo cual comercializa con diferentes vendedores de granos básicos y así mismo destina una parte para el consumo diario lo que representa una gran ayuda para él. Medardo solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el cual pueda comprar semillas de maíz y frijoles para sembrar, depósitos y rociadores para colocar el pesticida y otras herramientas más que le ayuden a Medardo a hacer mejor su trabajo.
texts.en: Medardo is 39 years old. he is a responsible person who works very hard to bring home the daily bread to his family and support his home. Medardo works growing corn, beans and sorghum on his small land parcel. He sells them to different vendors of basic grains and sets aside a part for daily consumption, which is a big help for him. Medardo is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL to buy corn and bean seeds to plant, as well as tanks and sprayers to apply pesticide and other tools that help Medardo to do his job better.

loans.use: to buy sorghum seeds to plant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buying farming materials.

loans.name: Awah

texts.en:
He is married and has six children. Due to the fact that he is unable to take care of the family and needed capital to add to his farming activity, he joined GHAPE in 2005. Since then he has obtained and repaid loans five times.

His inability to get investment capital which could constantly generate income for him to meet his children’s needs is what motivated him to obtain a loan from GHAPE. He promises to provide pork meat to his community when he obtains his loan from GHAPE.

Given a loan, he plans to buy piglets, pig feed and seedlings. He knows this activity will succeed because he has been doing this activity for a very long period and his community will provide a ready market for his products. In addition, he has a large piece of land where he will construct a fenced enclosure for his piglets. 

He plans to use the profits generated from this activity to pay tuition fee for his children in school and also to cater for their basic needs.

loans.use: to pay for piglets, pig feed and seedlings.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is a single mother of three children; all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a business selling chips (Irish potato crisps). 

She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more Irish potatoes and cooking oil. She works at the market seven days a week and sells on retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to a fully stocked restaurant and also to build her own house. The family resides in a rented house and has access to electricity and piped water. Herr monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of Irish potatoes and cooking oil.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is aged 38, married and has four children all of whom attend school. He takes care of the family and to maintain them, he started an agricultural trade business dealing in the buying and selling of upland rice, Irish potatoes and corn. Moses also rears some cows at home which give him milk as an additional source of income for the family.

Moses has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 (one million and five hundred thousand shillings) to buy more produce to trade since the season is now and the prices are still low. He believes that after the season he will be in position to sell at a profit because the prices are likely to have increased. Moses' dream is to expand his business to a level where he will not have to keep borrowing.

Moses however has a challenge of bad weather which at times makes transport difficult, prices for agricultural products also fluctuate and sometimes he can not predict how much profits he will get.

loans.use: To buy rice, Irish potatoes and corn.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Getting fired was the best thing that ever happened to Patricia. It literally launched her career as an entrepreneur.

About 10 years ago, her boss at a San Antonio catering company fired her when she questioned him on a price quote for a high school graduation party.

He quoted the client $5,500 and the client could only afford a maximum of $5,000. He refused to budge on the price and the client took her business elsewhere. When Patricia challenged his decision, he fired her on the spot.

Soon after, the caterer also lost a lucrative wedding contract because the bride found out that Patricia had been fired. She decided to hire Patricia on her own. Later, the bride’s sister did the same thing, and not just for their weddings, but also for their eventual baby showers.

Thus – with a bit of drama – San Antonio Rentals & Party Planning was born.

Patricia’s business creates nearly any kind of event in her hometown of San Antonio and the surrounding area. Her business offers event planning, full-service catering, floristry, and complete beverage services. It also provides a wide variety of rentals: centerpieces, photo booths, margarita machines, place settings and stemware, round or rectangular tables, chairs, tents, dramatic lighting, linens and fountains of dark, milk or white chocolate, ranch or barbeque sauce, cheese, or salsas.

Previous to working at a catering business, Patricia worked as an event coordinator for hotels and a major airline, and when others saw her work, they began to ask for her help creating events within their budgets, and she did it with an economical eye.

Abundant creativity sets San Antonio Rentals & Party Planning apart. “If I have a box, I’ll decorate it and no one would know it is a box,” she says.  Because of her excellent reputation, Patricia enjoys a large number of repeat clients who also send her referrals. She says, “They enjoy the extra that we do for them.”

Besides herself, Patricia employs her husband and three full-time workers. On larger projects, she contracts others to help.

In order to purchase new equipment, china, dishware and utensils, Patricia returned to Accion Texas, Inc. for a loan. This is her third loan from Accion; her first was in 2011 after her father – a former Accion client – referred her to the nonprofit micro-lender. With each loan, Patricia purchases new inventory to improve sales. 

“If anyone has the opportunity to borrow money, I would highly recommend Accion for a start,” she says.

Feel free to check out Patricia’s websites to learn more about her event planning services (sapartyplanning.com), catering (endlesstaste.com), and fountains (theendlesschocolate.com).

loans.use: To purchase new equipment, china, dishware and utensils.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn and beans for planting

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, a married mother of six children, two of whom go to school, also takes care of an additional family member, her sister. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

For the past year Alice has been operating a retail shop that sells a variety of products seven days a week. She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 1,000,000 from MCDTSACCO to buy more boxes of soap, sugar, cooking oil, flour and rice. Her major business challenges include transportation and electricity. She aspires to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy boxes of soap, sugar, cooking oil, rice and flour.

loans.name: Bishnu

texts.en:
Bishnu is a 31-year-old physically challenged person. He lives with his parents, wife and a child. His wife is a housewife and his child is attending school. 

He has been running a betel/variety shop in his village located in the state of Odisha, India, for the past seven years. He sells betel, biscuits, toffees, wafers and tobacco sachets in his shop. He earns 5,000 INR per month from his shop.

He has a plan to make his shop bigger and add some more stock of what he sells and other products. He also wants a refrigerator to keep soft drinks and chocolates in his shop.

He has asked for a loan of 20,000 INR for making his shop bigger and purchasing the above mentioned items. He has a dream to allow his child to study in a good school, so that his child can have a bright future.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing betel, biscuits, toffees, wafers, tobacco sachets, etc., and a refrigerator for keeping soda and ice cream for his variety store.

loans.name: Pramod

texts.en:
Pramod is a 32-year-old differently able person living with his parents. 

He owns and manages a tailoring shop in his house. As he was not able to do any kind of work in which more of physical strength is required, he started a tailoring shop in his house five years back. 

He has a plan to enhance his business by adding new sewing machines to his shop, so that he can take more orders from his customers and complete their orders on time. This will help him increase his customer base and monthly income.

Pramod has requested for a loan amount of 25,000 INR for purchasing two sewing machines and fabrics for his shop. He says that he wants to provide his family all the necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase two new sewing machines and fabrics for his tailoring shop.

loans.name: German  Ismael

texts.es: German de 42 años de edad es un señor muy trabajador quien cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales destacando su amabilidad y dedicación al trabajo que realiza, él vive junto a su familia. German se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno el cual posteriormente comercializa, este trabajo lo realiza hace más de 10 años, adquiriendo mucha experiencia en el cuidado de estos animales. Así mismo siembra maíz y frijoles, lo que es un complemento de mucha ayuda para su estabilidad económica. German con el deseo de mejorar sus ventas y su negocio, solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL por medio del cual pueda comprar semillas de granos básicos para sembrar, alimentos y vitaminas para su ganado y de esto modo vender reces más saludables.
texts.en:
German is 42 years old.  He is a hardworking man who has many good personal references that highlight his kindness and dedication to the work he does.  He lives with his family.  German raises cattle and later sells them.  He has done this work for more than ten years and has acquired a lot of experience caring for these animals.  He also plants corn and beans, which is a helpful supplement to his financial stability.  

German wants to increase his sales and expand his business, so he has requested a loan from INTEGRAL to purchase basic grain seeds to plant, as well as feed and vitamins for his cattle so that they will be healthier.

loans.use: to purchase feed for livestock.

loans.name: Santos Angel

texts.es: Santos Angel vive junto a sus tres hijos en casa propia, él trabaja de albañil para diferentes obras de construcción es un trabajo estable y tiene varios años laborando lo que le ha dado experiencia en el rubro convirtiéndose asi en uno de los mejores, obteniendo las mejores ganancias, su trabajo esta ubicado en un lugar accesible y muy cercano a su vivienda; Santos es un hombre entregado a su labor, dispuesto a dar todo de su parte para cumplir sus objetivos lo mas impórtate en su vida es su familia y en las ultimas semanas el deterioro de su vivienda ha incomodado la tranquilidad de su hogar, la casa necesita modificaciones y quiere realizarlas lo mas pronto posible para la seguridad de todos, es un hombre comprometido y no duda que podrá realizar los cambios lo mas pronto posible obteniendo el éxito deseado, necesita invertir pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cemento, ladrillos, piso, herramientas etc. Santos Ángel tiene buenas referencias de pago y se hace responsable de cancelar la deuda, esta agradecido con la ayuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Santos Angel lives with his three children in his own home.  He works as a construction worker doing different types of construction.  It is stable work that he has done for many years, which has given him experience and made him one of the best, which earns him better income.  His work is located in an accessible place close to his home.  Santos is devoted to his work and ready to give his all to meet his objectives.  

The most important thing in his life is his family, and in the last few weeks, the deterioration of his home has disrupted the comfort of their home.  The house needs repairs and he wants to do them as quickly as possible for the safety of his family.  He is committed and knows that he can make the repairs as quickly as possible to achieve his goal.  He needs to invest but he does not have enough capital, so he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to purchase cement, bricks, flooring, and tools.  

Santos Angel has good payment references and he has taken responsibility for repaying the loan.  He is grateful for the help and hopes that he can give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks, flooring, and tools.

loans.name: Melvin Willians

texts.es: Melvin de 35 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa dos hijos y su madre, todos se dedican elaborar artesanías, las cuales son elaboradas de diferentes materiales como barro, pintura entre otras, esto les brinda una gran ayuda ya que es una fuente de ingresos extra. Así mismo Melvin aparte de ser artesano, trabaja como agricultor en su terreno propio, en el que se dedica a sembrar maíz para posteriormente comercializarlo, este es un negocio bastante estable debido a su gran demanda, siendo algo muy positivo para él. Melvin solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para poder comprar implementos necesarios para realizar la siembra del maíz, de modo que pueda obtener más ganancias de su trabajo. Melvin posee una familia muy linda a quien desea darle todo lo mejor.
texts.en: Melvin is 35 years old. He lives together with his wife, two children and his mother. All of them work making handicrafts, which are made out of various materials such as clay, paint, etc. This is a great help to them since it is an extra source of income. At the same time, apart from being an artisan, Melvin works as a farmer on his own land, where he plants corn and later sells it. This is a quite stable business, thanks to high demand, so it is something very positive for him. Melvin is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL so that he can buy tools he needs to plant the corn. In this way, he will be able to obtain more income from his work. Melvin has a very beautiful family, and he wants to give them the best of everything.

loans.use: to buy farming tools.

loans.name: Hulash Ch

texts.en:
Hulash Ch is a 31-year-old physically challenged person living with his parents and his wife. 

He has a variety shop in his village. He has six years of experience in this business. Sometimes his wife helps him in managing the shop. He sells betel, biscuits, pickles, toffees, wafers, spices, lentils, cooking oil, etc., and earns 7,000 INR per month from this business. The total population of his village is about 500, and the people depend on his shop for their household goods. He is not able to meet the growing demand of the present scenario.

There is another betel shop in his village to compete with this shop, so he wants to purchase a variety of stock such as spices, oil, detergents and personal care merchandise like shampoos and toothpaste that he is selling right now and also more variety of chocolates and wafers. 

He has requested a loan of 20,000 INR to add some more stock to his shop.

loans.use: to pay for betel, biscuits, pickles, toffees, wafers, spices, lentils, cooking oil, etc., for his variety store.

loans.name: Ricardo Ovidio

texts.es: Ricardo de 51 años de edad, vive junto a su familia la cual está compuesta por su esposa e hijos. Él trabaja muy duro sembrando rábanos, pepinos, lechuga y maíz, toda el núcleo familiar colabora en sembrar las verduras y así mismo en comercializarlos en el mercado regional de su zona de vivienda. Ricardo tiene la suerte de poseer un terreno plano lo que le permite realizar el riego de forma natural, esto es una enorme ayuda para él. Tanto él como su esposa e hijos desean tener una vida con un futuro mejor es por esto que solicitan un préstamo  INTEGRAL, y poder invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de semillas de maíz, lechuga, rábano y otras hortalizas más y mejorar las ventas, lo cual será una enorme bendición para ellos.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 51 years old and lives with his family, which includes his wife and children.  He works very hard planting radishes, cucumbers, lettuce, and corn.  His whole family works together to plant the vegetables and later sell them at the regional market in the area where they live.  Ricardo is lucky to have flat land, which allows him to use natural irrigation, which is a big help to him. 

He, as well as his wife and children, wants to have a better future, so he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to purchase a larger quantity of corn, lettuce, radish, and other seeds so that he can plant more and improve his sales.  This will be an enormous blessing for them.

loans.use: to purchase lettuce, radish, and other seeds.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married mother of seven children, one of whom goes to school. She also takes care of two additional family members. Ruth resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

For the past 10 years, Ruth has been operating a poultry farming enterprise from home, selling her products on a retail basis seven days a week. She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 1,000,000 from MCDTSACCO to buy more poultry feeds and vaccines. Her major business challenges include transportation and electricity. She aspires to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy poultry feeds and vaccines.

loans.name: Ismael Armando

texts.es: Ismael de 40 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos, y se destacar por ser una persona muy trabajadora y responsable quien trabaja muy duro por salir adelante.  Con el enorme deseo de aumentar su producción de granos básicos Ismael solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de abono, pesticidas y  mayor cantidad de semilla de maíz y frijoles para sembrar, así mismo desea comprar unos depósitos para colocar la cosecha, los cuales funcionan como pequeños graneros de acero inoxidable. Ismael junto a su esposa comercializan los granos básicos en diferentes tiendas y mercados, dándolos a muy buenos precios, con esto Ismael pueda darle una vida estable a su familia.
texts.en:
Ismael, 40, lives together with his wife and children, and is known for being hardworking and responsible, fighting to get ahead in life. With the goal to increase his production of basic grains, Ismael is requesting a loan at INTEGRAL, in order to have enough money to invest in buying compost, pesticides and more corn and beans seeds. In addition, he wants to buy small stainless-steel containers to store the harvest.

Ismael and his wife sell basic grains in different stores and marketplaces, at very good prices. This is how Ismael provides his family with a stable life.

loans.use: to buy supplies and stainless-steel containers to store the harvest.

loans.name: Sarah Group

texts.en:
Sarah group was formed in 2010 and it consists of five women members. These tribal women live in a small village located in Senapati district of Manipur state, which is in the northeastern part of India. Empowering themselves and making contributions to their family incomes by helping one another through a group loan is the theme behind this group.

Sarah is the profile member who is pictured with raised hand. She is 47 years old and a mother to a son and a daughter. Her husband passed away in 2000 due to illness. Since then, she has been the sole breadwinner for the family. Due to financial shortage, she could not afford to continue sending her children to school. Fortunately, she owns a rice mill, which enables her to earn some income with which she managed her family’s daily bread. She also raised some pigs. 

During daytime, she went to work. Before her first loan, even as a woman she took up the work of cutting bamboo and firewood to earn a day’s wage. Though she knew that the nature of her work could have an adverse effect on her health, she had no other options. 

But in order to keep her family running and also to keep herself healthy, she wanted to take up some favorable work by taking a loan. With her first loan, she bought piglets and started raising them. She had only two pigs before the loan. Now she is satisfied and happy to see 15 pigs. She also finds more time to spend with her family and she can keep herself and her family in sound health.
 
She wishes to avail another loan to improve and broaden her piggery farming, which she wants to make her main source of income. Likewise, the rest of the group members need and wish for another loan to do better with their respective income-generating activities.

loans.use: To improve and broaden her pig farming.

loans.name: Alyona

texts.en: Alyona is a farmer who raises vegetables in greenhouses. She used her loan money to buy seeds, greenhouse film, and fertilizers to maintain her greenhouses. This season was a good one for Alyona. She was able to grow a lot of early vegetables and sell them at high prices. Alyona is getting her greenhouses ready for the spring season. She is going to plant tomatoes, potatoes and sweet corn. She is applying for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers, as well as wood for heating.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her greenhouses, as well as wood for heating.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Reyna Isabel vive junto a sus tres hijos en casa propia, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, granos básicos, pan, leche, jabón, entre otros, tiene varios años de trabajar en su negocio y le ha dado muy buenos resultados, está ubicado en un lugar muy estratégico es muy conocida por ser la tienda mas surtida, se ha hecho de mucha clientela que la prefiere porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad y aprecios accesibles además el servicio es excelente; Reyna es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan demostrarse a sí misma que puede llegar al éxito con trabajo duro y dedicación; la demanda ha aumentado por eso necesita invertir más en productos para no decepcionar a los clientes por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, pan, golosinas, producto instantáneo, jabones etc. Reyna Isabel tiene buenas referencias  de pago y es muy responsable tiene la certeza que podrá pagar la deuda y a la vez darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Reyna Isabel lives with her three children in her own house.  She has a store where she sells necessity items such as basic grains, bread, milk, soap, and others.  She has worked at this business for many years and it has given her good results.  It is located in a strategic location and is known for being the best stocked store.  She has many customers who prefer her store because it always has what they need with quality products at accessible prices and excellent service.   

Reyna is an enterprising woman with a desire to succeed.  She is always looking for new opportunities to prove that she can succeed with hard work and dedication.  Demand has increased at her store, so she needs to invest in more products so that she doesn't disappoint her customers.  In order to do this, she has requested a loan from INTEGRAL to purchase basic grains, bread, sweets, instant products, soaps, and other items.  

Reyna Isabel has good payment references and is very responsible.  She is certain she will be able to repay the loan and at the same time give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, bread, sweets, instant products, and soaps.

loans.name: Thambou Group

texts.en:
Thambou Group has five members belonging to the Non-Tribal community residing in a small village. The village is about 65 kilometres from Imphal, capital of Manipur, which is one of the seven states in the northeastern part of India. These women members are hard-working and tolerant. In the long run, since one alone cannot bring about sustainability, they have come together to find a way by helping one another.

Bebem is the profiled member of the group, posing with her right hand raised in the picture. She is only 25 years old and she is still a bachelorette. Her father passed away in August, 2012. She is now living with her mother alone. Apart from being a hard-working woman, she is also gifted with the quality of leadership. Socially, she is involved as one of the leaders among the younger generation in her locality.

By profession, she is a local wine brewer. This local wine is prepared from rice and locally made yeast. In a day, she is able to produce 30 to 40 litres of it. The quality of the wine depends much on the weather condition and seasons. When these factors are favourable, demand is higher and she can even produce more. There are about six to seven places where she supplies her product. She is assisted by her mother alone. Whatever profit that is made, is being used for the family.

Now she feels that it is time that she got married. But due to the poor financial condition that she and her mother are in, she cannot take that step. So she plans to raise her earnings by increasing the quantity of her product and finding more places she can supply.

Most of the members of the group brew wine while some are engaged in tailoring.

loans.use: To buy rice, firewood and yeast for brewing local wine

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo

texts.es: Carlos de 42 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa, sus hijos y sus padres. Carlos posee una parcela en la que se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, lo cual posteriormente comercializa en diferentes lugares de distribución de granos básicos. Él desea aumentar su cosecha por lo  que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda comprar pesticidas, abono, arados y semillas de maíz y maicillo. El mayor deseo de Carlos es mejorar grandemente su negocio, aumentar la cantidad de clientes, vender en más lugares y de esta manera mejorar sus ganancias. Carlos desea darle lo mejor siempre a su familia es por esto que deposita sus esperanzas en el préstamo otorgado deseando  mejorar su economía.
texts.en:
Carlos, 42, lives with his wife, children and parents. Carlos owns a plot of land where he grows corn and sorghum, which he then sells in different places that distribute basic grain.

He hopes to increase his harvest, which is why he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL, with which he would be able to buy pesticide, fertilizer, plows and corn and sorghum seeds.

The biggest wish Carlos has is to greatly improve his business, increase the quantity of clients, sell in more places and in this way improve his earnings. Carlos wishes to always give the best to his family and that is why he places his hope in the loan to be granted, desiring to improve his finances.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and fertilizer for crops

loans.name: Lamyanba Group

texts.en:
Lamyanba Group was formed in 2010. There are five members, all married women hailing from the same village  located in Sadar Hills, Manipur which is one of the states in North East India. The group was formed by like-minded and hard-working women members who want to come together, help one another, and collectively bring about some means to minimize their financial problems.

Ranjana is the profiled member, seen in the picture with her hand raised. She is 32 and a mother to a son and a daughter. Her children are school-going and her only wish is that she can keep them going, though her family is burdened with many financial problems. Her husband is a mason and he works on a daily basis with a petty wage. With such earning, she knows that she cannot keep the family going on for long. This is the point where she has decided to set herself to finding a way to sustain her family.

In 2011, she received the first loan. She utilised the loan in buying chicks and started poultry farming. She was successful somehow but due to frequent road blockades and state related problems, it was quite difficult to get poultry feed in time. On the other hand, she has an embroidery machine but not the materials required. So she has decided to start embroidery, utilising the second loan for buying said materials.

Likewise, the other members of the group are engaged in embroidery and weaving.

loans.use: To buy thread in different colours and textures, needles, and design materials for embroidery

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is a farmer who raises vegetables in greenhouses. Natalia invested her loan money to purchase seedlings, as well as plastic film for her greenhouses. It enabled her to have a good harvest, and she managed to accumulate enough profit to pay back her loan in advance and to provide for her family.

Last fall, Natalia's daughter broke her shoulder. The doctors had to do several surgeries to restore the bones. Natalia spent a lot of money for her daughter's treatment and now needs funding to get her business ready for the coming season. Natalia needs to purchase seeds, plastic film and coal for heating. She hopes to raise good crops and make enough money to care for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, film for covering and coal for heating her greenhouse

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a 45-year-old government employee who works as an accountant in a local government. This mother to three children is married and lives in Kagadi, Uganda. She has been in this profession for 20 years. She was inspired to the profession by the need to earn a living. Christine intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her three children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her three children.

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en:
Evelyne lives in Masindi, Uganda .She is married and charged with the responsibility of looking after four of her children. She operates a retail shop and also has rental houses where she earns extra income. She ventured into business after realizing that her husband's wages could not meet the family's basic needs. She faces a challenge of price fluctuation and  inflation while her dreams are to own a wholesale shop and buy a plot of land.

Evelyne intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as salt and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as salt and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Marcela  Emperatriz

texts.es: Marcela de 36 años de edad, es una mujer muy humilde y responsable, quien trabaja muy duro por sacar adelante a sus tres hijos, ella es una madre soltera que debido a las circunstancias debe trabajar arduamente  para poder contar con el sustento diario. Marcela  se dedica a la crianza de gallinas indias que posteriormente comercializa. Así mismo se dedica a la pesca artesanal, lo cual es una actividad  bastante pesada pero a pesar de esto Marcela lucha por pescar la mayor cantidad de mariscos para poder venderlos con  personas de las zonas cercanas. Ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para poder comprar gallinas, maicillo y concentrado para alimentarlas,   comprara nuevas redes y materia prima para realizar la pesca artesanal, lo que le brindar paz y tranquilidad pues confía en mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Marcela, 36, is a humble and responsible woman, who works hard to get ahead in life with her three children. She is a single mother that, due to some difficulties, had to work hard in order to bring food to her family’s table. 

Marcela raises Indian hens and sells them. She also fishes in a traditional way, which is a difficult activity. However, Marcela tries hard in order to catch the largest amount of seafood and sell it to local people.

Marcela is requesting a loan at INTEGRAL to buy hens, and corn and other types of feed for them. She will also buy nets and traditional materials for her fishing activities. All this will make her feel good, since she is sure that her profits will increase.

loans.use: to buy hens and feed, and supplies for her fishing activities.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a 46-year-old married man with six children living in Kagadi, Uganda. He is employed by the local government as a police officer, the profession he has carried on for a period of 22 years. He was inspired to join the police profession by his limited resources in that it is the only course he could afford to pay for. He faces a challenge of being paid a low salary which can hardly meet the basic needs of his family.

Joel is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his children since the new term has already begun.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is a 34-year-old married man with three children living in Masindi, Uganda. He operates a retail shop which he started five years ago and with the proceeds he has been able to pay school fees for his children and buy land. He faces a challenge of price fluctuations while his dream is to educate his children to attain degrees as minimum qualification and to own a wholesale shop. Joel is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise such as salt and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as salt and soap to sell.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred is a 35-year-old married man with four children living in Kagadi, Uganda. He runs a retail business which has been in operation for a period of two years. He does agriculture from which he earns income to supplement the income from the business he runs. He would like to complete the commercial building which he started  and own a wholesale shop despite inadequate capital. John intends to use the loan to buy water, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy water, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is a 40-year-old married man with seven children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He generates income from local brew selling alongside being a motorcyclist, a business which he has been operating for six years. He accumulated capital from motorcycle transport and farming. He has a challenge of customers not paying on time and inadequate capital to meet the customers’ demand. 

Justus has a personal goal of educating his children and building a residential dwelling as well as a business goal of expanding his business to open up other outlets. Justus intends to use the loan to buy local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy local brew to sell.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es: Máxima vive junto a su vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo en casa del hermano; ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, huevos, leche, jabón entre otros, tiene varios años de tener el negocio y le ha dado muy buenos resultados, está ubicado en una zona muy estratégica donde circulan muchas personas, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas prefieren su tienda porque es la más surtida siempre tiene los que ellos necesitan con producto de calidad y a precios accesibles además se caracteriza por su amabilidad siempre está a la orden de la clientela; Máxima es una mujer emprendedora, comprometida y muy entusiasta de salir adelante, siempre está en búsqueda de oportunidades que le den el paso al éxito porque solo asi encontrara un futuro mas prospero, en esta ocasión quiere acrecentar el negocio pero necesita de capital para invertir en los insumos por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, productos instantáneo, golosinas, bebidas, jabones etc. Máxima tiene capacidad de pago y es muy responsable asegura el pago de la deuda y a la vez confía en que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Máxima lives with her life partner and son in her brother's house. She has a store where she sells convenience store items, beans, eggs, milk, soap, and other things. She has had this business for several years and it has had very good results. It is located in a very strategic area where many people circulate. She has established a large clientele because people prefer her store since it is the most stocked and always has what people need, with quality products and accessible prices. She is characterized by her friendliness, and she is always available to her clients. 

Máxima is an entrepreneurial and committed woman who is very enthusiastic about getting ahead. She is always searching for opportunities that will lead her to the path to success because that is the only way she will find a more prosperous future. 

On this occasion, she wants to expand her business but she needs capital to invest in supplies. For that reason she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will will allow her to buy basic grains, instant products, candy, beverages, soaps, etc. Máxima has the ability to pay and is very responsible. She is sure she will pay off her debt and also trusts that it will bring her home economic security.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, instant products, candy, beverages, soaps

loans.name: Jaime Wilfredo

texts.es: Jaime de 24 años de edad, es un joven padre responsable y trabajador, vive junto a su esposa e hijos. Jaime posee ganado al que cría para poder producir y vender leche, así mismo siembra maíz, frijoles y maicillo en su parcela. También para poder obtener más ganancias, Jaime trabaja como jornalero cuidando los cultivos de otras personas. Él solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, y de esta forma comprar alimento, vitamina y desparasitantes y así brindarles todos los cuidados necesarios a sus vacas y de este modo producir mejor leche. También comprará semillas para sembrar y luego vender con distintos clientes.  De esta forma Jaime tendrá una mejor vida para él y su familia.
texts.en: 24 year-old Jaime is responsible and hard-working young father, he lives with his wife and children. Jaime has livestock that he raises in order to produce and sell milk. He also grows corn, beans and sorghum on his plot of land. Also, in order to earn more, Jaime works as a day laborer caring for the crops of others. He is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL in order to buy feed, vitamins and deworming medication so that he can properly care for his cows and produce better milk. He will also buy seeds to plant and later sell to different clients. In this way Jaime will have a better life for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins for cattle and seeds to plant.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a married woman with three children, ages seven, four and three, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a very hardworking woman who is involved in a number of businesses such as a salon and having a motorcycle to earn a salary. With the proceeds she has been able to buy land and pay school fees for her children. Janet uses a hired rider who remits 80% of the daily earnings. Her challenges are bad roads and mechanical breakdowns, while her dream is to own a taxi. Janet intends to use the loan to repair the motorcycle.

loans.use: to repair the motorcycle.

loans.name: Silver

texts.en: Silver is a 39-year-old married man with three children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has been a teacher for 10 years and he works eight hours a day. Silver was inspired to join the service because of the love for the job. He has a dream of educating his children up to the university despite the low pay. Silver intends to use the facility to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Edson

texts.en: Edson is a 33-year-old married man with two children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has been an enrolled nurse for nine years. He was inspired to join this service because he has the love to save lives. He hopes to go for further studies, educate his children and buy land for farming. He is challenged by lack of medicine at the health center, hence hindering his work, and high transport. The purpose of the loan is to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Costatine

texts.en: Costatine is a 24-year-old single man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has been a teacher and was inspired into service by his parents. He is challenged by low salary and the long distance to the work place, while his dream is to buy land and venture into commercialized agriculture. Costatine intends to use the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Roland

texts.en: Roland is a 25-year-old married man with one year old child living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has been an education assistant for one year and works four hours a day. He has realized that the meager salary he earns on a monthly basis can not ably meet his family's basic needs and he now wants to venture into retail business. Roland is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise such as salt and paraffin to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as salt and paraffin to sell.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice is a 37-year-old widow with four children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda who also cares for two orphans for her brother. She is a primary-school teacher, and she also grows crops and she sells the surplus. She is faced with the challenge of a low salary, due to the poor payment structure in her country, while she dreams of educating her children and venturing into modern farming methods. Joice is applying for a loan to pay school fees for one of her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy retail stock, including wood, paint and nails, for her hardware store.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en: Geofrey, a hard-working 27-year-old married man, lives in Kyenjojo–Uganda with his three children. He is involved in the transport business, with a year of experience as a taxi driver. He started as a hired driver and now has bought his own taxi, paying half of the money with his personal savings. He has problems of bad roads and vehicle breakdowns leading to high repair costs, as well as high fuel and transportation costs. He has a personal goal of building a permanent house and a business goal of expanding his business into new market areas. Geofrey is applying for the loan to complete paying for the car.

loans.use: to complete the payments for his taxi.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred is a hard-working 53-year-old married man who lives in Kyenjojo-Uganda. He has five children, all of whom attend school He acquired his start-up capital from rental income. He opened a retail shop where he sells general merchandise to the people in his village and the surrounding areas. Fred is a very honest businessman but is challenged by inadequate capital and price fluctuations due to inflation, which lead to high prices for commodities. In the future, he wants to become a wholesaler and open up new outlets in the nearby urban centers. Fred is applying for the loan to purchase sugar, soap, rice, salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, soap, rice, salt and cooking oil to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Santa

texts.en:
Santa lives in the Likoni area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has one child. She owns a retail shop, a broom-selling business, which has been running for three years. She obtained the capital to start the business by performing manual jobs.
She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are high transport costs and inflation. Santa is applying for a loan of 21,050 KES to buy more brooms to sell. The extra income she earns with the loan will be added to her savings to improve her family’s living standards and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more brooms to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Rosenda Candelaria

texts.es: Rosenda Candelaria vive junto a su hijo y su madre en casa propia; ella se dedica a la venta de mariscos cangrejos, camarones, pescado entre otros, tiene varios años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en la venta que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicado en un lugar que califico como muy bueno su negocio es un lugar estratégico porque por ahí circulan muchas personas, es muy conocida en la zona pues sus mariscos son de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio es excelente; Rosenda es una mujer emprendedora, con muchas metas por alcanzar, trabaja a diario para ganarse el pan de cada día y sabe que con esfuerzo y dedicación logrará el éxito, en los últimos meses aumento la demanda el doble y eso la impulso para hacer crecer el pequeños negocio  necesita invertir en insumos pero no posee de capital suficiente por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar mariscos por mayor etc. Rosenda Candelaria tiene capacidad crediticia y una moral impecable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosenda Candelaria lives with her son and her mother in her own home. She makes a living selling seafood, such as crabs, shrimp, and fish, among others.
